descriptions.overview: PremiumÂ mulch comes in three different colors: red, brown and black.
list: Gives any landscape a finished look and feel
Controls moisture to help reduce water use and regulates soil temperature
Product is available in 3 colors: black, red, brown

specs.title: Bag Capacity Quantity by Dry Volume
Shipping Option
specs.spec: Buy online pick up in store

reviews.title: "Hope you've had your tetanus shot!"
reviews.text: We bought 130 bags of this black mulch and it's complete garbage. There's nothing premium about this mulch, except the price. Here's what we found in our "premium" mulch- fungus, plastic, fiberboard, painted wood, rocks, rusty nails, and other debris. Need parts for a Nerf gun? We got it. Need rocks to go with your mulch? We got it! Need painted wood? Sure, we've got it. What about un-dyed pieces of scrap? You guessed it, we got that too!Thinking about buying this product? Well, I hope you've had your tetanus shot! I found plenty of rusty nails that could have sent me to urgent care. I laid all the mulch down by hand and it was like handling hazmat. I don't know how they can sell this junk legally? It's like they didn't care what they shredded and sold. I had one weekend to get all my mulch down with the weather and I took my chances with this product. Although I read bad reviews, I thought these were isolated cases. After laying down 130 bags, sourced from varying pallets, I learned my lesson the hard way. It wasn't a one-off experience. This product is just plain filthy junk. *Please view the pictures of some of my finds.
reviews.author: Stoked-On-Spokes

reviews.title: "Brown bags with black mulch"
reviews.text: I bought 41 bags of Dark Brown mulch, When I started spreading, first bag has brown mulch, the second bag has black mulch, I was upset, i don;t know what to do with all the bags. But kept spreading all the 41 bags of dark brown mulch, at least 15 bags are black mulch. I am very disappointed, I made sure, all the plastics bags are brown. Some bags are really wet with color leaking from bags.
reviews.author: omkar

reviews.title: "VERY Disappointed. Mold and Mildew"
reviews.text: Yes, this product is easy to apply because its in a bag. What mulch wouldn't be when its in a bag. A few months ago, against my better judgment I purchased about 25 more bags for the flower bed. It looks good until that one time when you perhaps pull a weed or do whatever to turn the mulch over. I was extremely disappointed when AGAIN, I see white mold and mildew. Sure, it cant be seen from the road, but when you get up close, a few feet away, you can see where everything under the first layer has turned white with mold and mildew. This mulch is in a couple different locations. Front of the house where there sun all day, and around the corner where there is sun most of the day, or morning and early afternoon. What I had purchased last year also had turned white. Actually I should have known better when I saw it in the bag. Yes, black mulch and red, had white mold in the bag. I thought it was something that would come off but it doesn't. Do yourself a favor if you really want a nice looking flower bed. Purchased something that is guaranteed not to mold or mildew. This looks awful....
reviews.author: mark6147

reviews.title: "DO NOT buy if you want color"
reviews.text: We were suspicious right out of the bag. Looked like the color was already partially gone. We are senior citizens and did not want to load it up and take 30 bags back! Hoping for the best, we spread it out . Can't tell the difference from what we put out a year and a half ago. And seems to still be losing color. BIG, big disappointment!! Would like to get our money back or at least be given bags that have color. Don't know how to get a refund at this point.So, I guess all we say is, "Be very careful that you get bags with good color saturation." And if anyone knows how we can get our money back, please let us know. Pics attached.
reviews.author: Robert

reviews.title: "Mixed quality, beware before buying"
reviews.text: Purchased 12 bags, 9 which were very good, but 3 were junk. Would recommend that if you purchase this product, that you load the bags yourself, and pick out by feel as to quality. Of the bags purchased, 9 were soft to the touch & excellent , the junk ones were actually chunky and looked like chopped up pallets. See attached photos
reviews.author: Ctl

reviews.title: "MOLD!!"
reviews.text: ThisI did a review awhile back of the poor quality of this mulch appearance-wise. It had a lot of scrap lumber and pine needles(?) - neither absorbed the black dye. But it is WAY worse than that. Some of the 40-50 bags I bought had mold - a small amount immediately obvious. I knew it was the mulch because I had a couple bags left over and later opened them to find raging mold) I soon had a blanket of white-yellow mold covering the entire front & back yard landscaping.Plants died, flowers didn't bloom, and fruit production was scarce. It took a TON of time and back breaking work to scrape that gooey stuff from my entire property. I then had to treat the soil, plants, etc. It took months. EXPENSIVE!! I still have to get new ground cover and apply it. My yard has looked like crap for a long time. I work really hard to have a nice yard I can enjoy ... all for nothing. They should call this stuff "Mold by the Bag".
reviews.author: Leadfoot350

reviews.title: "All 15 bags were good to go..."
reviews.text:
I actually read the reviews as I was waiting in line to pay for some, so I thought I'd just get 5 bags to see if they're OK or not before buying any more. It's on sale so at $2 a bag how could I go wrong?

The first 5 were all OK, pretty fine and uniform, with no scrap lumber, big chunks, termites, dead animals or wet dripping messes as some have reported.

Just plain old mulch which looks good to me and spread like any mulch did before. So my 15 bags were all good to go, seem high quality to me. Whether the brown stays a year as they guarantee, we'll see.

I suspect a lot of problems reported are due to storage issues at the store or manufacturer, outside in the rain or for periods of time which allows water or insects to get into the bags. The bags I loaded into my car were on pallets, wrapped in plastic, which could only help to protect the mulch.

I'd say more but what more can you say about mulch?
reviews.author: OutdoorCook

reviews.title: "Best bang for your buck"
reviews.text: We ordered 2 pallets of mulch for our entire front yard in black initially.  Based on reviews, the black faded to a "dark brown" color.  However, when we laid one bag of black on the ground, it was BLACK!  It looked like it was burnt, and living in California, we did not want our front yard to look like it had been on fire.  So we exchanged the black for the brown and we couldn't be happier with the result.  After drying, the color fades from having a slight red/purple tone to a nice pure brown color.  Lowe's was great to work with as far as the exchange process went.  At $2.00 a bag when you catch it on sale, and the ability to have it delivered, it's a great deal!  Other reviews had stated they found a lot of debris in their mulch.  Out of 130 bags, I found one bent nail in one bag.
reviews.author: MomofTrips

reviews.title: "Not Good"
reviews.text: Maybe, if you need to use it for backyard or somewhere no one is going to see, but as for using it in the front yard. No good. The other name for mulch is beauty bark. This stuff is not cut up in uniform like other mulches I have purchased, so it makes for an ugly appearance when it comes to presentation. The only good thing about it was that it was cheap.
reviews.author: Smitty

reviews.title: "Fungus,Color Fade,Shredded & Chipped Mixed Medium"
reviews.text: We had such an expansive area to do that we thought we would give this a try vs our usual pine straw. Not one of our better decisions!!! As we were applying the product we noticed that some of the bags were shredded bark and others were chipped bark... unfortunately we were not able to return ALL the product, so decided to do our best to make it look esthetically pleasing . While it did look nice for the first week or so ~~~~~ we then noticed disgusting fungus looking GROWTHS and pine tree saplings popping up everywhere. Upon much research we learned that this was Slime Mold, which was luckily non-toxic to humans and pets. Now we are faced with these disgusting BLOBS and pulling saplings on a daily basis. I am now also noticing the Slime Mold encroaching on my plantings AND lawn. I am going to be contacting the company as I purchased 135 bags (One whole pallet and an additional purchase of 60 bags... not to mention the delivery) Please do your homework ~ There has to be a better quality controlled product out there. Thanks you!!
reviews.author: AvidGardener

reviews.title: "Guarantee color for 12 months"
reviews.text: Was impressed with the deep, dark brown color of this product, but after first rain, the color had washed off. I do not recommend this product. It's very disappointing for the time and money spent
reviews.author: Jana

reviews.title: "Black? You're kidding me....."
reviews.text: That is the response I got when I bought it for the new home I had just bought. the brick on my home is a burnt reddish/brown and no one could understand why I didn't use brown. i said to be different, I want black and I think it will make the rich texture of the brick stand out. I was right and all the nay sayers who said yuck loved it. My neigherbors even stopped over to tell me how awesome it all looked once I rescaped the design, planted and layed the mulch. The last few owners did nothing to the landscape over several years so this house was a eyesore to the neighbors and the different appearance the black mulch gave the front, side and back of my home was very appealing and applaudable. I am excited this is $2 a bag. I did not get this on sale last year, missed the sale 2x, but this year, I am doubling up on what I bought last year to ensure a rich and appealing look. The black faded al ittle but like someone else said, wet it and keep it moist if you're in a dry area and it will almost refresh/renew itself. I am in MI so we have sporatic weather from hot to cold to wet to hot and humid and the mulch still looked great last fall. Just deciding to clean out the old before I lay the new or just pile it up and over it is the biggest dilemma but I am getting this stuff today and laying it out tomorrow. It's been a long winter and I need the green to look green and the purples, pinks and white plants to look vibrant to make my house look as good as Marth Stewart if not better!
reviews.author: bgill85

reviews.title: "Do not buy!"
reviews.text: This mulch is VERY inconsistent. Our first load was fine (we bought a total of 130 bags, regret that we bought it all and had it home before knowing what most was like). After that, many bags were filled with small, fine white roots from something growing, and the mulch is definitely not at all black. The attached pictures are of the mulch the day we put it down. Again, not black and is already faded looking. We will go back to buying the bulk loose mulch by the truckload where we used to.
reviews.author: RH

reviews.title: "Great Mulch, Great Price"
reviews.text: My families been using this mulch for the last decade or so, every year it's exactly the same.  Good color, no trash, no rocks, great value.  Just bought and laid 15 bags, going to get thirty more to finish the front beds.  Look like any product check before you buy, look at it, smell it, move it around...its in a clear bag for goodness sake!  If it doesnt look right get another bag.  Anyhoo, enjoy!
reviews.author: Ladya

reviews.title: "Quality is falling."
reviews.text: Purchased over 100 bags last year and it was some of the nicest mulch I have ever had. Purchased over 100 bags again this year and was the worst mulch I have ever seen. Color was mismatched from many bags, found glass and rusty nails in some bags, several pieces of what appears to be press board in the size of maybe 2 inched by 4 inches. Probably will not consider the purchase of this brand again.
reviews.author: firstchance1

reviews.title: "Nothing but excellent looking mulch here!"
reviews.text: I was extremely worrried about the bad reviews here but was relieved to open the bags to find beautiful looking mulch. Time will tell how it holds up.
reviews.author: GJR

reviews.title: "MOLD!!"
reviews.text: I did a review awhile ago about the poor quality of this mulch appearance-wise
reviews.author: Leadfoot350

reviews.title: "Think twice before using"
reviews.text: I have used this mulch in the past around my trees and was very pleased. I was happy to see it on sale, so I figured it would be a good time to redo the flower beds. What a mistake. As I began working on the project, it seemed each bag kept getting worse. Some of the mulch was discolored with white speckles; I don't know if it was mold or what it was. I also found huge "planks" of wood in the bags and even what appears to be an aluminum can. I guess the manufacturer and I have different definitions for the word premium.
reviews.author: creative1

reviews.title: "Beware - Full of mold and rot"
reviews.text: Bought 10 bags. Out of the 10 bags, 8 of them were full of yellow and white mold and rot. Absolute garbage product.
reviews.author: MikeM

reviews.title: "Total garbage. Turned white / gray after a weekend"
reviews.text: Total garbage. Turned white / gray after a weekend
reviews.author: DisappointedOne

reviews.title: "Great Mulch"
reviews.text: I have relied on this brand of mulch every year for my landscaping projects since 2012. I have never had to reapply and the color maintains it vibrance for the entire year.
reviews.author: Gardengirl

reviews.title: "Pure plant poison.  Do not use !!!"
reviews.text: I used 20 bags of this Premium mulch and 20 bags of Scotts Nature Scapes mulch for a renewed garden.  Results: $750 dead new roses, existing roses killed. $250 perennials killed.  As effective an herbicide as Round-Up or even paraquat.  Now I have to scrape this off my 500 sq ft entire garden and then I don't know if the herbicidal effect will persist such that I have to replace the soil.  What a mess. I will pursue a small claims case.
reviews.author: Kevin

reviews.title: "Nothing but a bag of sticks"
reviews.text: I strongly DO NOT recommend this product. I purchased $100 worth of this mulch and I it was faded and more sticks than mulch. I also found half of a rubber ball and plastic tubing in a couple of bags. In addition, about 15 of the bags had white mold growing on the mulch.I emailed the manufacturer and attached the photo's shown and they refunded my money.Buyer beware!
reviews.author: Timkay2

reviews.title: "Hit and miss"
reviews.text: I purchased 30 bags last year. Exfellent product I no problems at all. The color lasted all summer and into the fall. I decided to buy it again this year, same brand, same logo on the bags but completely different product inside the bag this year. When I opened the bags the mulch was wet and stickey. The color started fading after a week, it turned grey. The mulch had mold and it spread onto my flowers and roses right after putting it down. My perennials were there for 3 years, now I lost a lot of them even after using neem oil to control it. I'm not sure I will buy this again, maybe 2 bags at a time to test it first, definitely not 30 again.
reviews.author: AmateurDIYer

reviews.title: "Cheap and effective mulch."
reviews.text: Boughr 20 bags and have used this mulch for three consecutive years will say this year's batch definitely was closer to "premium" as the name suggests compared to recent years. All the mulch had good color and was shredded similarly to the Scott's shredded mulch (which is more then double the price for .5 cu/yd less).  No garbage in any of the bags or mold. I expect the color to fade but didn't listen to older review stating to put it down when there is no rain in forecast for at least 48-72 hours so will see if that helps. Compares identically to Scott's Earthgro mulch. Can't beat the 5 for $10 deal!
reviews.author: Liquorish

reviews.title: "Faded drastically after laying down"
reviews.text: Bought 40 bags to do my entire front yard.  The laid easily and spread easily with plenty of coverage.  Looked great when I was done.  The next day the color had faded drastically. It is no longer black. It looks grey and old like it has been there for several months.  Will not buy it again.  Pictures show how much it faded so far in less than a week.
reviews.author: Jorge

reviews.title: "Two different color brown mulches"
reviews.text: Cary, NC location. There are two different colored brown mulches with the same Item number and UPC. Look at the color of the bags; one is a darker (Chocolate) color than the other one (Reddish) and so are the mulches. If you need to spruce up your mulch or spreading mulch, verify the colors first. Make sure you get the same color, unless you are going for a mixed look. Some employees know of the problem and others do not. The employee that was helping customers said they were not different and you need to get bags from the same pallet. I understand dye colors may change from different batches, but the bag color being different? They should be separated, since one is a dark brown and the other is lighter.
reviews.author: DuaneM

reviews.title: "Can't beat it for the price! Nice color and size."
reviews.text: After reading the reviews I was scared to buy it, however I had no issues. No trash or debris, Brown color as advertised, even after being sprayed with water. Pretty uniform sizes, no insects,mold, etc. On sale during Memorial day for two bucks a bag. Very satisfied and an excellent deal. I live in the Southern Nevada desert, not to much of a chance of termites, mold, etc in our heat. I picked it up for moisture retention in the soil and to prevent weeds.
reviews.author: Turborich

reviews.title: "MULCH BLACK-MAKE SURE NO RAIN FOR 24-48 HRS"
reviews.text: I bought another 60 bags of the black mulch on 6 Sep 2017.  (I bought 60 bags last labor day in 2016). I have not had the problems that some of Lowe's customers have complained about. The most important thing one must do is not apply the mulch if rain is forecasted in 24-48 hours. The mulch needs to dry, otherwise the color will bleed. The cost works out to $27.00/for a cubic yard.  I'm 72 years old and do all my own yard work.  I'm just trying to pass on some advice that I have found to be helpful regarding this mulch. The mulch usually lasts for several years.  Overall I am satisfied with the mulch. I live in Southwest Ohio, and I have no connection with Lowes.  Regards Tom
reviews.author: Tigertom

reviews.title: "Don't buy this mulch!!!"
reviews.text: I decided to change the look of my yard this year and purchased the black much instead of the brown...this was a BIG mistake!! After I cleared out all the brown and started spreading the black I found rocks and plastic..I can deal with that. However, a few days after I put the mulch out it rained and washed the black off the mulch...now Lowes did offer to refund my money for the mulch, but I purchased 40 bags, that's a lot to take up and replace..so just beware of the black...now I purchased the mulch on 4.11.18
reviews.author: jmevrn9

reviews.title: "If You Buy this Mulch, Keep Your Bags for a Refund"
reviews.text: I read the reviews on this mulch, but decided to try a test of 5 bags before I purchased the 100 bags I need for my landscaping. I applied the mulch at 9:30 am yesterday and it rained all day. When I looked at it at 8:00pm, it was not black it was brown!! Since the mulch has a 12 month color guarantee and the color didn't last for 12 hours, I took my receipt back to the store today to get my refund. I was told that I needed the empty bags in order to get a refund. Of course, the trash men have already come and the bags are long gone. I'm glad I didn't waste too much money and energy with this inferior mulch with a secret requirement that prohibits a refund.
reviews.author: Unsatisfied-Landscaper

reviews.title: "faded after first day"
reviews.text: Put the mulch down on a Sunday by Monday afternoon the color had faded and completly washed off on some pieces. Very disapointed in this product. Lowes told us the directions for this mulch are that it has to he kept dry?? That is not stated anywhere on the bag. I don't even want to give this one star.
reviews.author: Diana

reviews.title: "Premium 2-cu ft Black Hardwood Mulch"
reviews.text: I have bought this brand of mulch for several years.  I am happy with the look.  A few things to remember.  Don't put the mulch down if rain is forecasted for the next 24-48 hours.  The mulch needs to dry thoroughly.  I clean the beds of weeds first, then lay newspaper down 7 sheets, before applying the mulch.  I usually lay 2-3 inches of mulch on top of the newspaper for a good covering. This procedure really keeps the weeds down.  I used 60 bags last year, and just bought another 60 bags this week.  13.5 bags equal a cubic yard.  So $27.00/ cubic yard.  The mulch from last year is holding its color ok.  I hope this helps somebody. I live in Dayton, OH. Best Wishes.
reviews.author: Tigertom73

reviews.title: "Great stuff"
reviews.text: I've used this mulch for several years and have had no problems with fungus, or fading. It's not triple shreaded, so there are small chunks of wood mingled in the mixture. It covers well and hold moisture as it should.
reviews.author: Don

reviews.title: "This junk is NOT mulch"
reviews.text: This is not mulch. It is ground up construction debris and it looks terrible. Chunks of particle board, bamboo, and other unrecognizable wood. Do yourself a favor and buy your mulch from a garden center, its not that much more expensive. I bought 40 bags, put down half of them around the back of my house and then I retuned the other half and got 2 yds delivered from a local garden center for what turned out to be only $5 more per yard. Thank God I decide to do the back half of my yard first. Looking at the two different mulches side by side is unbelievable. Luckily, I got enough of the REAL mulch that I will be able to put a thin layer of it over this "Premium" junk.
reviews.author: Danny

reviews.title: "Dead grass"
reviews.text: Days after I laid one bag, the grass along the edge that I laid it started to die. A trail of grass continued to die over the weeks to follow. We have had lots of rain this summer and the dead grass is patterned along the rain drainage route. Makes me sick to look at it. Lowe's claims that the product is chemical free, etc., but I am not convinced. Something in this mulch has spread along the rain drainage route to kill my healthy grass. From reading the other reviews, you don't know what is mixed in this mulch. I suggest sticking to a higher grade of mulch. Guess I'm stuck with removing the mulch and reseeding my lawn.
reviews.author: SMAP

reviews.title: "Good for the price!"
reviews.text: I read all the reviews, and was weary of purchasing this mulch to lay in my beds I had worked so hard to build this last summer. However, with the lack of funds to buy anything else, I decided to try it out! I laid newspaper down, beforehand, then this mulch atop, staying away from each plant by about 3 inches. I haven't found any discoloration yet, (it's been about a month), and there have been major downpours in the meantime! I did find that there were some rocks, and a couple of larger pieces of "log/twigs" that were included inside, but it actually doesn't matter to me, as long as it covers the appropriate amount of area. And doesn't kill my plants! Which they are looking great!I got these bags on sale at $2/bag, so I wasn't expecting much! It's exceeded my expectations.
reviews.author: MrsJ

reviews.title: "Premium Black Hardwood Mulch"
reviews.text: For the past couple of years, i purchased vigoro black hardwood mulch from a Lowe's competitor. Very chunky, uneven color and faded quickly. This year, i purchased triple processed mulch from a local nursery at $4.99/bag. Beautiful, spread well and my front yard beds looks fantastic. Back yard, another story. Since Lowe's was offering their premium mulch for $2/bag I decided to give it a try. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the mulch I purchased! Nearly the same as the Scotts brand that i purchased for more than double at another competitor. I will definitely use Lowe's premium mulch next year for all of my beds. Great product, greater value.
reviews.author: Cathe

reviews.title: "Worst Product ever and Lowes shouldn't sell this"
reviews.text: I brought over 30 bags of this mulch and it does not live up to its name about the 12 month gaurentee and I had to throw away 17 brand new never opened bags because hey all turned to Mold a few weeks later and mind you they were kept in the garage. Lowes shouldn't associate itself with this company and I did not bring it back to my Lowes in Bartonsville,Pa because they have always treated any problem I have had with Excellent Service and I know its not their fault if the bag turns to mold and pure yellow without any of them being open. I lost money on this product - NOT WORTH A PENNY . I am not a gardner but I know when I ended up with a lousy product
reviews.author: Ruben

reviews.title: "False Advertising"
reviews.text: My husband and I bought 30 bags for our landscape. Immediately after placing it, it had a dark rich color. We still needed to get a few more plants so we didnt finish the project right away. Exactly 6 days later, we placed the rest of the mulch. The first mulch application had already faded so bad it looked terrible. Not to mention the mulch was mixed with some plastics as well. "12 month guarantee"- what am I supposed to do with that? Shovel this shotty mulch back up in my truck for a refund? Not happening. Buyer beware.
reviews.author: Katie

reviews.title: "great product"
reviews.text: We mulched our entire yard to avoid having to ever cut grass again. We have used several different types of mulch over the last decade,that we have been less than happy with. We started using the brown Lowe's mulch 2 years ago and we love it. We buy 10 bags at a time only when they are on sale, so it has taken quite a while to finish the job. The brown mulch we bought to finish our yard this week matches the same brown mulch installed 2 years ago. In addition unlike other mulch we have used this mulch does not wash away in the strong rain storms we get here in the mountains of western MD. The sale price of 5 bags for $10.00 can not be beat.
reviews.author: Zelda

reviews.title: "Terrible Mulch"
reviews.text: I purchased 28 bags of this "brown" mulch and the color was very inconsistent. Of the 28 bags, there were 3 different shades, regular brown...very dark brown (almost black)...and reddish brown. My guess is they don't clean out the equipment that they use to mix in the die. Also, a good portion of the bags I purchased were moldy. Again, I do not recommend purchasing this mulch. I subsequently purchased Scotts mulch from Home Depot and the color was very uniform with no mold whatsoever.
reviews.author: megaman

reviews.title: "15 of the 15 bags purchased had mold."
reviews.text: I purchased on 4/2/2017. Every bag had mold in the mulch. do not recommend.
reviews.author: judy

reviews.title: "Do NOT buy"
reviews.text: We decided to put new mulch down, so went and bought this mulch on sale. Usually buy Scott's, we didn't this time. We learned a HARD lesson! We now have several types of spiders we didn't ever have before and they are aggressive! I noticed an odor coming from the flower beds like a mixture of poo and vomit and something dead, then the flies started. After using a whole can of fly spray, we still have tons of flies around the plants. We never could get rid of the foul odor. Raked it all out and now have nothing in the beds, yet. No odor, now, still have the spiders. The consistency of the mulch is large pieces and looked awful!
reviews.author: jangawhite

reviews.title: "May 2018 Review"
reviews.text: Past reviews had us concerned, but it seemed all the bagged mulches at most big box stores had lousy reviews. Many of the Lowe's reviews are several years old. We've always used shredded cypress in flower beds away from buildings (rock by buildings). But the environmentalists say that is not a good idea. Mature cypress trees are just not available anymore. So we looked for brown hardwood mulch. Bought a test bag and looked inside. We came back and bought 40 bags for our perennial beds. No trash, not shredded but well chopped, only a couple instances of small amount of white mold. We probably only removed 5-10 larger palm-sized wood chunks and a couple rocks. This mulch was exactly what we wanted. Good color, hope it lasts. Purchased in Sioux Falls, SD. (And at $2 per bag it's hard to beat)
reviews.author: JJ

reviews.title: "Terrible Quality"
reviews.text: I am landscaping a large yard and have bought at least 50 bags of mulch over this past summer.I've bought from(this brand) and from their competition (Vigoro or Scotts?). There is a huge difference in quality. I have one long flower bed that I started spreading mulch using the Scotts and then put out some of this brand just because it was the next bag handy in my 'supply' area. Night and day color and quality. Wow. Disappointing to say the least. Rich black mulch now paired with gray/ashy colored garbage. Thankfully I have a pallet of the better brand. The areas with this will just have to do until next Spring when the yard will need refreshed and I use a different kind. The other reviews mention garbage. I have found lots of odd, plastic pieces throughout. A bigger issue is that there is a white (paint like) substance on a lot of it. I will attach a picture and hope it is clear enough to see the white as well as the general poor quality (Hershey wrapper). Imagine if you spilled white paint on your black mulch and then stirred it up a little. It's very obvious to see and makes the product all the more disappointing. Next year I will pay the extra $1 or so a bag to get a better quality.
reviews.author: Baxter

reviews.title: "Good results"
reviews.text: Purchased 60 bags, 50 on sale. I think Lowe's must purchase this product from multiple sources. This review pertains to North East Ohio. The color was deep as the product was wet when put down. When dry, it did lighten up but was still defiantly black. There was a little mold in some bags but it disappeared when raked out. I compared this to my neighbor; theirs was purchased from a local nursery chain  and private labeled. The primary difference is theirs smelled really bad and cost more. I only found one little piece orange something. So, I am very happily with my purchase, my only regret was I didn't purchase it all on sale.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Color DOES NOT Stay"
reviews.text:
This mulch was on sale for $2/bag in April and I bought 10 bags to cover my flower gardens. It looked great...but wasn't enough, so I bought 10 more! All 20 bags were laid down on April 28th/29th 2016.

Then we had a few days of rain. Now (less than two weeks later - May 12th 2016), the mulch is sort of a gray/tan combination as the color has faded or been washed away. So much for "12 month color guarantee." 

It looks horrible - much worse than just one winter's wear on last year's mulch. I will absolutely have to lay new mulch if I don't want my yard to look like I haven't touched the mulch in several years.
reviews.author: LD189

reviews.title: "Black dye stained my car"
reviews.text: Just bought 15 bags of black mulch at Lowe's in Camden, DE.  Had laid down plastic sheeting in the back of our cream-colored SUV to keep the dirt off.  When we unloaded the mulch, there were puddles of black dye on the plastic sheeting which had dropped on the upholstery, carpeting and plastic in the car.  It is stained.We'll return it tomorrow if we can get someone to pick it up.We've always got our mulch for the same price at Home Depot and this has never happened before.
reviews.author: Pat

reviews.title: "Used to be great, but they changed material"
reviews.text: We have purchased about 50 bags of this mulch over the past 3 months. Prior to the last purchase of 7 bags, the product was great. Had no odor whatsoever, and seemed to have a very slight rubberized coating on it. The last bags we purchased are the material that used to be in clear bags that we stopped purchasing because they always had an extremely strong sour putrid odor that would not go away for several weeks, even with heavy watering. These last 6 bags are that same awful mulch. Our yard now smells horrific after laying a couple of bags. We will be returning the remainder. Do not buy this mulch!
reviews.author: Dawn

reviews.title: "Color still dark brown a year later"
reviews.text: I'm not really sure why some of the other reviewers are saying the color faded the next day but mine has lasted now for an entire year and hasn't faded much at all. Out of the about 250 bags that I've bought over the past year, I've had maybe 3 that were not consistent in color so I think that's a pretty good ratio. My mulch gets a lot of sun throughout the day and we've had plenty of rain over the past year. This is an excellent product especially if you get it on sale for $2.00-$2.50/bag. I have it all the way along the property line landscaping in the back yard and all along the front, back and sides of my home in the bushes. I would highly recommend without a doubt and will continue to use it myself as needed.
reviews.author: jonny

reviews.title: "Quality had decline a lot"
reviews.text: I bought mulch from two different Lowe's in Colorado last year and the brown mulch was fairly uniform fine chips.  The color held up and I was satisfied.In 2016 I bought 80 bags of mulch in Colorado from Lowe's and was disappointed in the poor quality. Over half of the bags had material that should not screened out.  There were fireplace size chunks of wood, a couple of crushed up aluminum cans, crumpled up underware and a shredded T shirt.  One half of all the bags I bought had foreign material.  I suspect that Lowe's uses different supplies in different parts of the country, but whom ever they were using North of Denver was doing a poor job.
reviews.author: JohnWFA

reviews.title: "Poor quality, includes garbage"
reviews.text: This was my first purchase of black mulch. I normally use cypress mulch. This product is hardly mulch. The contents of the bags included rocks, large blocks of wood, chunks of random wood, plastic, wire, foil, nails, cardboard, recycle brown bags, and a little little little amount of true mulch. Oh and several bags were moldy. I am so disappointed that Lowes would buy this GARBAGE that seems like it was pulled from someones recycle day curb, put in a vat of black paint, and put in a bag labeled "mulch". I can't wait for next spring to see how much of this garbage has broken down into the earth....stay tuned....and DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.
reviews.author: Jill

reviews.title: "Great price, color not good like last year!!"
reviews.text: Last summer I bought 25 bags of this same mulch and it was very nice and the color lasted throughout the year. The bags I bought 2 half weeks ago looked good in the bag until I laid all 25 bags and the next day. I looked after the mulch had dried out and the color looked much more faded as what I have left from a year ago. So I'm very disappointed. These bags were on sale for $2.00 a bag so the price was great but the color is very unsatisfactory. I always buy things at Lowes, but I'm not happy about my latest mulch purchase. I'm adding 2 pictures, the first is the mulch I laid last May 2015 and the second pic is what I just bought and laid 2 half weeks ago May 10, 2016 . I would return the mulch, but i have already laid all of the bags. You can see quite a difference.
reviews.author: kincade109

reviews.title: "Weeds I've never had"
reviews.text: I purchased 30 bags at the beginning of the season and even though it's kept it's color in some areas,  not all,  I have these weeds that have overtaken my garden which I've NEVER had,  nor really they anywhere else in my yard,  except where I put this mulch.  It's a blanket kg weeds that never go away.  I've exhausted myself trying to keep up with getting to of these.  Never again!
reviews.author: Nicki

reviews.title: "MOLD MOLD MOLD!!"
reviews.text: Opened on bag and there was SO MUCH MOLD! See attached pic. I will be taking this and the other 15 bags back to Lowes. Makes me mad because now I have to waste part of my Saturday returning this total garbage back to Lowes!!
reviews.author: Kram

reviews.title: "Beautiful, high quality mulch"
reviews.text: After reading several negative reviews, we went to our local Lowe's to check out the mulch before making our purchase. We thought it looked good, so we decided to buy. 223 bags later, we have never seen a better quality, cleaner mulch. Its rich color is so beautiful, and we are such happy, pleased customers. We bought our last mulch from a professional landscape company, and theirs doesn't even come close to the quality of our new mulch. Can't imagine ALL the bad reviews, maybe the mulch comes from different suppliers. Our bags came from Hope, Ark.
reviews.author: Captain

reviews.title: "Dangerous product - could injure kids/adults"
reviews.text: I purchased 50 bags of this mulch to put around my kids playground set, tonight while my kids were getting ready to play we found a piece of wood with two 2 inch rusty nails through it. Now we don't know how we're going to get this all removed and cleaned up so right now my kids new playset if off limits.Bottom line - do not buy and lowes should stop selling this garbage.
reviews.author: Rick

reviews.title: "Worst mulch ever purchased"
reviews.text: My husband and I have purchased mulch for over 22 years and this is by far the worst mulch we have ever purchased!!We purchased 90 bags of this back in March 2016 and within three months noticed the color fading considerably.  The bag clearly states (in 4 places) 12 month color guaranteed!It looks like driftwood in our flower beds.Unfortunately we did NOT read the reviews for this mulch before purchasing (which we normally do) and if we had we never would have purchased as others are dissatisfied with this product also.  The fading is so bad we contacted the company to get a refund.  They told us to go to lowes to get a refund ... So with emails and pictures and our receipts we did and lowes gave us our money back thank you lowes!!!We will never purchase this brand of mulch again.
reviews.author: CK

reviews.title: "No problems with this mulch."
reviews.text: There have been quite a few negative reviews on this mulch. I have purchased this for a few years. Granted, in the past, I have found some "junk" in the mulch, but only a very little. This year (April 2018), I have purchased 50 bags (so far), and all of it has been exceptionally clean. I always get the brown color, avoiding black because it almost always fades, and if I walk on it I have found that the color tracks all over the place. But, so far, I have not had a problem with the brown. It might lighten up a little throughout the summer, but for $2 a bag (on sale), I think it's a good deal.
reviews.author: PattyMW

reviews.title: "White residue"
reviews.text: It has white residue in couple bags. Not sure what it is. Even it's harmless, it's ugly. Also the quality is not good, some pieces are quite big and even has some branches in it. Would not buy again.
reviews.author: Rain

reviews.title: "Good Mulch for the price"
reviews.text: This mulch has been down on the ground for better than a month. Yes, there was color dulling. This happens when the mulch dries. Great coverage for the price. I can tell where the Scotts Color Scapes ends and this mulch begins. The Scotts had faded from the laying down in October to February when we put down the Lowes Premium. The Lowes Premium is holding the Black Color very well. The different sizes of the chips in the mulch gives it charater and good coverage. I have recommended this mulch to many in the neighborhood and several neighbors have purchased this mulch.
reviews.author: DrJ3055

reviews.title: "change in quality from previous years"
reviews.text: I have been purchasing this same mulch from Lowes for the past 15 years with no complaints. This year i purchased once again and was surprised at the "change in quality." The bags were consistently filled with very large chunks of bark and many one foot sections of limbs. I would not consider this to be mulch, but rather wood chips. Very disappointed in the product. I took samples to the manager and the customer service was excellent. I will continue to buy at Lowes... but will definitely check out the insides of bags before taking them home! This year i suggest you pass on the "Premium mulch" and go to another brand.
reviews.author: Buckeye

reviews.title: "Very inconsistent - some beautiful; mostly garbage"
reviews.text: I just bought 20 bags of this "Premium" Brown Mulch. There is nothing premium about this product. About 4 of the bags had beautiful brown mulch in them that will likely look nice for a long time. The remaining 21 or so bags had large pieces of poorly stained wood. It looks more like chopped up 2 x 4s than mulch. Some of these pieces are 10 to 12 inches long. If you look at my flowerbed now, it looks like I bought two completely different types, colors, and brands of mulch. It is going to take more work to "mix" the different types so everything blends well. Very disappointing. I would NOT recommend this mulch to anyone.
reviews.author: Krista

reviews.title: "As good as local mulch dealer for less"
reviews.text: I bought 100 bags 25 at a time in order to throw a $15 off $50 coupon on 'em and I have no complaints for $1.40 a bag. I saw no construction debris or insects. The first batch had some white mold but I just laid that out in areas far from the house and then bought the next 3 loads but did not pick up current inventory but had Lowe's contact me when a new shipment arrived. The next 3 batches were bone dry with absolutely no issues. Certainly cheaper than local mulch I bought earlier and I cannot tell the difference between batches. I would by again assuming price was right.
reviews.author: carolina-trader

reviews.title: "Not "premium" mulch"
reviews.text: Like a great many reviews already submitted, the "premium" mulch is not premium.  I bought twenty bags and in just four bags I found a stone as big as my fist, several other stones an inch to an inch and a half long, large shards of wood, some more than six inches long and pointed, a spent shotgun shell, and a piece of two by four.  The black dye has faded in just four weeks.  I have had contact with the local manager and Lowes corporate, and they say they are looking into the manufacturer's quality control, but the length of time of the reviews for this product with many one star reviews being present, Lowes apparently did not police the products it sells to this point in time.
reviews.author: Dalgor

reviews.title: "Terrible quality, will never get this again"
reviews.text: This is my third purchase of black mulch for landscaping. The first was from a local ranch store, I got it bulk loaded into my trailer. The second was from a different, but similar store. I was happy to find this at Lowe's because it's closer to my home and the price was great, about 4 bags for under $10.When I distributed the mulch in my flower bed, I discovered a lot of garbage. Plastic caps, a lock nuts, a piece of 2x6, a rock, shreds of plastic bags. They certainly didn't screen this well, or the 2x6 would have gotten screened out. The quality control over what goes into this stuff is horrible, and it makes me wonder if I've just distributed a bunch of shredded pressure treated wood into my bed - which would fill it with the chemicals used to preserve wood.Besides pouring garbage into my flower bed - even the chunks of wood were poorly sized. What I've purchased before was mulch that was made of relatively similar sizes of wood chips. This had a lot of big chunks that leaves the flower bed looking uneven. I ended up taking those large chunks and putting them behind the irises because they looked so bad. There are a couple in the picture above the plastic and 2x6.The bag says "Contains natural forest products" but it also contains a lot of junk.
reviews.author: Stephen

reviews.title: "Ugly construction debris"
reviews.text: I didn't expect it to be bark.  But I also didn't expect it to contain rocks (big ones) chunks of wood, some pressure treated and some with yellow paint still on it.  The color is not like the web-photo, it is more the color of coffee.  Too dark and not very natural looking.  See attached photo for the debris found in just the three bags I bought.
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "Why so negative?"
reviews.text: It's amazing to me how people can give a negative review on so many things in life that are as simple as this. You see this foolishness all the time. âMy burgers bun didn't have enough sesame seeds....so I rate it a 1....I am so devastated and disappointed.â It is very misleading to people with common sense that may look at reviews. Folks, this is mulch. Pretty much how you have always known mulch. Yes, you could spend more and get a better quality. Please don't be scared away from the exaggerated negative reviews....it is a fine product and you will be satisfied....unless , of course, you expect the mulch to change your life! Then I'm pretty sure you will be disappointed!
reviews.author: Padams

reviews.title: "Sux"
reviews.text: smells nasty OMGawd.  pshew.  do not buy.
reviews.author: KB

reviews.title: "Does not hold color"
reviews.text: One week after putting this mulch down there was a rain storm and the mulch is now brown. I went back to the Lowes store and was told I could bring the mulch back (yeah, right) or contact the manufacturer, Oldcastle Lawn and Garden. The only thing on the bag is a PO Box address. Could not find any website for this outfit. I still have all my empty bags. In a chat session I was told Lowes should give me a refund if I re-bag the mulch and return it. Yeah, right, like I am going to do that.
reviews.author: Rich

reviews.title: "Quality dropped off"
reviews.text: Used this mulch lady year with great success. Extended the munched area at our house and in less than 48 hours and wishbone heavy rain storm all black dye is gone. The black in the image is over a year old, the brown was black until I applied it two days ago. You can see where the black dye stained my driveway as I carried a bag that had been rained on into my backyard.
reviews.author: Kyle

reviews.title: "Bags falling apart all in the same place"
reviews.text: Have used this black mulch from Lowes for the last 4 years and overall pleased with the product as compared to using pine straw.  Recently purchased 50 bags and over half of them the bags where coming apart at the right lower corner at the seam (looking at the bag as displayed) had to tape each bag just so I could transport them to were I needed them in my yard.  Had a similar issue last year but was able to pick through another pallet that wasn't this bad.  When you are buying a product in a bag like this, one would expect the bag to hold the product so you can get it home in your yard and not on the road from the store to your home.
reviews.author: PaPaJo

reviews.title: "disappointed in mulch"
reviews.text: i have been purchasing this mulch for years and until now have been satisfied.  i purchased over 30 bags and have spread a few.  the mulch is about 30 percent large pieces of limbs--some as large as my forearm--that look horrible in the garden.  i would have used Facebook with a bad review but i don't believe that's the way to handle business.  so, i will live with what i bought, but will never buy mulch from lowes again.  to say i am disappointed is an understatement.  i may display an empty bag in my garden so all my neighbors and visitors will know where it came from.
reviews.author: gardener

reviews.title: "More like wood chunks instead of wood chips"
reviews.text: I bought about six bags of this mulch when it was on sale. Each bag had eight to ten pieces of wood averaging about foot long and 1- 2" thick that I had to break up and four of the six bags had rocks. Most of the other pieces were larger than you would expect for mulch as well. I have used this brand before and it was much better than this batch. Perhaps they were in a rush to get the product out because it was not ground up properly. If I could take them back I would. I was really disappointed in this product. I probably will not buy again regardless of the cost. Avoid this product unless you are looking for kindling for your fire pit.
reviews.author: Beth

reviews.title: "Faded after one day in flower bed."
reviews.text: Put mulch down and it rained on it the next day. The color faded to natural wood where water ran off roof onto mulch. Had a streak of natural colored wood all way down the middle.Do not buy. Waste of time and money.
reviews.author: Mick

reviews.title: "Totally Disappointing and an inferior product"
reviews.text: I make it a point to go to my local Lowes first for my gardening needs and when I needed some additional mulch for one of my beds I purchased 4 bags of the "Premium Brown Mulch". I had purchased a number of bags of Scotts Premium Brown Mulch from Home Depot, but they were out of this mulch and I figured the Lowes product would at least be comparable.It is anything but--It's awful. First, it is more like chipped or shredded wood chunks that have been artificially colored a very dark brown (almost grey quite frankly when coming out of the bag). Second, I agree with others about the color degrading quickly. After just one decent rain the "brown" color has mostly disappeared and what I am left with is a pile of grey wood chips--very unappealing.I have attached an image I just took a few minutes ago. On the top is the Scotts Brown Mulch, on the bottom is the Lowes brown (looks like grey now) mulch. The Scotts mulch has been down for weeks, the Lowes mulch for less than a week. I picture says it all. Very disappointed.This is the first time I have been extremely disappointed in any product sold at Lowes. I will not purchase this again and advise anyone else looking for high quality mulch to consider the Scotts Premium mulch, which is true mulch and that color does indeed last for well over one full year.
reviews.author: montanamike

reviews.title: "Color washes off immediately"
reviews.text: We bought this ground wood mulch last year it was ok but this year the color COMPLETELY washed off after first rain... color lasted 4days!!! Looks terrible. Don't purchase it at any price! It should be -5 stars not even  1 star... the photo shows how bad... this was dark brown 4 days earlier.
reviews.author: NW

reviews.title: "OK product but beware of the contents..."
reviews.text: I have trimmed many of the lower branches of two large oaks this year and I wanted to place some mulch underneath so that my boys can play under without getting dirty with the regular ground.2 bags came out to be almost pure white with mold covering all of them.  I have found: â¢ Much large chunks of wood compared to the earlier 20 bags I've purchased â¢ Contained rocks. Yes, palm sized rocks. â¢ Tree branches that still had the overall diameter and some length â¢ Wood backing found in 60's basement â¢ Building material, some piece of wood with scare cut â¢ Piece of blue painted wood Honestly, I would have not bothered reviewing since I got great customer service from Lowes, but these replacement bags really placed Lowes quality of mulch in a bad light. I will never buy from here again and instead go to Home Depot with their Scott's bags Lowes, if you are reading this, please have your supplier quality teams investigate your mulch vendor, as at this rate you may end up giving your $2.00 on sale mulch a bad rep.
reviews.author: Deng-Xiaoping

reviews.title: "Bolts, Branches, Just Plain Bad..."
reviews.text: We bought 5 pallets of this and it's the worst mulch I've ever seen - even the local Joe down the street has better quality.  The word "premium" should mean just that.  Now, granted we bought it while on sale because we have 2 huge areas to naturalize, but that shouldn't make it an inferior product.  Usually "premium" means just that, and that it's been hammered more than one time.  We've found metal, full size pine cones, huge pieces of tree branches, wood with paint on it (check out the picture, it's worth a thousand words - hose nozzle was for size reference).  And, it gets even better... when you put water on it, the color runs off, I've never seen anything like it!  It's already started to fade, so I seriously doubt the 12 month guarantee on color will hold up.  We should have stuck with the other brand we used around the house, now THAT was "premium" mulch!
reviews.author: sherric704

reviews.title: "Spend the extra dollar for better stuff."
reviews.text: We used this on our beds and it looked nice for a couple days. Within a couple weeks, the mulch was fading. A week after that, it was entirely overgrown with weeds and crabgrass to the point that I believe the mulch I got was contaminated with seeds as I have not seen this bright green variety of crabgrass in my region before. It even grew in the mulch that was thinly spread over the landscape fabric in the far corner of my yard.Spend the extra dollar and save yourself having to dig everything up twice and mulch twice (with better mulch). This garbage ruined my beds.
reviews.author: LowTolerance

reviews.title: "Not as bad as everyone claims"
reviews.text: I was so hesitant to buy this after all the sketchy reviews. We went to the store to look at other brands and didnt even want to consider this one. After seeing such poor quality with the other brands we did buy this brand. I did not get this on sale and the price was a little higher than expected by the comments.  All 8 bags were consistant with size and color. Found one rock total. Hasnt faded in the month it has been down, we have not received much rain, but i do water my plants every other day. Would have received 5 stars if we didnt end up with a driveway full of spider mites a couple days after applying it. We didnt have them prior to the application.
reviews.author: Tiredmom

reviews.title: "Different mulch in each bag"
reviews.text: Last year we purchased this mulch and they were all the same. This year we have purchased many many bags. Some of them are lime last year, super dark brown larger pieces ofulch, other bags a brighter brownish red tone and tiny little pieces. Not happy!
reviews.author: Julie

reviews.title: "Last spring there was a 1 year color guarantee???"
reviews.text: Last tear there was a 1 year color guarantee. Now it seems they could not come close so it is now a season??? Put it on in spring..... in summer it will be gone! First photo is last springs application. Second photo is last weekend after new application.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "NOT MULCH - Dangerous bags of construction debris"
reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT DOES NOT CONTAIN MULCH.  I bought 5 bags and every single bag was composed of pieces of laminate flooring, rocks, large chunks of old decking and fence posts and even pieces of yellow plastic reflectors. I went back with a sample from each bag and complained to management. They refunded my money.  This product absolutely will not be used in my yard.  This is a very dangerous bag of construction debris that is being passed off as mulch.  Lowes needs to pull this entire line from all their stores.
reviews.author: Sara

reviews.title: "Color Faded Next Day"
reviews.text: We have numerous nature areas in our yard that require mulch, so I'm always on the lookout for a good buy. This product was on sale this spring, so I took a chance. The first afternoon I used it, I had to stop halfway through a large nature area due to a rain shower. The next day I literally could not tell where I left off. The rich brown color had faded to splotchy light brown with flecks of white from where the dye had washed off in the rain. I prefer buying my mulch in bags as it's easier to place them where needed using our lawn tractor and trailer; however, I will not make the mistake of buying this product in the future. I've used Preen in the past and was very pleased, but it's costly and rarely on sale.
reviews.author: WarblingLisa

reviews.title: "lost its color"
reviews.text: it was black, it rained  now  washed out brown The package says 12 months color guaranteed it was less than 3 days!  I paid full price 5 bags ! Now what!  who do i contact to make this right? I should  have stuck to Scotts brand
reviews.author: nycgirl

reviews.title: "Love this mulch!!!"
reviews.text: I generally buy Preen if it is on sale. However, this year, I guess Preen is not having a promotion so I thought I would give this mulch a try...after all the price was right and the color is guaranteed just like Preen and Scott's. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality, finely shred, no large chunks of wood, no mold, no bugs and a great color. We will see if it fades but actually, I have never had any brand of mulch that does not fade by the end of the year. I will also have to wait to see if it is comparable to Preen for weed control but with such a great price, you can buy a container of Preen and sprinkle it in the mulch. Great buy!!!
reviews.author: Sammy

reviews.title: "Do Not Buy - Subterranean Termites In Sealed Bag"
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I, opened up a few bags of this mulch, and poured the mulch into a shrub and flower bed right next to the front wall of our house. We began to spread the mulch and much to our horror, it was brimming with little white subterranean termites. They quickly began to scatter, and they burrowed into the ground.The Lowes store managers where we purchased the mulch were wonderful when I explained what had occurred. The managers were kind enough to give us a free, high quality termite treatment kit, to treat the area around our home. Lowes' genuine concern and exceptional customer service were a big relief when having to deal with the aftermath of termite infested mulch.Please do keep buying from Lowes; their customer service is superb. However, do yourself a favor and don't buy *this* mulch!
reviews.author: LowesCustomerfromSmyrnaTN

reviews.title: "Composition is suspect"
reviews.text: I have put down a lot of mulch in my life and this is absolutely the worst I have experienced. I buy the cheaper mulch to put on my pathways and have used this without problems in the past.  I know mulch has an odor and usually I enjoy the smell of fresh mulch, but something in this mulch is not right, there is something organic that is rotting or moldy and it is producing a stench that is unlike anything I have experienced with mulch.  It is a week later and I am still apologizing daily to my neighbors for the sickening smell.  My next door neighbor actually moved an outdoor barbecue to another location because the smell was so nauseating. I am a very experienced gardener, so I know mulches and this is not acceptable, no matter what the price.
reviews.author: Sue

reviews.title: "White moldy mulch"
reviews.text: I bought 10 bags of this black mulch and my husband and I opened and spread 4 bags of it into our garden and the mulch was all moldy and white. I didn't open the others bags because I knew they were bad too. I told my husband to return the other bags to lowes and to tell them about the problem. We couldn't return the bags that were on my garden already therefore lowes didn't give us a refund. We ended up buying and using the other brand of black mulch that is more expensive than this one but fortunately it was on sale for the same price as this one and came out good. I won't buy this brand again.
reviews.author: JmelKAC

reviews.title: "good mulch"
reviews.text: I put 30 bags around my mobile home,the color was great.easy to spread.this is the best stuff ive seen in awhile for the price,color lasted the whole spring and summer.will be reusing it again next season too.i don't know where people are getting there mulch from that they say had termites or bugs.i live in north east ohio and none of my bags came with termites or bugs.i would recommend this over and over again.but my bags were fresh and damp alittle so it was eay to spread and I guessing because it was fresh and wasn't laying around a long time there was no chance for termites to hatch in the dried out mulch.love my lowe's.
reviews.author: jfitz144060

reviews.title: "Great product - used for last 3 years!"
reviews.text: When my landscaper first recommended this several years ago, I wasn't sure what I thought about black mulch instead of brown or natural, but my oh my goodness - it is SO pretty against the bright green leaves and pink flowers we chose. I am so glad we chose this one. We've used this exact mulch for the last 3 seasons and each year I have so many people compliment our beautiful landscaping. Yes, the color fades a bit over time, which is to be expected... but overall, I've been really impressed with how long it holds its color. I highly recommend this premium black mulch.
reviews.author: 411Goddess

reviews.title: "Great mulch for the price"
reviews.text: I purchased 24 bags of the dark brown mulch in May and used them in my beds around my house. For the price, I cannot beat it. All 24 bags were the same consistance and color...no issues there. I purchase the bagged mulch because it's easier for me to handle the bags and spread them where I need it as oppose to buying a truck load. In the past I've bought Scott's mulch and I cannot tell a difference between the two. I haven't experienced any odor with this mulch, as a matter of fact, I was pleasantly surprised that there wasn't an odor on my trip home with it in my suv! In years past, I've bought mulch that had such an awful odor I removed it...but this one I've been really lucky with and haven't had any issues like others have posted. I am on my way back to purchase more bags of this mulch for some new beds I've planted this year!
reviews.author: Barb

reviews.title: "Garbage"
reviews.text: I bought 25 bags of this garbage mulch and it was filled with moldy junk. Do NOT buy this inferior product as you are better off getting fresh mulch delivered. I will continue to tell the world about this garbage mulch and the continued failure of this manufacturer.  Lowe's should be ashamed of providing this manufacturer an avenue to dump garbage mulch into its environment that it services.  Forget about this CRAP!!!  Who will pay for my time spreading as well as removing this garbage from my beds?  Not the manufacturer but Lowe's customers.  Lowe's take notice!!!!!
reviews.author: Dick

reviews.title: "very disappointed"
reviews.text: Ive used this brown bark before for various spots in my yard and its always been satisfactory... This year at the beginning of summer I bought 20 bags of the same batch as recommended,  i got the bags home and spread out and it looked great, it's very close to my lawn so after several months and the lawn being watered a gluey substance started to appear,    Big clumps,  choked out and killed a tree, it was a young tree but 1 yr established,   I've removed the bark and very apprehensive about putting any more back, i took a photo, maybe someone can tell me what it is.
reviews.author: BPonRTE66

reviews.title: "Good Last Year(2017) - Really Bad this year (2018)"
reviews.text: I Bought this mulch for the first time last year end of the season and it still looks good after rain and snow. I only used in one part of my yard where i had gas work done and needed to be fixed. Now i purchased about 18 more bags to finish off the rest of the yard and after the first rain it looks really bad - the black is gone and it looks greyish and whiteish see the photo below dark is from last year and light is the one i applied this year
reviews.author: Catao

reviews.title: "Brow bagged mulch (landfill waste)"
reviews.text: I have used Lowe's bagged mulch in the past and was very satisfied. I picked up 30 bags this morning for a project my wife was doing and it has turned into a disaster. The stuff in the bag is garbage. It is pretty much a bag of water soaked landfill waste that has been shredded and colored. I'm not sure it is even  safe to handle. If it were not for the reloading the remaining 12 bags and driving them 17 miles to the store, I would return them. This is a horrible representation of the Lowe's brand. I have written many, many reviews for Lowe's products. This is only the second complete failure. The only good thing about the product is that I do think the bits and pieces of plastic bottles in the mix may last a long time.
reviews.author: ken

reviews.title: "This isn't mulch"
reviews.text: We have used this brand for several years with hardly any issues. Not sure where Lowe's is sourcing it this year, but the quality is so much worse than before. It's all here as reviewed by others: rocks (not pebbles), large planks of wood and the dreaded white mold. We used 40 bags at home and also purchased 50 bags at our church. They all had the same issues - these are large pieces of wood, not mulch. Most of the black was faded right from the start. A family member bought the red sale priced mulch at Home Depot and had much, much better results. I think I'll use their brand in the future. BTW our mulch was purchased in the Toledo area.
reviews.author: Disappointed

reviews.title: "No color guarantee"
reviews.text: Mentioned 12 months guarantee color, but 1 rain changed color to complete white from black. not recommended at all.
reviews.author: Babu

reviews.title: "Average at best, quality has gone down hill"
reviews.text: I decided last year to change over to the brown mulch as a change of pace. Well... Not too impressed with a number of items. First, the color DOES NOT STICK around long. Here in Dallas, the color was bleached out in a matter of 3 months, just a heads up in hot sunny climates. The second issue was the abundance of termites (those the store did exchange) the last issue was the huge chunks of bark and can best be described and thick cut off branches. I wish that there were more positives other than we purchased on sale. I will not be purchasing this brand again. YMMV
reviews.author: DallasIrisGrower

reviews.title: "Excellent mulch"
reviews.text: This past week, we bought 15 bags twice and 20 bags once of the brown color at 5/10.00 and could not have asked for better mulch.  I have spread 40 bags and, so far, found one small lump of dirt and one piece of paper, both about 2" in diameter. The mulch looks great in my flower gardens and around our trees.  In the past 2 years, I have bought several bags of the black to use at our second home and the color has held very well on it.  I'm sorry others have had problems and hope their next purchases will be as satisfactory as mine have been.  Don't let low overall rating keep you from trying this product.
reviews.author: Glenda

reviews.title: "Mulch looks awful"
reviews.text: Bought 5 bags of brown and when I finished it looked like it was about 5 years old..no distinct smell and color was dull....do not buy...went to Home Depot and bought their brown mulch and you will see in the picture the clear difference
reviews.author: Ryan

reviews.title: "Fungus and lost color in 3 months"
reviews.text: I purchased 7 bags of this mulch in April 2018, and the mulch quickly lost color and produced a bad fungus.  I would advise avoiding this mulch as I've not had this trouble with other brands of black mulch.  The manufacturer # Lowe's provided to call on the 12 month color guarantee is 800-346-3216 in case anyone else is looking for it.
reviews.author: Tara

reviews.title: "Good Enough"
reviews.text: Been buying this for the last 2 years; probably about 60 bags in total. I stay with the brown color; when it fades is still brown looking. People already have a perception of what mulch should be. Some say its too fine and others say its to too big. While I would prefer it a little finer, its good for the price. Every time I purchased it the mulch was very wet. I could see the top bags getting a little water in them during a rain but its all the bags. So its safe to assume they are packaged that way. I'll be buying more this spring once they go sale. Just need to add an 1" of mulch overtop what is there.
reviews.author: mikee1200

reviews.title: "They have changed the quality of this mulch"
reviews.text: Last year I bought 60 bags of this mulch and I loved it.. Today, however, I bought a number of bags and I knew right away that they put a lower quality mulch in the bags .. It was like cheap double shredded mulch that they just sprayed brown..I  even went to some bags I had left from last year and the difference is remarkable..I wanted pictures but it started raining.  I will not buy any more.. They fooled me..  All this and they made me wait 10 minutes to get somebody's attention at Customer Service.
reviews.author: Dennis

reviews.title: "Infested with Termites"
reviews.text: This mulch was infested with termites and despite what you might read on the internet it can, and does happen. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K-tpGjAUWYcThis is not my video but it is exactly what I found in this mulch.  I took photos of the termites found in the mulch I purchased at Lowe's.
reviews.author: Lynne

reviews.title: "I thought I would give it a try for the cost."
reviews.text: The price was very cheap. I read a lot of mixed reviews, and since most of them seemed to involve insects, especially subterranean termites which are very uncommon in my geographic region, I gave it a try.In my 8 bags of mulch that I bought, I found quite a few rocks, a few rusty bent nails, some Styrofoam, chunks of carpet and a lot of pieces of wood from a pallet. I know this because they are still painted red or blue. Most of the bag was usable, but there was definitely a lot of junk in these bags as well.
reviews.author: DIYH

reviews.title: "Stinks up yard and car. Can't get odor out of car"
reviews.text: This was a new low for timberline mulch. It was soaking wet, staining as it leaked, and smelling very bad. It smelled up my front yard for many days, but that is only a minor problem compared to what it did to my wife's car. The stench is so strong that you have to leave the windows open to even sit in the car. We tried another deep cleaning today and hopefully it will get better.Please Lowes, find another supplier. The pine bark nuggets have limbs in it and the mini nuggets are a mixture of fines and large pieces. The Garden Pro brand you sold in the past is much better. I guess I will have to stop mulching as everyone in our area carries the same sorry brand.
reviews.author: JimS

reviews.title: "I Wish I Could Rate It a Zero"
reviews.text: Mulch looked great and the price was good, so we started with purchase of ten bags. Spent most of the afternoon laying it and was pleased with how it looked. Surprise, heavy rain later that night. The VERY NEXT MORNING, the mulch was light brown. Now it just looks like old mulch. Trash men had come, so no empty bags to return for a refund. We need about another 30 bags, but I can guarantee we won't be purchasing this. 12 month color guarantee is a joke. And BTW, nowhere does it say not to lay it before rain. HORRIBLY DISSATISFIED!!
reviews.author: Laurie

reviews.title: "Worst mulch I have used in 40 years"
reviews.text: My first bags of black mulch purchased at Lowes. What a waste. The mulch was purchased on Monday, put down Tuesday, had rain on Thursday, and this is what it looks like on Friday. I now have gray mulch. The dark scuff that appears black in the picture is the soil, not mulch. The rest of my mulch, which is 2 year old died mulch from a local nursery, looks far better 800 days later than this material does after 3 days. There is no warning on the bags to not put it down 48 hours before rain. I have put dyed mulch down for years with no problems, but that was with non-Lowe's black mulch. Unfortunately my wife tossed the receipt. She said " We never have had a problem with died mulch before. Why would I keep it?" Could not argue the point with her. We have been doing this every year for 35 years. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT UNLESS IT WILL BE UNDER SUNLIGHT FOR MORE THAN 2 DAYS. Possibly even 3-5 days of sun.
reviews.author: Ed

reviews.title: "Picture worth a thousand words"
reviews.text: See attached photo.  I bought 100 bags put half down Saturday and got a light rain that evening Sunday put the other half down and see for yourself the difference. Called the company in SC and they would not back thier product. Shared the photos with Lowe's and they gave us a full refund. Will never buy that product again
reviews.author: Kraden

reviews.title: "What happened? This used to be good mulch!"
reviews.text: I've purchased Lowes Premium Dark Brown Hardwood mulch every year for the past 5 years. Prior to this year, the mulch was a nice rich brown color and finely shredded. This year, good color, but every bag, all 30 of them, were nothing more than wood pulp, & large pieces of every kind of wood. It was like they forgot to shred it. I also found paper clips, UPC stickers & old cotton balls! I do a lot of shopping at Lowes and will continue to do so, but I will never purchase this product again. Maybe Lowes need to find a different supplier. One that provides a quality mulch product.
reviews.author: MrsV

reviews.title: "Black gone after two rains, junk!"
reviews.text: I tried to add a photo but it gave me an error message with exceeding the size limit with one single cell phone photo what a joke is well. This product is another joke lasted 3 days or so and a couple rains it's now a natural bridge. Buy the premium Scott's variety or other premium variety which I've used and had great results with. This was on sale and I should have just skipped it considering the price differential and I now have brown to match the rest of my black and grey decor. Will be requesting a refund or something and see how their "1 year guarantee" goes then post it.
reviews.author: Greg

reviews.title: "Garbage"
reviews.text: Please do yourself a favor and don't buy this product.  It is total garbage.  I bought 8 bags to put in my flowerbeds.  When I was spreading it, I noticed how big the pieces were.  Some were simply pieces of 2X4's (they had sawn edges and cut corners).  There were also large rocks, some the size of my fist.  The color started to bleed/bleach out with a couple days.  When it rained, the color just ran.  Within a couple weeks, it looked worse than before I put the "mulch" down.  I had to buy 8 more bags of a better brand just to cover up the mess.
reviews.author: David

reviews.title: "Barely worth the discounted price"
reviews.text: As others have stated, bags contain a fair amount of trash.  Not junk wood but actual trash.  Color fade obvious after only 48 hours.  See picture for mulch spread 48 hours ago with brand new mulch next to it.
reviews.author: jprice1485

reviews.title: "RED SPIDER MITES!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!"
reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE!!!!!! BOUGHT ABOUT 25 BAGS OF MULCH. I OPENED 20 BAGS AND SPREAD THEM ALL OVER THE BACK YARD. THE NEXT DAY I STARTED SEEING HUNDREDS OF TINY LITTLE INSECTS ALL OVER MY CONCRETE. AFTER WEEKS OF SPRAYING INSECTICIDES ON THEM AND THEM NOT DYING, IM STILL DEALING WITH THEM. RECENTLY I DECIDED TO OPEN ONE OF THE SEAL BAGS BAG'S TO CONFIRM IT WAS FROM THE MULCH AND BANG THERE THEY WHERE INSIDE. JUST A HEADS UP IF YOU CONSIDER PURSHASING THESE BAGS. I GOT THEM WHEN THEY WHERE ON SELL.
reviews.author: THEONE

reviews.title: "Don't waste your money!"
reviews.text: This mulch is horrible. We ordered a whole pallet (65 bags). Every single bag was moldy (white stuff on mulch) and piece sizes range from slivers to huge chunks of wood. I also found lots of various trash in the bags - foil, metal, plastic, glass. Worse purchase ever.
reviews.author: SM

reviews.title: "Poor quality mulch"
reviews.text: I purchased 150 bags of this mulch.  The first thing I noticed was a strong chemical smell, almost like creosote.  I spread a couple of bags and then it rained.  The mulch looked like last years, faded and gray.  Over half of the bags have a white mold/mildew in them.  Some of the bags are mostly mold covered.  Many of the pieces are quite large and I have found trash (food wrappers, bottle caps, etc.) mixed in with the mulch.Lowe's used to sell naturally brown, hardwood mulch from Timberline.  It was excellent quality.  Since I use such a large amount each year, I will have to start sourcing a better mulch for my next purchase.  I only hope this mulch does not harm the plantings since the chemical smell lingers for weeks after the it has been spread.
reviews.author: cwalpert

reviews.title: "Very Good Mulch"
reviews.text: I used this black mulch 4+ years ago. I wanted to "freshen" up all my landscape. I bought 40 bags on sale {over Memorial Day week}. I do my own yard work. I do not have any connections with Lowes. I have NEVER had any  problems with this brand! It has a "crisp" color and is good quality. I have never found any kind of "garbage" in any bags nor any mold. I have had some "chunks" but I just loosen them with my hand tools. My mulch sits in full sun all day. Hint: if you lay down the mulch and the forecast calls for rain, simply "water" it down with your garden hose on the "shower" setting. I am very pleased with this brand.  Once I used another brand {which I won't name} and it was not "mulched" up but rather looked like "small sticks" and turned white within 9 months.
reviews.author: Lisa

reviews.title: "Waste of Money"
reviews.text: 12 month color guarantee?  Yeah, right!  Black mulch turned brown in 1 week.  I bought and laid down 20 bags of this garbage.  Totally wasted my money as well as my labor.  Lowes should be ashamed to sell this rip off!  My photo shows the new mulch that I just laid down on top of the 1 week old mulch.  See the color loss for yourself.
reviews.author: Jack

reviews.title: "Held color ok but had a lot of trash"
reviews.text: I was mostly happy with this purchase. It held color For about 5 months but that was with enduring 3-4 weekly sprinklers for 2 straight months and a lot of massive rain. It'd probably last longer if my sprinklers didn't hit it so often. Unfortunately, there are a TON of big chunks of mulch and what I assume was construction site trash. I found some random chunks of various types of wood like 2x4s and plywood. There were also a few nails/screw and some sharp metal chunks/slivers. Can't really expect much better for the cheap price tag it carries.
reviews.author: Bsampson

reviews.title: "Brown Mulch Worked For Us"
reviews.text: We purchased approximately 120 bags of the premium brown mulch to do a major renovation to our landscaping.  The purchases were made over the course of two years during spring sales at about 30 bags per purchase.  We found that the color was consistent from each purchase, spread easily and has now been down for nearly 3 years.  No color loss even with the hot California sun!
