Weeds are nowhere to be found (spread it about 3-4 inches deep throughout over landscape fabric) and plants & trees are thriving with less water usage. The upside is less yard maintenance and neighbor compliments!
reviews.author: DanTheMan

reviews.title: "Good price, need to plan when you put it down"
reviews.text: Color is nice and the price is great. Not the best stuff in the world but is what it is. If you put this down a few days before a rainstorm, the color WILL wash out. You need to plan when you lay this mulch and allow for a week of hot dry weather. If you do that, you will be ok. If you do not, like I did, you will try and get a refund from lowes but they will tell you to REBAG AND BRING IN ALL OF THE MUCH YOU WANT to be REFUNDED. You will need the receipt, original bags and need to have put the mulch back into the bags to bring in. The bags that state, 12-month color guarantee with no mention of application instructions. I give the product a 3-star review and Lowes a 1. Customer satisfaction is poor with this product.
reviews.author: Eric

reviews.title: "Poor quality & Poor color retention"
reviews.text: The one year color guarantee did not last even a single day. Bought 12 bags of mulch and put down 10 around the flower beds. Later when I watered the flower bed, the color was gone from the areas that came in direct contact with the water. I now have discolored mulch all over the flower beds. I immediately returned the remaining two bags. Very disappointed with the product. Also, there was too much variation in the size from bag to bag. Some bags had really large pieces and some had fine pieces.In short, poor quality, poor color retention, and I am stuck with a yard that looks awful. Stay away from this product. If anyone wants to try this product, my advice to is to open one bag and run it through water to make sure the quality is okay.
reviews.author: Lalit

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: mike

reviews.title: "waste of money"
reviews.text: I bought 48 bags of this on 4/20/19It was pretty and black while in the bag but after i got it down and  pick all the trash and big pieces of lumber out of it within three hours after the sun dried it out it looks like a faded light brown color What a big disappointment and a waste of  money
reviews.author: mike

reviews.title: "Very Disappointed - Too Many Wood Chunks!"
reviews.text: I have purchased this mulch in the past and been happy with it.  However, this time I ended up with a majority of the bags containing big wood chunks, some of them 7-8" long and 3" wide.  Some of them looked like chunks of fence boards or pallets that the wood chipper had rejected. I understand that this mulch is made up of ground up lumber products, but I expected "Premium" to have been better shredded.  Some of the bags had a bad smell, too.  Better off buying from a local mulch distributor and having it delivered in bulk.  Home Depot had mulch on sale for the same price and it was a better quality than the one Lowe's had.
reviews.author: TexCat

reviews.title: "Color Fades Quickly"
reviews.text: We bought 11 bags of this mulch from Lowes and additional 12 bags of black mulch from Home depot. We laid them down on the same day. The bags of mulch from Lowes have already faded in color and look brown compared to the bag of black from home depot. Very disappointed in this product
reviews.author: Jennifer

reviews.title: "Chucks of sharp metal bigger than my fist"
reviews.text: Bought bags when they were on sale 4/10.  It was high quality, dye did not run, small mulch made from tree material. Got an additional 20 bags when on sale for 5/10 and not only was it a different color but the dye stained our hands and clothing and it was not made from tree material but recycled construction wood and trash, had laminate flooring, blue painted wood, trash including part of a phone and gloves, metal chucks larger than my fist and bricks as we were taking it out.  Brought samples back to Lowe's and offered to bring back all the bark, was treated like I was lying, including having the assistant manager say there wasn't a possibility the mulch was substandard because he had never had a bad review of it in 12 years.  After some argument was refunded in a store credit.
reviews.author: LizHammond

reviews.title: "Recommended where a cheap utility mulch is needed"
reviews.text: Significantly less expensive than the Scotts Naturescapes and significantly lower in quality. The Scotts is more finely ground and finishes much better around residential landscapes. The Lowes brand has large chunks of wood, is much more difficult to spread to a thin dressing coat, and is significantly darker brown than the Scotts, so you can't apply one next to the other. This Lowes mulch is good in backyard areas to cover up, for example, areas where vines and brush may have been removed and you'd like to cover it up with something uniform; for that, this mulch serves well. I just don't recommend it around the foundation.
reviews.author: dt63944

reviews.title: "Luxurious, Classy look"
reviews.text: Love love love, everyone compliments my landscaping, red fades and looks bad afterwards. It always rains in Florida and my landscaping still looks good. Bought in March, stored two bags in the garage and laid it out yesterday July 13th and it still looks good. Was afraid the heat and sweat in bag would ruin mulch but its still going rich in color.Bad reviews do not compare to my amazing experience. Would never go back to red again, and brown resembles the dirt too color too much, not my style. Black brings out the color in my plants.
reviews.author: Suly

reviews.title: "Inconsistant Quality Mulch"
reviews.text: Each year I buy my brown mulch at Lowes and have been very satisfied with the product. That was until this year. In early spring I purchased 10 bags and found the product to be acceptable, as usual. A couple of weeks later I purchased another 5 bags after Lowes replenished their sold out stock. That new batch was different. The color was light brown, instead of dark, and not much of it was shredded. Instead the bags contained mostly large chips of wood, which can not be called mulch. Either Lowes uses more than one supplier for their mulch or a single supplier that has bad quality control.  I hope that Lowes reads these negative reviews and rectifies the situation with their supplier(s).
reviews.author: Phil

reviews.title: "Made from wooden shipping pallets"
reviews.text: If you are into recycling this is the perfect product. After some research I found this mulch came from ground / shredded shipping pallets. I first thought this is scrap and I want real wood. Well before it was made into a pallet it was a tree, correct. This is not a man made material, so its natural. If you freshen up your area each year or so, this will work fine. Sprayed a color, it will eventually return to brown, the color of trees. If you see a little white mold, just stir it up, after it is mulch. Keeps the moisture in the ground where it should be.
reviews.author: 68Eagle

reviews.title: "Mulch pieces are too large"
reviews.text: I purchased 20 bags of the mulch because it was on sale for 4 for $10. I had already put down mulch from a landscaper and didn't purchase enough. The color of mulch is a dark brown, browner than most brown mulches. I thought it was good mulch until I noticed how large the pieces were. They were similar to large chunks of wood more so than mulch. Some pieces were parts of a small tree trunk or branch cut about 4 - 5" in length. Also found large rocks in a few bags of mulch. One rock was the size of a softball. I waited to do this review until I purchased some more mulch produced by Scotts and sold by Home Depot. This mulch was much better quality, no large chunks and the color was closer to the mulch that I get from wholesalers. This mulch was on sale for the same cost 4 for $10.I wouldn't go so far as to recommend not purchasing the Lowe's mulch, because mulch is seasonal and regional. The lot that I got may have been a bad lot but in the future I will be more cautious purchasing this brand and lean more toward the Scotts Brand.
reviews.author: Donti

reviews.title: "good for a rock garden"
reviews.text: 30 bags full of large rocks. I would not call this mulch!
reviews.author: kinsalegal

reviews.title: "Steer clear."
reviews.text: Black mulch placed in flower beds on a Friday. Looked great. Rainstorm in a Sunday. Black color toatally washed out. Twelve month guarantee? Barely lasted two DAYS.
reviews.author: NYStateovMind

reviews.title: "I paid for mulch and got so much more...."
reviews.text: I don't recommend this product at all. If I wasn't already so committed to putting it in my gardens I'd just assume return it. I know it's nice to give but I only wanted mulch in my bags. I received in addition...Large blue board that looks like a piece of pallet, A broken piece from what looks like a tool handle, bent up pieces of metal, pieces of paper of all shapes and colors and a piece of fan belt. Not any needles just yet but I'm being extra careful.
reviews.author: Bill

reviews.title: "216 bags and so far so good"
reviews.text: I have purchased 180 bags of brown and 36 bags of red over the last month from the Akron, Ohio store when the mulch goes on sale.  I have bought in several different batches and the quality has been OK so far.  The mulch has a decent pine resin aroma, not moldy or manure and the color seems to have held on through several rain storms.  I have found three small bits of random plastic, but no construction debris or insects.  This mulch is probably as clean as any of the other mulch brands I've used over the years.There are a lot of negative reviews, so it must be that quality depends a lot on the supplier of the moment.  I would recommend going to Lowe's to verify the quality is acceptable before you purchase.
reviews.author: Bill-from-Akron-Ohio

reviews.title: "Horrible."
reviews.text: I bought 3 bags of this from Lowe's to do a small area in the front of my house and allowed it to âcureâ without rain for seeveral days and it has already lost its color I am very disappointed.  The darker mulch is the mulch I just laid and the other is mulch I laid a week or so ago and it's dramatically faded.
reviews.author: Betta

reviews.title: "Quality Poor"
reviews.text: This is the second year we have purchased "Premium" brown mulch.  Last year's product was fairly uniform but did tend to mold after about a month.  This year we purchased an addition 14 bags of "Premium" brown mulch and it was horrible.  More sticks, twigs and rocks than normal mulch and the worst thing of all was the ODOR.  I was raised on a farm and can tell the smell of a feed lot.  Don't know if there was run off into the holding area for the mulch or what but we have put it down and hope the odor goes away eventually.  Won't purchase this again.
reviews.author: Ray

reviews.title: "Deserves 0 star"
reviews.text: This mulch is basically just chopped up bits of garbage and mildew infested chunks of wood. I bought 1 bag and my local store to check it out due to the poor reviews. I found pieces of plastic, rocks, and bits of rusty metal. The "mulch" that is in the bag is made up of huge pieces of tree branches, I had to lay it on so thick to cover the ground, it really didn't cover anything but a tiny flower bed I have. Back to the store to buy a better quality brand for the rest of the yard.
reviews.author: BM

reviews.title: "Great mulch at a great price!"
reviews.text: We always wait for the spring sale to buy our mulch. We purchased 16 bags in the black color. This is great mulch that will last us whole year before fading. We live in Texas, so it's constantly in the sun. I must say that in the past we had a lot of trash in the mulch, but this year we had zero trash out of 16 bags! I only had a few chunks of wood, about a 3 in block, in 2 of the bags. Overall, it's great quality mulch at a great price. I will definitely buy this again next year.
reviews.author: CrystalATX

reviews.title: "Liked it at first"
reviews.text: Bought 20 bags of this mulch and three days later after a hard rain I noticed the black had faded to the regular brown colored mulch. With a 12month warranty one would think it would last longer! It was a hard rain.
reviews.author: Catfsh

reviews.title: "Great mulch for the price"
reviews.text: I have been buying this mulch for several years now.  Surprised at all the negative comments.  Competitors???  Never have seen bugs, large chunks, trash, etc. as detractors report.  Color does not immediately fade.  As a matter of fact, last year's mulch still looks good.
reviews.author: DeDee

reviews.title: "Color Varies - Watch Out!"
reviews.text: The pictures say it all.  The mulch was bought and put down the same day.  The picture of the comparison was taken the day after.  I have bought about 50 bags so far and approximately 1/5 of them have had color issues.  So disappointing that I will have to dig up, dispose and replace mulch.
reviews.author: KB

reviews.title: "Excellent Tree Trunks"
reviews.text: This stuff sucks. I've used it a lot in the past. The two most memorable experiences were I put it down at my last house and about mid-summer I saw these clumps of orange specs all over the mulch. Long story short it ended up being an infestation of stink bugs. Since I can't be completely sure the mulch was at fault I continued to buy it. Second was last year I put it down at my new house, and mold sprung up in patches. I decided this spring to dig it all out, and this stuff had compacted into sheets about 1 inch thick. It was literally coming up in sheets. The large pieces is a given. So I am now done with this stuff.
reviews.author: chiefbootknocker

reviews.title: "Really Bad!"
reviews.text: I bought 15 bags of this mulch on sale. What a mistake! I usually buy Scott's Hyponex but this sale was so tempting I fell for it. The mulch was soaked within the bags, every one of them, foul smelling and extremely heavy to handle. I should have suspected something was wrong when, after they loaded the 15 bags into my station wagon, the clerk said " don't go too far on that tire." I can carry 20 bags of Hyponex without any problem, but 15 bags of this mulch put an extreme load on my vehicle. I found out when I unloaded, the bags were so moist inside that they were far too heavy to handle easily. Since the bags were sealed, they were obviously filled at the source when the product was soaking wet. I won't be buying this again no matter what the price break.
reviews.author: Ray

reviews.title: "Shotgun fungus"
reviews.text: Looks nice but started noticing black spots on side of house, then on cars. This really got worse this year and finally found out it is shotgun fungus.  Blows tar like spores into the air as the chips are breaking down.  Having to pull up all of it. Have to repaint house after much work to get spores off.  Not sure what is going to happen to cars. Very upset and no one in Lowes or other nurseries seem to know anything or care about the mess we have.
reviews.author: Pat

reviews.title: "Very Cheap, basic low quality mulch."
reviews.text: Nothing to write home about...this mulch is just your cheap, basic, run of the mill mulch. It is not as finely ground as claimed...I bought 22 bags and in each one I found very large chunks of wood, even some decent sized logs of wood, about 12-14 inches long x 3 in diameter. Hardly what I need for my mulch to be.But if you are looking for basic, cheap stuff, this is it. WORD TO THE WISE- wear your worst, nasty, old rattiest clothes when loading/unloading or spreading this stuff....the dye comes off easily and you'll never get it out of your clothes. Spend an extra $1 or $2 for a better brand/quality.
reviews.author: LW29

reviews.title: "DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!"
reviews.text: After putting down 40 bags of this mulch (no rain or anything), the color didn't hold for even four hours. The landscaping now looks like a patchwork quilt - just AWFUL!We were offered a refund but that doesn't even come close to the cost of removing and replacing the mulch again. Don't waste your time or money on this product. The 12 month guarantee is an absolute joke.
reviews.author: Rick

reviews.title: "I got what I paid for..."
reviews.text: It's almost the end of the summer season (Southeast USA) and I wanted to do a little work to spruce-up the landscape around my yard.  Lowe's was selling the "Premium 2-cu ft. Black Hardwood Mulch" for $2 a bag.  This sale price plus the 5% discount by using my Lowe's card was within my price point.  I purchased the mulch at my local Lowe's Store. The staff at the store even loaded my car! I unloaded the bags at my house early afternoon and was able to open and spread out the mulch about 28 hours later (next day). The first bag that I opened had a white mold-like substance on the mulch (see first photo).  Out of the 20 bags that I purchased, about 15 had a significant amount of white mold-like growth on the mulch.  I did use the mulch and, after a bit of raking, covered up most of the white (keep in mind I purchased the Black colored mulch, so the white was clearly visible). In the end, the mulch looks ok and other than me breathing in the mold while spreading (next time I will use a mask) the condition of the mulch was not so horrid that I felt compelled to try to return the mulch or otherwise complain to the local store. I did read the online reviews before purchasing this product and there were comments about a mold-like condition of the mulch. So, my point of this lengthy comment is for the buyers to know what they are getting when they: (1) make a purchase at the end of the season (I assume these bags had been sitting outside, and in my case, in the humid Southeast) in the Lawn and Garden department since Spring, (2) the item is deeply discounted and (3) the reviews indicate a possible issue.
reviews.author: DIYWannaBe

reviews.title: "Keeps its color"
reviews.text: Here we are at the end of the season and this mulch has retained much of the original color. The weed problem I had with other mulches is virtually non-existant with this product, the only down side is the material size consistancy. Some of the wood particles are fairly large while others are minuscule. Overall, a really great product.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "DONT BUY THIS MULCH"
reviews.text: I bought this on 3/04/2019 and it looks terrible today, 3/11/2019. I spread 21 bags of this black mulch. It rained twice between those dates and completely took the nice color out of the mulch. For reference, I also bought black mulch at Home Depot that is a dollar less for a different home and it still looks brand new after a month.  Lowes store in Gallatin, TN only gave me 10% back off the total bill. After all my hard work spreading 21 bags, I have a $10 discount and an entire year to look at this ugly mulch. Hardly worth the gas to go over and get $10 off. Not a happy customer.
reviews.author: Ryan

reviews.title: "Gotta laugh at the 12 month Guarantee"
reviews.text: Did my landscaping on a Friday used 20 bags it rained hard the next day. Now just looks like wood chips
reviews.author: Brent

reviews.title: "bags full of debris"
reviews.text: This was a return purchase as I had used the brown "premium" mulch last year and was satisfied with the results, so decided to purchase the same product again.  It was not the same product.  It appeared to be a bag full of shredded debris from either a construction site or possibly trash that washed up in a flood somewhere.  Found plastic, pieces of what appeared to be wall board, wood siding, (some still had paint), and one piece of broken glass.  It had a foul odor and appeared to be growing white mold.  Very dissatisfied and would rather pay a little more for a real mulch product in the future.  Stick to Scotts.
reviews.author: donz

reviews.title: "Black dyed shredded wood and chips"
reviews.text: Purchased 10 bags of Black mulch to replace and add to our garden and front yard shrub area. I did get black "dye" on my hands and pants. This mulch is good for adding nutrients to the soil and your plants. The shredded wood decomposes over time and makes your soil better. I removed Lava Rock (slag from steel mills) because this mulch looks natural and the color helps the plants stand out. Now I've read that this product comes from wood shipping skids. Well, where do you think that wood comes from? Yes TREES, The renewable resource. Like recycling? Here is another chance to help the environment, and bring beauty to your home. Don't forget to use your Lowe's card for an extra 5% discount.
reviews.author: Eagle68

reviews.title: "Too much mold and garbage"
reviews.text: I used to have bulk mulch delivered by the local nursery every year but I thought bags would be easier to move so I ordered 160 bags delivered this year.  About 75% of the bags were good quality mulch with very nice color.  Unfortunately the other 25% was riddled with mold and that makes the entire area look bad to have white islands mixed in with the brown mulch.  There was also a fair amount of garbage mixed in as well.  I found plastic straws, pieces of wire, portions of signs and other things mixed in.  I would say you could pick out the good bags of mulch in person, but the mold tended to be in the middle portion.  I will go back to locally acquired mulch next year.
reviews.author: jaydoc

reviews.title: "Premium Mulch Review"
reviews.text: Purchased 25 bags of this product every year to update my landscaping. This year I have had at least two of the Twenty Five with white/gray mold all thru the bag. Looked so bad that I would not use this on my landscaping. Those two bags wound up in the local dump, but for only $2.00 per bag I haven't lost much, had I found additional product I would have taken it back to Lowes. I would still recommend this product as this was the first of many years I have seen this problem.
reviews.author: BigE53

reviews.title: "Not happy with this mulch !"
reviews.text: Bought 30 bags of this mulch. I have used a lot of mulch iver the years and this is the only one I have ever wished I hadn't bought. Only good thing about it was the price. This mulch has a very strong smell of manure, two days later and the smeel hasn't faded as I though it would. It had plastic garbage, food wrappers and random junk in it. Also mold. It lost about half it's color once I rinsed with hose trying to get rid of the smell. I will be going today to buy enough of another brand to hopefully knock the smell down and bring some color back. Very disappointed in this and do not recommend.
reviews.author: Grace

reviews.title: "Never again"
reviews.text: Terrible quality control. Large chunks of wood (2 x 2, 1 x 5, etc. -- multiple in each bag) plus an incredible amount of debris - gravel, a rock about 3 inches in diameter, nail, shredded plastic bag, small chunks of plastic, a 1.5 diameter plastic wheel, duct tape, a 2 x 2 chunk of aluminum and the finger off a landscape work glove - but only the glove, thank goodness!
reviews.author: Gardener

reviews.title: "Nail inside"
reviews.text: I only buy a few bags at a time.  I put a bag on the ground, open it, & use my hand to push the mulch into a handled painting container, which I then shake over the desired area.  I wear long rubber gloves while mulching.  Imagine my surprise yesterday when stuck to the magnetic part of the painting container was an EXTREMELY long & bent NAIL!  This could have gone through my hand!
reviews.author: JW

reviews.title: "Hit or miss"
reviews.text: I have bought this mulch several times over the past few years.   Sometimes it is great, while other times it is sloppy wet and half rotted.   If you can load it yourself, choose to purchase the lighter weight bags (water adds weight).  BTW, this mulch is dyed.  DO NOT USE IT ON VEGETABLE GARDENS OR AROUND FRUIT BEARING TREES.
reviews.author: Thomas

reviews.title: "Worst Mulch I have ever purchased"
reviews.text: Purchased 3-11-17- 40 bags, The mulch is full of pulp wood and garbage.  I found multiple crushed soda cans, electrical wire, door/window molding, plastic wrappers, and lots of mold, and has the musty / manure smell.  Too busy/difficult to take it back and buy from someone else... used it by the shop vs. the house, since it is not a "walk up appeal" issue by the shop.
reviews.author: Lisalou

reviews.title: "This is a fairly low quality, nothing "Premium""
reviews.text: This year's patch is really bad.  Pieces are at least 50% bigger.  Large pieces of wood which look like trash, one rock the size of a baseball, a metal hook piece, plastic pieces, pine cones as well!
reviews.author: Laoblue

reviews.title: "Is this Mulch or COMPOST?"
reviews.text: In years past the mulch I used to buy was quite good; mid-sized chunks that lasted several years without a problem. These days the industry has found ways to get you back to buy more and more by shredding this stuff down so much it is a year away from compost........and compost is great for seed starting, just what we don't want! Besides all the other stories of termites, red spider mites, mold,...etc. It's hard to do right with this product. Love Ya Lowes, but you need to find another supplier.
reviews.author: B

reviews.title: "not good purchase"
reviews.text: the product was to be black in whuch it was... low color and not been down 2 weeks and already see brown color thru it...was not colored properly....good value for the money but if you like good color then this is no good.....
reviews.author: pattyp

reviews.title: "There's a reason it's on sale..."
reviews.text: I bought 30 bags of this while it was on sale. Who couldn't beat $2.00 a bag, right? Every bag had white mold. The color is dull and there are pieces of plastic, rock, and other trash in the bag. There are some huge chunks of wood, at least 6-7 inches long. I am so mad I spent money on this. I really wish there were an option to give it zero stars! Should've returned after the first couple of bags were a dud. I guess you get what you pay for. I'll be buying from Home Depot from now on, I think.
reviews.author: KimG

reviews.title: "Poor Qualiy Mulch, fades fast"
reviews.text: Over the past weekend I spent a lot of money and bought about 70 bags of the black mulch and laid it out. We had rain for 3 days and most of the color has worn off the top layer of mulch already. How is the mulch supposed to stay black for 12 months if it can't withstand 3 days of rain? I am very disappointed. I worked very hard landscaping and now it looks faded.
reviews.author: Pamela

reviews.title: "Dangerous Objects in Mulch"
reviews.text: We purchased this mulch for around our kids play scape. While we were disappointed the inconsistency in shred and color and the fact that the mulch contained rocks, nothing was more disturbing and maddening then finding a rusted 6 inch long 1 inch diameter bolt with jagged edges in the mulch.
reviews.author: Concerned

reviews.title: "Looks good"
reviews.text: We bought 100 bags for the backs yard and we'll see how long the color lasts. For now it looks very good nice.
reviews.author: PCBbaypoint

reviews.title: "Nice color out of the bag but doesn't last"
reviews.text: I recently purchased a new home and I have a ton of areas to mulch. I started purchasing bags of this mulch due to the cost and the ease of just dropping bags as needed at trees or the shrubs surrounding the house. First thing is these bags generally are drippy with the brown dye coming out. They are stored outside in the garden area so if it rains, these bags get wet and the mulch soaks up the water for a while. So be mindful that you may make a mess of your trunk and self. The dye for the most part washed out of my shirts but my jeans are all stained. And not too shockingly, when the bags are wet, the stink. The color out of the bag is great but it fades quickly, I've had some down for two weeks and through three rain storms. I don't think the brown will last through the summer but we shall see.
reviews.author: mrchang0

reviews.title: "Color for 12 months I didn't get 12 days"
reviews.text: I have used this product many times in the past with good results but it is not the same. I mulched half my gardens and then had a few days of rain. My black mulch is now a faded brown and my gardens do not match at all, not to mention all the big sticks and plastic I pulled from the bag. I am very disappointed with the result it was a lot of work and doesn't look like anything was done. I guess I have to shop elsewhere for my mulch from now on.
reviews.author: Seriously

reviews.title: "Not a good product!"
reviews.text: I had purchased 12 bags from Menards and ran out. Needed to finish project so ran to Lowe's. I bought 8 bags of "premium black mulch". Putting the 2 mulches side by side. The Lowe's bags were full of mold and the cut was so bad. It had huge pieces of what looked like ruts and some pieces had no die on them. Will not be buying this "premium" trash again.
reviews.author: Matt

reviews.title: "Color fades fast"
reviews.text: Just purchased the black mulch and put it all down and within one day it is grey with brown showing. Poor quality control but this shows you get what you pay for just glad I didn't purchase all 100 bags I needed and only got 15 (was changing from red to black)Stay away from this mulch if you want the color to stay. Also if you do purchase becare full of all the other junk in it. Everything from large chunks of wood to plastic and the best was the broken razor blade in one of the bags.
reviews.author: Alan

reviews.title: "Absolute Garbage-Color GONE in 24hrs"
reviews.text: I put this mulch down about 2pm Friday. We had a medium Rain that night. The next morning color was almost completely GONE!!!!! Most of it was as light as a popsicle stick. Just total garbage I will NEVER buy from this mulch company again. Gave a full refund though
reviews.author: cricket1976

reviews.title: "Premium 2-cu ft Brown mulch"
reviews.text: I purchased 450 bags of the premium brown while it was on sale 5 for $10. The mulch over all was ok, the color was consistent and the grind was consistent. I needed 20 bags to complete the project in my yard and purchased them yesterday afternoon. The mulch was a different brown and was molded. I was in the mulch business for 14 years and this was probably one of the worst products i have ever seen. I know that lowe's Have different mfg's produce the mulch and not everyone uses the same raw material, but at least they should be able to use the same colorant and have a consistent lookDavid HewettSantee, SC
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "Black Mulch from Oldcastle Products at Lowes"
reviews.text: You get what you pay for:Pros: Generously filled bagsPros: On sale at $2/bagCon: Trashy mix, including building waste (I found electrical wire, electrical boxes, etc in mine)Con: Large pieces not shredded, the size of mature carrots and mature baking potatoes, some as large as Subway sandwiches!Con: lots of rocks, mostly 1" gravel, some rocks as big as potatoes.Cons: Lots and lots of moldCons: one heavy rainstorm and lots of the color is faded.I bought 100 bags, wish I had stayed with the Scotts product! Never again!
reviews.author: Sidney

reviews.title: "Love the color, has not faded, nicely shredded"
reviews.text: Bought over 100 bags initially.  Liked it so much, we bought about 50 more for the back yard.  BUT, the 5 for $10 sale was over when I went back for the balance of 90 more bags.  It was WAY too expensive, so I went to WalMart and bought black mulch for LESS than $20/bag ... their regular price.  BUT, the less expensive mulch was not shredded as well and had large chunks as well as long and sharp pieces that poked thru most of the bags.  Decided to buy only about 40 bags and wait ... with hope ... for Lowes to reduce the price again.  Now that they have, we intend to buy at least another 50 or more bags.  The yard has never looked this good and we continue to find areas of our very large yard that would look much nicer w/black mulch.  LOVE it at $2.00 a bag ... will NOT buy it for much more than $2/bag.
reviews.author: Intense

reviews.title: "Purchased 50 bags"
reviews.text: Not sure why so many had issues.  The 50 Bags we purchased were great.  Rain did not affect color, but we purchased brown, not black.  Similar to another reviewer, the past mulch we purchased was from a landscaper.  This mulch was as nice, if not better,  much easier to spread than using a shovel and dump cart and less than half the cost.  Very happy and will repurchase.
reviews.author: Patti

reviews.text: I have always used this mulch in my garden. I have always bought it when it was on sale at 2.00 a bag. I have bought hundreds of bags over the past few years.  This year I've bought a hundred bags so far.  The last thirty bags I bought were huge pieces of wood. Not mulch but two by fours chopped up. Had other large pieces of wood also. I've never had a problem with this mulch until this year. I've always placed it around shrubs and my vegetable garden. Just don't look like mulch anymore. Lowes has piles of it. I may try something else now.
reviews.author: Scotty

reviews.title: "Costs more in cleanup"
reviews.text: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. Paid $2 a bag. Found rocks ranging from small to the size of my fist. Extremely heavy due to moisture content from factory. Does not cover well compared to mulch I have used in years past. I didn't spread 4 of the bags. Couple months later I noticed a fungus growing out of one of the bags. I ended up putting 4 bags in the trash. shoveling up another 1.5 bags worth that appeared to be contaminated from being close. Found more fungus growing in same mulch under tree. I'm hoping I don't need to remove the remaining 15 bags.
reviews.author: platypus

reviews.title: "Mixed browns, inconsistency."
reviews.text: I bought 15 bags of this when on sale. Imagine my surprise when I have half of it spread, open another bag, start spreading and it's a different color of brown and shredded more fine than the first bags. So inconsistent, you never know what you're getting with this mulch. I guess I have to buy mulch by bulk to get consistent coloring. A lot of reddish dye in some of the bags. It's not a huge problem for me because it use it in beds that are full of various plants and shrubs (cottage style) so it doesn't jump out. I only use local delivered bulk mulch in my front since the mulch shows much more and I don't like the bi-color.
reviews.author: Kathy

reviews.title: "Value Priced Mulch For DIY"
reviews.text: I don't understand all the bad product reviews on this mulch. This is a consumable product that will break down into the soil through normal decomposition. The color will fade just like any other product.I used the black hardwood mulch last year and it did fade but that is completely normal. There is a reason the landscaping companies put out fresh mulch every year at the bank and other shopping centers. This is done to improve the overall appearance of a business and your home is no exception.Lowes put this mulch on sale for Memorial weekend, its a real bargain at 44% off the normal price. This makes the product a real value for a new area requiring several bags. This Brown Hardwood Mulch was purchased to use around vegetable plants to conserve moisture and reduce nematodes from soil splashing up on the foliage during rainfall. The small vegetable garden in my yard looks great with a layer of fresh mulch and I am pleased with this product. The plants were also purchased from Lowes.This mulch was rated 4 Stars because some of the wood was somewhat coarsely chopped with a few large chunks of wood, some of it was finely peeled wood. Not complaining, just stating the facts. Its a great value as compared to hiring a landscape company to deliver a truckload or hiring the work to be done.
reviews.author: Slacking02

reviews.title: "Depends on distributor"
reviews.text: I bought 50 bags in the Vernal, UT store that came from a distributor in Hyrum, UT. These were great- I'd give them 5 stars: uniform pieces, nice chocolate brown color.I needed more and picked up 20 bags in Glenwood Springs. These came from a different distributor (Arvada?), and they are terrible. 0 stars! Lots of dust and big chunks of scrap wood, and a faded color. I will be returning these and getting more that is sourced in Utah!
reviews.author: LL

reviews.title: "All 12 bags were pretty darn perfect!!"
reviews.text: OK, soâ¦I read all of the absolutely horrible reviews (moldy, nails and other debris in the bags, etc..) about this mulch and yetâ¦.I am cheap and $2 a bag was right up my alleyâ¦so how bad could it be right??  I was prepared to be completely disappointed and decided to only buy a few bags to try it out.  Wellâ¦. I ended up buying 12 bags (looked pretty good in the bag) and EVERY bag I opened was darn near perfect.  The debris was really minimal, no mold and the mulch was pretty consistent in size and color (Brown).  I was pretty darn happy.  This stuff is great!  I may not be a mulch âconcessionerâ but it looks like regular mulch to me.  Spent $26 (there is always tax!!) on 12 bags and couldn't be happier.  I am actually going back to get more to do the remainder of the yard.  Now to be fair, there may be inconsistency in different regions.  Perhaps Colorado got the âcream of the cropâ.  Not sure, but based on the reviews I would have stayed clearâ¦VERY happy I didn't.  Now will it fade?  YEP!  Will it need to be replenished annually?  Absolutelyâ¦It's mulch folksâ¦and it's $2 for 2 cu ft. (that's a good sized bag).  It honestly looks just like what I had a landscaper put down a few years ago that cost much more!!  Take this review for what it's worthâ¦but in my opinion it's worth buying a few bags to see if your store received a good lot.  Mine did!!
reviews.author: AT

reviews.title: "Color is steadfast!"
reviews.text: I have used this product for the past three years and I mean in a abundance. This week i purchased over 1500 square feet of this material, the quality in my opinion has always held. I applied it over the material I purchased last year to freshen up my property. The color holds well and the material spreads easy. I have so many compliments of the color steadfast holding every summer. So far it is the same this year. The black blends in with the landscape and looks natural allowing my beds to create a good root base for my plants. Excellent product and I will continue to buy.
reviews.author: Jimmyb

reviews.title: "Evidently this mulch varies a lot"
reviews.text: I purchased this mulch twice - 5 bags last spring and 5 last fall.  The bags in the spring were OK, but they did contain some large chunks of wood (like lumber - with squared edges). Eventually the color faded from the dark brown, but it still looked ok.  The bags I got last fall were horrible. The consistency was long, stringy pieces of wood instead of the smaller pieces from before and within 3 months, it had faded to a pinkish color.  I just finished raking that up and bought EarthGro brown much instead.
reviews.author: SierraFoxtrot

reviews.title: "it's mulch!"
reviews.text: Used this product for three years now and will not change. It does not fade too much after all summer in the Florida heat and sun. Just have to remember to wear older clothing when working with it and gloves as well. The color used for the dark brown coloring does transfer, but minimally and usually washes in laundry with a little bleach. It does not blow out of the plant beds once it is on the ground. I just really like the color!
reviews.author: Heylady

reviews.title: "Too much color variation and garbage in each bag"
reviews.text: I have used this product on a previous property with great results. The color was crisp and the quality was good and the best value. The black really makes the color of the plants pop and it looks fantastic. In November 2011, I decided to use it again on my new property and all new landscaping but unfortunately the product quality has deteriorated dramatically. The first batch of 100 bags I bought had an overwhelming amount of mold so much so that when the landscaper opened and poured out the bags, it fell out in chunks. About 40% of the mulch was affected and unusable. The color saturation between bags was so drastic that some bags were not black but more of a light brown.Fortunately Lowes in my area was extremely helpful and contacted the company to let them know of the issue and refunded part of my purchase. Thank you Lowes! Because I already have the black mulch down, I can't or don't want to switch to another color and in my area, this brand is the only one available in black. I needed to cover more area in my flower beds so reluctantly I bought another 40 bags. After opening 8 bags and finding bits and pieces of trash including hard plastic, paper, plastic bags among other things, I returned the rest to Lowes and again they were extremely helpful. However, this time I contacted the mulch company directly and spoke to someone responsible for managing the quality that came out of the Phoenix plant which is where this lot came from. She was very friendly and apologized but didn't really offer to help rectify the situation.By this time, you think I would have learned my lesson but I had some bare spots that needed coverage so I bought 4 more bags a month later. This time I looked at the bags very carefully before buying them and had to look through 20 bags before finding 4 that didn't contain mold or trash. I took the four bags home and after opening them, I found trash but not nearly as much. The color was good but I had to pick out all the pieces that had white paper stuck to the back of them. I just wish this company would get better quality controls in place because I love how the black mulch looks around my yard.
reviews.author: Frustratedgardner

reviews.title: "Great"
reviews.text: Everything about this mulch is great the size of the nuggets and qualify are great I only wish the color was a little darker since it does tend to fade a little with time.
reviews.author: Lety

reviews.title: "Not hardwood"
reviews.text: Bought a pallet 68 bags of black colorWas more greyish Brown Found numberous pine cones in mulch and blue plastic Also painted wood pickets and something that looked like broom handle chopped up
reviews.author: Bd

reviews.title: "Not as bad as the reviewes"
reviews.text: A lot of the negative reviews are for the black mulch but this review is for the dark brown mulch which is the item I bought.  It's pretty good mulch.  Certainly not the highest quality but I bought 30 bags on sale for 2 dollars a bag and it's tidied up the landscape and given a nice clean look.  The mulch has been through several rain storms and no color change.  I've bought this mulch in the past and within the first year the mulch will start to lose it's dark brown look but I've bought much more expense stuff that did the same thing.
reviews.author: RMC

reviews.title: "Chicago Guy"
reviews.text: I have been buying the Brown mulch for the past few years and will continue to do so.  I have a pretty good base and have been buying 15-20 bags a year to top off.  The color holds pretty true, better than the previous mulch I used to get delivered by truck.  I found it easier to use/spread the bags.  Will this look brown next spring, probably not, but it won't turn as grey as non colored mulch.  Overall I am happy.  Not sure what people really expect for $2/bag?
reviews.author: ChicagoGuy

reviews.title: "Which color of mulch"
reviews.text: Don't know what people are complaining about. Of  course black mulch fades, there are no black trees, Brown looks natural and makes your yard look great. There are no word that explains red mulch, mulch is not to be accent in your yard. Double ugly anyway. Brown looks nice for monthsBlack fades and doesn't look natural. Red, OMG. Does nothing to make your plants look better.
reviews.author: Becky

reviews.title: "cheap but worked"
reviews.text: Not the best but from far it looks good. Different colors bc the bags were sitting outside in the rain but after laying it out and the sun baking it, it seems to be more uniform in color. Size ranges from tiny to large so if you want uniform size dont buy. Bought on sale and wish I could have bought more. Bags were so heavy bc of being wet I could only buy 10 bags. My Grand Cherokee was pretty weighed down. Also plan on using more than you think. The area I wanted to cover wasnt huge and I thought only 6 bags would be enough. I used 8.
reviews.author: kc

reviews.title: "Shredded Pallets"
reviews.text: This mulch is really poor quality. I only use it in areas that need mulch but can't be seen. It's worse than wood chips. It's nothing more than shredded wood pallets, very course, big chunks you would never want in your nice gardens. Yes, I found trash in mine too presumably to add weight or just poor quality control. Mulch this poor is not a good value I don't care how cheap it is.
reviews.author: Kathy

reviews.title: "Mulch or Firewood?"
reviews.text: I bought ten bags to touch up my front yard beds. The mulch does not even start black yet alone stay black. I don't think it can accurately be called mulch. Kindling is more like it. I apologize for the clarity of the picture, but it clearly shows the size of a major portion of the pieces in a bag. Those pieces are on the steps of an 8-foot ladder (for perspective). Says it all, even at the sale price of $2.00 a bag.
reviews.author: Queequeg

reviews.title: "Very Happy With This Mulch"
reviews.text: Our family has bought this mulch for 2 years now, the color holds up and when you catch the $2/bag sale, it is totally worth it!! We did not find trash in the bags as some had mentioned and this last time we purchased 150 bags.  I did notice color variation last year but not this year...not really an issue with us as we have a large yard to care for. Our experience was very positive and with the price, we felt like we could be more generous with the amount of mulch we used.  Hope this helps!
reviews.author: DIYFAM

reviews.title: "Inconsistent color and bad smell"
reviews.text: I bought two bags and as soon as I opened the first one I sensed a strong manure smell. I thought the smell would fade away once the mulch dried out but it still persists 2 days later and now the front of my house stinks like a cow field. The problems did not end there as once I opened the second bag (which also smelled like manure) I realized that the color was inconsistent and now I have half of my flower bed one color and the other half a slightly but noticeably different color. If you buy more than one bag I would recommend mixing them together before laying it out so that you get a more consistent color. Not sure what to recommend about the smell. Maybe use this only in the backyard? Or maybe just buy a different brand.
reviews.author: Lollo

reviews.title: "only 2 days black color remains"
reviews.text: left side applied two days ago right side is today applied.the black color was too easy to wash away from rain!it looks
reviews.author: Hestee

reviews.title: "Some mold and other things"
reviews.text: I normally buy the red mulch but decided to try a different color this year for a more drastic effect. I got the effect I want but there was so much garbage in it. I am talking pieces of foam,plastics both hard pieces and plastic bag pieces. There were even bent rusty nails but the real kicker was the open condom wrapper. I know this mulch is on the cheaper side so I was sorta expecting some garbage just not everything that I found and it is called premium mulch. I am glad though in the end that I waited for it to be on sale and that all in all it don't look bad but it really is not a premium mulch.
reviews.author: Letsgarden

reviews.title: "It's as good as anything else"
reviews.text: I have used this mulch, and I have used other brands of mulch like Scott's. Don't kid yourself. This mulch is no better or worse than anything else. They ALL fade. They ALL have white mold in some bags. They ALL are made with whatever wood the supplier can get their hands on. You might as well go for the cheapest you can get because they are ALL the same.
reviews.author: NickC

reviews.title: "sorry mulch, more like pulp wood"
reviews.text: My wife purchased the mulch and it the sorriest excuse for mulch I have ever seen. Great hunks of wood, some up to an inch and a half wide, white mold, and nasty smell. Do not buy this mulch.
reviews.author: Denny

reviews.title: "not dissappointed"
reviews.text: After reading several reviews I thought I would add my two cents...I bought, at several different times, @25 bags of this mulch....the last 10 bags were definitely a different consistency of mulch....instead of the usual style mulch these last bags were more like ice that comes from your refrigerator when you hit the "crush" button....thankfully, these last bags were not in an area that can be seen by guests...although at a distance you really can't tell the difference ....but none of the mulch after several weeks of rain, heat and sun have turned grey or silver.
reviews.author: thejper

reviews.title: "Very good mulch for a great price"
reviews.text: I've bought somewhere in the neighborhood of 2000lbs(50bags) of the Brown mulch since the first 4/$10 sale of 2017 in my area and have had no issues with the contents at all. Color is pretty uniform from bag to bag, it spreads well, each bag covers approx 12sq ft at 2" deep, and I've had no insects, reptiles, inorganic debris, trash, or other undesirable litter reported by other previous reviews. As I've seen the bags are back for my area to 5/$10, I'll highly likely be acquiring more. I've recommended this mulch to several friends who have also have nothing but good things to say about the performance of the product.
reviews.author: Rhees

reviews.title: "great product for my yard"
reviews.text: I REALLY LIKE THIS PRODUCT. I LIVE IN AN AREA WITH A LOT OF WIND AND I NEEDED SOMETHING THAT WOULD STAY PUT AND HOLD THE SAND DOWN. THIS IS GREAT!! I CAN NOW SIT IN MY YARD! THANK YOU LOWES. I AM NOT WORRIED ABOUT THE COLOR AS I AM NOT DECORATING MY YARD HOWEVER I DO WATER AND HAVE NOT NOTICED A COLOR CHANGE.
reviews.author: BIGIRLGALE

reviews.title: "Smells"
reviews.text: Put down mulch on Friday and smelled like someone cleaned out a barn.  Rained over the weekend and still on Tuesday it smells.  It also had alot of trash in it.  Aluminum can pieces, cardboard and just trash.  NOT happy at all.
reviews.author: Kim

reviews.title: "This is NOT Premium Mulch!!!"
reviews.text: I have purchased this or a similar product from Lowe's annually. This year's product is bad. It contains long chunks of hardwood, plastic and some pallet wood. There is uneven coloring. This is not a premium mulch. I should have closely examined the product to see that it was in no way the same as last year's product. Wasted $40 at Lowe's Vernon Hills, IL and will call them for refund if I find the time. Stick with the name brand such as Scott's or Preen.
reviews.author: wordswithoutasound

reviews.title: "Bagged Mulch is for me!"
reviews.text: I have purchased this mulch for several years - usually on sale.  I've never had any of the problems described so many of the recent 1-star reviews.  I even read a review where it faded a few days later.  Mine is still deep brown after a week and while I expect it to fade, it will still look good. Year's ago I purchased a truckload of mulch for a natural area and there was so much junk and garbage (metal, rubber, glass!) that I never ordered by the truckload again. I prefer by the bag and while the colors are nice, as long as the mulch does the job, they are irrelevant.  Lowes' team is always helpful in loading your car - I don't recall it always being that way, but it is appreciated!!
reviews.author: Sheila

reviews.title: "only 2 days black color remains"
reviews.text: left side applied two days ago right side is today applied.the black color was too easy to wash away from rain!it looks
reviews.author: Hestee

reviews.title: "Some mold and other things"
reviews.text: I normally buy the red mulch but decided to try a different color this year for a more drastic effect. I got the effect I want but there was so much garbage in it. I know this mulch is on the cheaper side so I was sorta expecting some garbage just not everything that I found and it is called premium mulch. I am glad though in the end that I waited for it to be on sale and that all in all it don't look bad but it really is not a premium mulch.

This is not a premium mulch. I should have closely examined the product to see that it was in no way the same as last year's product. I even read a review where it faded a few days later.  Mine is still deep brown after a week and while I expect it to fade, it will still look good. Year's ago I purchased a truckload of mulch for a natural area and there was so much junk and garbage (metal, rubber, glass!) that I never ordered by the truckload again. I prefer by the bag and while the colors are nice, as long as the mulch does the job, they are irrelevant.  Lowes' team is always helpful in loading your car - I don't recall it always being that way, but it is appreciated!!
reviews.author: Sheila

reviews.title: "had mold in it already and had NAILS!"
reviews.text: Wouldnt recommend this mulch to anyone
reviews.author: trevor

reviews.title: "Don't Let the Pretty Color Fool You!"
reviews.text: On 3/31/19 I purchased 20 bags of this Premium Brown Mulch from Lowes located in a suburb of Charleston, SC. I absolutely LOVED the dark brown color. Unfortunately, immediately after pouring the bag onto the flower bed to spread/apply it around my shrubs/perennials I began to notice small white particles all over it. My husband thought perhaps it was possibly a bad batch/bag so he opened another only to find more of these tiny white particles all over it and in some cases there were large clumps of it. He drove back to Lowes and asked several Garden Ctr employees to look at it only for them to say that it's probably mold or fungus. So I decide to log on to Lowes to ck reviews and read where someone said there's was covered in termites. Needless to say all but the 2 bags thrown in our flower bed have been returned, but we're VERY concerned about our shrubs/plants because we just bought/planted all new shrubs and amended the organic soil we installed last year. It's been a huge investment of money literally in the ground, not to mention our time so I would literally be devasted if this mulch was infested with mold or termites. The thought just makes me ill. So buyer PLEASE beware. It's just too bad bc no one locally has a very dark brown mulch.
reviews.author: Mimi

reviews.title: "Color faded after 1 rain"
reviews.text: Bought black mulch on a Friday, mulched on a Saturday and by Saturday evening after a bit of rain, it looked like brown mulch had been mixed with a bit of black soil.  12 month color guarantee? NOPE.
reviews.author: Rich

reviews.title: "Nice color but..."
reviews.text: mushrooms grew.  And lots of them.  Then, this morning I was watering my flowers and saw this monstrosity.  Some sort of disgusting fungus.  Ick. It was slimy and growing around my poor petunia.  I was wondering why this group of petunias was late to bloom.  Maybe it was this disgusting fungus. I had already hit it with the water before I noticed it.
reviews.author: Linda

reviews.title: "4 for $10 doesnt mean worry-free"
reviews.text: i havent actually used this yet, but i've read ALL the reviews and went to home d. this morning and lowes to compare the $3.33/bag to this. i find the 2 equal in appearance. but i went to lowes and saw an older couple grabbing 36 bags of this in brown due to the value.some things to remember:-the underlayment. if you use plastic, water collects and this stuff is organic-based and will mold over time due to that. the mesh screen is better because water can escape.-in dry heat, this stuff will dry out, causing it to fade, mulch - shade + sun - moisture = fade. a very informative and long time officer grounds keeper for an nfl team told me that this stuff needs a little moisture from time to time to increase life. so hose it down with a mist every few days, doesnt need to be drenched, just wet.-"dont forget the special sauce". if you have termite or other issues for whatever reasons, spraying for the bugs doesn't hurt anything. weed killer as well.-"turn over a new leaf". get a flat shovel and turn it over every few months. you can get good coverage with just 2 inches, u may have to rake it around a little from time to time to keep your underlayment covered but u shuld still go ahead and turn it over a few times a year to keep the color even and lasting. brand new $10,000.00 car paint jobs buried in clear will still fade quickly when continuously left out in the sun. this is the same with ANY brand. i'll be laying about 20 bags tomorrow, i'll take some pictures for review and post again in a few months,
reviews.author: racerx510

reviews.title: "washed out color"
reviews.text: Standard mulch product and average cost. Bought this brand for the color and because the bag reads that color was guaranteed not to fade for a year. It faded over 50% the first day after a short rain fall. It is now a light brownish color mixed with black throughout all of my garden beds. Very disappointed, after all the work and expense to freshen the backyard, it looks like we didn't buy enough of the new mulch and poorly tried to blend it in the with the old worn out mulch.
reviews.author: Yard-maintenance

reviews.title: "Brown Mulch Affecting Plants"
reviews.text: Not too far back (02/16/18), I bought 20 or so 2cu ft bags of mulch from Lowe's. Normally I use Cypress Mulch but this year was trying something different. What I bought is labeled as Brown Mulch whose color is guaranteed for 12 months (perhaps not the exact wording). I find this "mulch" to be nothing more but chopped up dyed wood (my opinion).If the manufacturer's name is on the bag, it's in a foreign language... What I see, I can't pronounce.Today, doing yard work in the front yard, I noticed various plants that have their shoots turning brown, plants that I've had for years.... plants that normally thrive and reproduce with no effort on the homeowners part, plants that were transplanted from poolside of a former home to this with no fear of damage... and thrive they did at this present location for the past 20 years, and this pertains to seven or eight identical plants.Whether this mulch is killing the plants or simply discoloring them... At the present time, I do not know.Obviously something is wrong with the plants (all of them) and the only common denominator is this chopped up wood brown mulch of which I'll be tearing up shortly as yard debris pickup. Has anyone else encountered problems with their plants since using this Brown Mulch?
reviews.author: OMCJoe

reviews.title: "Purchased 45 bags for delivery"
reviews.text: I would say a good 70% of the black mulch had some white substance on it and a foul odor.  Extremely disappointed.
reviews.author: DJL70

reviews.title: "Garabage Mulch"
reviews.text: I bought this last year and was fine. Nice color and texture. I figured I would buy again this year and do more areas around the house and patio. The mulch wasn't even close -  very large pcs. of wood, mold, color not good, and even plastic bag pcs. mixed in. Couldn't spread with a rake because of chunks were too big and kept getting stuck in rake. Will never buy again!!!!!!!!
reviews.author: Unsatisfied

reviews.title: "Last year was a great mulch - this year AWFUL!"
reviews.text: We used this mulch on two previous occasions and it was great - a nice even black color that lasted for months before starting to fade a little. This year it is absolutely HORRIBLE - faded within days on HALF the yard. Yep, we have two tone mulch in our yard. It looks like we got halfway through and gave up, just the look we were going for - NOT! Would not recommend at all and will be going back to previous mulch since it was cheaper and I got the same result anyway. Not happy with how much we spent to end up with a really crappy looking result.
reviews.author: Caz1968

reviews.title: "ugly"
reviews.text: Put this down at my moms for her and the next week I saw it it was ugly..$2.00 a bag, its not even worth that..I only got 3 bags, and I'm happy I did because I was going to buy a lot more. but after seeing this I will spend more and get better stuff.
reviews.author: deb

reviews.title: "Premium Brown Mulch - WARNING"
reviews.text: I purchased this product on Sept 4, unloaded it from my auto, broke out in a rash on my upper chest/neck region within about 10 hours. Did not think anything of it. Sept 12 I spread 8 bags in a flower bed using gloves. Within about 12-15 hours I was covered in a bright red, severly itchy rash with huge welps from my knees to my neck. ER visits for IV steroids and Benadryl have cost me 600.00. I have never had a rash nor any allergies to anything and I am not a young woman! I am now having my home cleaned due to touching items after laying the mulch and searching for a crew to remove it. My fight for my life from this anaphylactic crisis is not over. Be very cautious when purchasing this product. We are currently in a search to find where this mulch came from and having it tested by an Environmental lab. Use caution!
reviews.author: Alive

reviews.title: "mold and spores"
reviews.text: Bought this in May 2016.  Used about 20 bags. Color was OK, but it does contain a LOT of large pieces of bark and a substantial amount of moldy pieces.  It did a fair job on keeping down weeds, but in a few days we saw a lot of patches of fungus. The mushrooms / fungus that started to grow is like NOTHING we have seen around here before: some very flat, dark brown and very slimy,  and some that are spiky looking with bright red and blue.I WOULD NOT BUY THIS AGAIN!!!!!!
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "Premium Black Mulch 12 month color guarantee"
reviews.text: This mulch is awful.thank goodness I only purchased two bags. I put it down and three days later we had a thunderstorm.it is now almost light gray. I am very disappointed. Also I paid the original price of $3.33 thinking it would be a better quality than the one 4 for $10. Was I wrong. They guarantee it will last 12 months. It didn't even last three days! Don't buy it!
reviews.author: Susan

reviews.title: "Worst... Mulch... Ever"
reviews.text: This is the worst mulch I have ever used in 13 plus years as a home owner. I was attracted to it because of the price, but that is the only good thing about it. My biggest gripe is that the wood pieces are very lightweight, and with every small gust of wind pieces of the mulch get blown into the yard. Moderate rainfall does the same. I spend more time raking the chips out of the lawn than actually mowing. My wife warned me about buying the cheapest item (and she is looking over my shoulder smirking right now) and I will say that I wish I had listened. Would not, and will not, buy again.
reviews.author: MattM

reviews.title: "Uneven colors"
reviews.text: I bought 8 bags to start with. Some bags were brownish black which was really obvious against the black mulch. I checked the bag and it's labeled black mulch. So watch out, it may not blend well. Some sections are really black and some has a hint of brown.
reviews.author: Linda

reviews.title: "Large pieces full of mold"
reviews.text: Please spend the extra money to get better than this.  I bought 20 bags last year. Huge pieces not mulched and full of bugs spiders and mold.
reviews.author: Steven

reviews.title: "Awful and Cheap"
reviews.text: I suppose if you're looking to cover some ground in a back lot or something this will do. If you're looking for a good looking mulch for your flower beds, spend the money and get Scott's. This garbage looks ok at best the first few days and then looks like gray shredded wood after the first rain. Large inconsistent pieces, terrible color hold and not worth the money even on sale. I would not recommend to a friend. In fact, I'd recommend staying away to a friend.
reviews.author: DA

reviews.title: "Not Bad for the price"
reviews.text: I recently purchased 260 bags of brown mulch. The color was more like dark brown/black. Ok I can deal with that. Normal brown would have been better but that is my problem. The issue here is that this product is more pulp wood than regular mulch. The mulch I have purchased in the past is double ground and is easy to spread. This mulch has way too much unground wood to called mulch. There are chunks of wood in some cases 6 to 7 in. long. After a light rain all you see are the unground pieces that are left. What mulch that was there is gone, mostly. But now I have learned another old lesson, you get what you pay for. So next time I will look for another source. I would not recommend the product.
reviews.author: Mulch

reviews.title: "Beautiful"
reviews.text: I have only had my mulch down for one week so I cannot attest to its colorfastness. However, it is beautiful in my flower garden. The color is a rich dark brown much like very fertile soil. I am very happy with my purchase of this mulch and I will go back and buy more.  Other reviewer's said that they found huge chunks of wood, door knobs, soda cans, and everything including the kitchen sink in their mulch. All I can say is that my 5 bags of mulch have been shredded to a uniform consistency, as they should be with no surprises. So far, I have found no soda cans, bowling balls, or kitchen sinks in any of my bags but I'm hoping to find gold nuggets and a winning lottery ticket in the next batch!
reviews.author: Linlin

reviews.title: "The Smell is Digusting"
reviews.text: I just put brown mulch down on my moms flowers bed. From the start, the odor was strong and similar to that of vinegar. I figured after a day the smell would be gone. It's been two days and it still smells like a mixture of manure and vinegar. I have no idea why it smells like that but I've never had mulch that smelled this way. There was also trash mixed in. I noticed it as I was spreading it around. No wonder the product is cheap. Lowe's should be ashamed for selling this garbage of a product.
reviews.author: Sharon

reviews.title: "NOT Black"
reviews.text: Just do not buy Black! I have used this product in the brown color for years and I love it.  The color is rich and lasts.  I lay down 3-4 inches, no fabric, and have no problem with weeds.  Skip the Black and go more natural with the brown.
reviews.author: utz

reviews.title: "Rocks and wire"
reviews.text: That's what we found in the bags we bought in Columbia, MO. Not really a good deal. Better mulch at Menards. How do I get a refund?
reviews.author: Rsbesalke

reviews.title: "Worst ever"
reviews.text: 12 months guaranteed!!!!! No color after one night rain it was like garbage. It ruined my garden. Returned some of them in bag .
reviews.author: Faromi

reviews.title: "Great Bang For the Buck."
reviews.text: I've bought maybe 15 bags of the brown mulch to heighten the appearance of the yard with the smallest amount of money. I found the mulch to do the trick. If you notice most of the negative comments about mold and inconsistency, are old. I think they might have improved the color and quality to last longer. I purchased the mulch maybe about two months ago and I haven't had any problems with fading or mold. We had a lot of rain the past couple of weeks and 80+ weather and gloomy days in between. The mulch I believe has a duration of about a year of when it'll need replacing, which is no big deal. I mean I got the bags during their Memorial day sales at 2.50 a bag so you won't hear me complaining.
reviews.author: Kristy

reviews.title: "Is this brand of mulch mixed with cow manure?"
reviews.text: As a new home owner and excited to add some do it yourself curb appeal, I purchased 5 bags of dark brown mulch for $10 during the Memorial Day Sale instead of going back to Home Depot were I purchased one bag just weeks earlier to add around a few scrubs (that had no smell) I was thinking mulch is mulch right? WRONG!! 4 of the 5 sealed bags were very wet and leaked a dark brown liquid into my trunk and garage leaving behind an awful stain and stench. After lining my patio with the mulch sitting outside to enjoy my morning cup of coffee is no longer an option unless you like the whole barn yard smell. I am very disappointed to see a review from 2013 from the same area (Concord,NC) where I purchase from that two years later the smell is still an issue. I hope it drys out and the smell will fade but will it smell the same every time it rains or I water my scrubs I have to wonder...
reviews.author: NewHomeOwner

reviews.title: "Terrible product"
reviews.text: I bought 15 bags and put them out in flower beds around our house, deck, and driveway...After scattering the product, my wife noticed that is was full of bugs...I notified Lowe's and they gave me a bottle of bug spray that you attach to your water and said use this....oh yeah they also refunded me 25% of my purchase price....so now I have an infestation of clover mites, millipedes, and the other bugs I haven't identified..that I have to take care of...I also have a dog that I don't like being out where I have to spray...I have always used pine needles until this spring... but even if I ever use mulch again it won't be this brand and it sure won't be from Lowe's..I tried to get them to send someone out to take care of it but they said no...Oh I also noticed some color differences....suppose to be guaranteed fora year..and it's black...some of it came out of the bag with a brown tint
reviews.author: Mark

reviews.title: "JUNK"
reviews.text:
I bought this mulch last year when it was on sale, there was ground up rotting wooden fence posts chunks of wooden pallets, some the size of my fist. I'll spend the extra money and by the Scotts mulch from Home Depot.
I see some of these reviews go back years so obviously Lowes is not interested in rectifying the problem. Even on sale for two dollars a bag this mulch is still junk.
reviews.author: Layter

reviews.title: "No problems"
reviews.text: I live near Fresno and bout 150 bags of the brown mulch to spread over a 1500 sq ft front yard. I took 25 bags at a time over a period of several days. I experienced none of the problems that other reviews have discussed. It was all consistently brown mulch with any variation in color due to the degree of moisture in the bag. Overall, it looks excellent and if it goes on sale again I will buy more
reviews.author: profesrebel

reviews.title: "Termites in the mulch, not worth the price!!!"
reviews.text: So mad- I would give this no stars if I could! Started to put down the mulch I bought on sale - looked lovely 3 bags in until I started seeing a bunch of termites all over before they burrowed back under the newly put down mulch!!!!!!!! Seriously the worst feeling in the world and super scary- had to run to buy termite killer/ spray, but with the on/ off rain wondering in the back of my head if I killed them or not. :(  Will never buy this brand again sale or no sale!!!!
reviews.author: NJHomeOwner

reviews.title: "Mulch Is Mulch"
reviews.text: I have a 1/4 acre yard, I have used this mulch for years. Sometimes it is "perfect" and sometimes not so. Let's not forget that this IS mulch. With a layer of weed cloth and a thick layer of mulch, weeds don't stand a chance. Ones that do pop up, you just easily pull them out. It does a great job at keeping me from doing the yearly Spring "weeding". When ever it goes on sale, I stock up knowing I will use it. The more I mulch, the happier the garden is, the less water I use, the less working I do, leaving me more time for fishing... It does the job of conserving water and keeping the roots cool from the Summer heat. You must use weed cloth underneath this mulch or you are just wasting your time because the weeds WILL grow in the mulch...
reviews.author: MrCee

reviews.title: "black mulch"
reviews.text: The dark mulch lookec great when we put it out. It did not take long for it to fade to a some what brown color. But it will do and will probably purchase again next year.
reviews.author: rayyyy

reviews.title: "Mulch"
reviews.text: We bought this mulch thinking it was going to be very nice, but when we opened it and started pouring it out, we found chunks of wood, rocks, big rocks, not pebbles, pencils attempted to be ground up, sticks, there is nothing remotely close to being shredded like most mulch.  This is no where near premium mulch, it is very poorly shredded mulch. We will be using a different product moving forward!  We do not recommend to buy!  We are putting a much better quality mulch on top of this to hide it!!!!!
reviews.author: csrgirl

reviews.title: "Don't buy this! Color runs everywhere!"
reviews.text: We bought several bags of this brown mulch on sale at Lowe's. We spread it in the garden and noticed the brown color coming off on our hands immediately. The paint gets everywhere including our shoes. What will this runny color do to our vegetables? What about pets? Lowe's should pull this off the shelves at once. The bag says it contains "natural forest products and colorant." "Natural" is an undefined term in commerce. There is no ID of the colorant used. We think it is cheap dye - country of origin not disclosed on the bag. Don't buy this mulch unless you want stain everywhere!
reviews.author: Asheville

reviews.title: "SMELLS HORRIBLE"
reviews.text:
The mulch was piled high at my local Lowes store. I bought 6 bags and when I opened them to lay the mulch there was a HORRIBLE smell. I can still smell this from having an open window in the house. In the past I have always bought brand name mulch and never had this issue. I did google why this happened and this is what I found:

http://www.gardening.cornell.edu/factsheets/mulch/toxicmulch.html


The bags of mulch at my local store were exposed to the rain and also piled high which caused them to sour. This bag mulch will kill your plants - DO NOT BUY!!!!
reviews.author: marieno

reviews.text: i thought it was good mulch untill i found this in it.
reviews.author: mike

reviews.title: "It's good, but it has its problems"
reviews.text: This is the third year that we have purchased this brand of mulch in brown.  The mulch is cheaper then the rest in price and   The mulch itself is good. It's nicely shredded and in all of our past years of purchases, we had never had Any issues with trash or nails or other items being in the mulch.   My one biggest complaint would be even though the mulch is guaranteed to keep its color for one year, every year that we have purchased it, the color fades a shade or two I mmediately after any heavy rain. Even with the color washing off, Overall it's a good hardwood mulch at a cheap price.
reviews.author: Greg

reviews.title: "Mulch Has Many Attributes!"
reviews.text: I bought red, black and brown. I use the colors in different places in my front and back yards.This mulch Inhibits weed germination and growth. It holds in soil moisture, protecting your plants from drying out . It moderates soil-temperature fluctuations that happen in winter and summer. I think it looks neat and attractive in my yard.
reviews.author: Mari

reviews.title: "Flunk"
reviews.text: Used this mulch along one side of the house where I have ground rose bushes.  A few weeks later, I noticed the bushes looked bad.  Closer inspection revealed saw fly larvae on the bushes. Had to treat them for weeks with horticultural oil but was able to save them.  I had used a competitor mulch on the other side of the house and there were no problems.  This mulch should be sanitized!
reviews.author: Papa

reviews.title: "works for me"
reviews.text: I thought this was a good deal and I wanted black mulch (I am 70 years old...no kidding) and since I still love doing thing in my yard, I bought 10 bags....well that turned into another 10 and finally another 12. My yard looked great and it is one year later and with all the snow and stuff and it's April now... it still looks good. Yes, some of it had some white stuff, but the size and texture of the chips was great and it looks just as good today as it did when I put it down last year. No kidding.
reviews.author: KY

reviews.title: "No Problems Here"
reviews.text: I put down 45 bags of this stuff last summer and it still looks better than the new mulch my neighbor used. I bough another 10 bags this week and I'm getting more tomorrow. Don't know why everyone else is complaining. Maybe different areas get mulch from different suppliers? Haven't had any odor problems either.
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "Does not retain color"
reviews.text: Do not buy if color is a requirement, color did not last one day before the brown faded out, very disappointed more like a 12 hour color guarantee. Surprised Lowe's continues to carry this product with this type of warranty my guess after spreading no one goes back to complain nor do they want to remulch their property. It's mulch for that I would give it a 1/2 star if I could.
reviews.author: nick

reviews.title: "Don't Expect The Best"
reviews.text: My wife and I recently bought 30 bags of the Home Depot version of this mulch at the same price and were very satisfied with the product.  We decided to do another area of our yard but when we went back to buy more we were told they were sold out.  We then went to the nearby Lowes since it was advertised at the same price and I was of the opinion it would by the same quality.  Long story short . . . . . It looked about the same, however it was far more messy to work with and had a horrible smell.  Although the color is about the same, we much preferred the mulch from the supplier at HD.  We did not see any visible bugs as noted in some of the other reviews.  Overall . . . it is mulch at a fair price.
reviews.author: gardenman

reviews.title: "Very Bad Smell!"
reviews.text: I bought 20 bags to do a few beds by the entrance of my driveway. By the time I got to my house the smell in my van was unbearable. Mulch appeared to be wet when I put it out but the smell was like very strong cow manure. It has been 4 weeks, I have bleached the inside of my van, ionized the air, and sprayed odor ban, and I can still detect the smell. The smell from the mulch in the flower beds will gag you when you walk by. $2 a bag seems cheap but I would not take it for free! I have used the mulch from Lowes in the past without problems,but never again!
reviews.author: silverdan

reviews.title: "Great When It's On Sale for $2"
reviews.text: Amazing value at $2.00 which happens at least twice per year.  Combine that with a coupon code and you have an amazing value that lasts for a year.  You find find better mulch for $27/yard.  Besides, who wants a big pile dumped in their driveway??  That's a lot of senseless work.  Individual bags are a huge time saver.  Would never pay regular price for this stuff, though.
reviews.author: JamesH

reviews.title: "black color can't last"
reviews.text: Bought 4 bags in Lowes. Black mulch placed in flower beds on a Sunday. Rainstorm came at night and black color toatally washed out. Twelve month guarantee for colors????? bad purchased. Are they able to refund???
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Just Awful!"
