reviews.text: This product has huge chunky pieces that looks like terribly shredded pallets. There were some pieces that had red paint on them. I will NEVER buy this again! There is nothing "Premium" about this mulch and the color was never there to even last for 12 hours. Pulling this up and getting something else!
reviews.author: vdal

reviews.title: "Quality product for a great price"
reviews.text: I have read some of the negative reviews. Some were legitimate and some give me pause to understand why the purchasers were upset. I used to live in the mountains of North Carolina and had a chain saw and a chipper shredder. Speaking only as one who made his own mulch, most people don't understand that it takes a lot of effort and time to create the equivalent of 10 bags of mulch. Therefore, the price, particularly, when on sale, is an excellent value. I have found trash in my bags, but only sporadically, and I remove it. Sure, there are some big pieces, but big deal. Remove them or put them in the back. I have bought the brown bag mulch from Lowe's for the last 10 years and will continue to buy from them. I have made my own mulch, and buying it from Lowe's it so much easier with little effort involved. They will even load it in your car/truck for you. All you have to do is unload at your house and put the bags in the area where you want to mulch. No brainer. Recommend!
reviews.author: Stretch

reviews.title: "Great Mulch"
reviews.text: I have used this mulch the past two seasons and have nothing but great things to say about it. I had to buy 55 bags of the stuff to cover all of my beds but it lasts an entire year, unlike pine straw. The color does fade a bit but that's what the sun does to everything. Expecting it to stay 100% black all year is really unrealistic. I will be buying some more this year.
reviews.author: Daner30

reviews.title: "Worst mulch on the market"
reviews.text: We bought 20 bags of black to freshen up the mulch in our front yard at our new house. It had a smell like some kind of paint thinner and tar. 10 minutes after putting it down the color started turning brown. I found construction debris and rocks , huge pieces of wood and mold. Gonna take it out and get stone then i wont have to fool with all this nasty stuff anymore.
reviews.author: uhappyinky

reviews.title: "Bought the black mulch"
reviews.text: Read the mixed reviews and decided to buy anyway . Mulch still looks good . Everyone wants to find a deal and want their yard to look good . But I think that people can also be a little unrealistic about what they are buying . You are buying a $2 /$3 bag of mulch not a $20 bag of mulch . I buy it for weed control as much as the color and hope the color  lasts for the spring / summer .
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Bad product"
reviews.text: Bought 20 bags layer it out looked good. It rained overnight next day the milch looked like it was 2 yes old gray. The pieces when big chunk would not call this mulch, especially not premium mulch.
reviews.author: Magilla60

reviews.title: "Premium Mulch - Brown"
reviews.text: Read a ton of "not so good" reviews before making a decision on this mulch and due to such, was very hesitant to purchase the Premium Mulch - Brown color.Went to my local Lowe's store to view it personally in the bags. There were a couple of bags torn open on the stack / pallet so I could actually see close up what I was thinking about buying. I did not see any type of bugs, termites, big hunks of bark, cow manure or any other additives within the bags, just brown mulch as was reported / mentioned in some of the reviews, so thought that was a good thing. I also actually smelt the mulch up close to see if any mildew odor or any odor present for that matter. What I did smell was a fresh, woody type smell, almost cedar smell which one would think that is a good thing since it is a wood product. After an extensive look, smell, etc of the open bagged mulch, I purchased 12 bags which Lowe's loaded in my vehicle for me as they are pretty heavy, but this mulch had no water in the bags or leaks at all. Once back home, it was spread out in my landscaping and it looked really nice and refreshed, almost like a professional just did the job but not because I did it, the product just simply made a world of difference to the curb appeal of the home and I was very pleased with the outcome!Although some bags at some locations/states may differ and would relate those reviews to that reason; the ones I bought were right on the money and a great price during Labor Day holiday sales in central S.C.I would recommend this particular mulch for sure, but as always, look #and smell#..before you buy it and you shouldn't go wrong at all!
reviews.author: HappyOne

reviews.title: "Garbage"
reviews.text: I bought 10 bags of this mulch. I will say that the price was good but it was terrible there was so much Garbage in it and I mean Garbage. I found part of plastic toys part of aluminum cÃ ns and the product consisted of large sticks. I didn't get the coverage I use to. I would say you get what you pay for but to be honest my mother-in-law bought mulch at the same price from Home Depot and she said it was great not full of the big sticks and definitely  no GARBAGE. I was very disappointed.
reviews.author: Beth

reviews.title: "Poison Oak"
reviews.text: Bought 40 bags.  I'm fine with the the way it looks but it seems that there was some poison oak that somehow was ground up in at least one or more of the bags.  Needless to say if you are using this be sure to use gloves, and long sleeves.  Not a bad mulch but word to the wise...
reviews.author: CRM

reviews.title: "Lots of junk in the "premium" mulch"
reviews.text: I am finding lots of junk in the bags lately.  Plastic toys pieces, plastic hanger piece, plastic from garbage bags, wood that looks like pallets, rocks, aluminum can pieces, etc... I ordered 40 bags and the majority had a few pieces of garbage.
reviews.author: MATt

reviews.title: "Absolute garbage"
reviews.text: I purchased Scotts mulch beforehand and had zero problems. I go back to the store to get mulch, they're out of Scotts and give me this. Okay, whatever...a) bags are only 75% fullb) mulch does NOT spreadc) color varied with every bagd) does not spread evenly. Looks like shredded cratese) does not cover as much of an area as Scottsf) has a distinct, smelly odorDid not have a favorable experience with this product
reviews.author: BD

reviews.title: "Lost all color"
reviews.text: I applied this mulch 2 days ago. Yesterday it rained. Today there is absolutely no color in the mulch I just put down. The mulch from last year looks better than what is 2 days old. I only hope the color that washed away doesn't kill the bushes I put it around.
reviews.author: Disappointed

reviews.title: "Good mulch"
reviews.text: Used for simple edging project around my shed and house with a few plants. Easy to use, no bugs or anything. Great value for the bags -- I was considering the farm down the road that sold mulch, but these bags seemed a big bigger for a few cents less. Only issue I had was that I estimated I needed 150 sq. ft., and based on the 12 sq. ft. coverage listing, I ended up with 4 extra bags. Maybe I didn't add it as thick as I should have. No biggie, I'll use it next year or around the tree in the front yard.
reviews.author: dickhouse

reviews.title: "Fantastic for the price"
reviews.text: We loved the color, texture and look of this mulch. the price was fantastic too. The color is a true dark brown. We used Scotts Nature Scape Deep Forest Brown for years at double the price and Scotts Deep Forest Brown seems to get more red than brown every year.We will continue to get this mulch (Premium Dark Brown Hardwood) in the future.
reviews.author: Docmary

reviews.title: "Color Faded FAST!!"
reviews.text: Installed 5 days ago.  After 2 days of minimal rain..the color has faded to grey. I have never seen this type of fading before..especially just after putting it down. I will not purchase this product in the future.
reviews.author: Franky

reviews.title: "I didn't know plastic grew in the forest"
reviews.text: Even though this product has received mediocre ratings, I decided to buy 4 bags.Well, you get what you pay for.One bag had rocks, another had glass, and plastic.I thought people were exaggerating, but no they weren't.For a product labeled as "100% forest material", I didn't know plastic, glass, and drywall grew in the forest.
reviews.author: Nisky12304

reviews.title: "Worse Than What I Replaced"
reviews.text: I purchased 16 bags from the Jefferson City location on 4/27/2019.  As always, I removed some of the old mulch to maintain the same depth. The first couple bags were just ok in color. The next several had so much mold that I decided not to use in the flower beds visible from the street. The quality of the new mulch was much worse than the year old mulch I previously removed. Imagine my disappointment. I will never purchase this brand again. Buyer beware, complete garbage!
reviews.author: KGS

reviews.title: "Terrible product and guarentee"
reviews.text: Bag says it has12 month guarentee color. Mine lasts maybe 5 months. I call today to get store credit directly from the producer and they say they will only refund half the bags. Terrible product and terrible company. Would not use any of their colors. False guarentee.
reviews.author: Matt

reviews.title: "Still looks great!"
reviews.text: I've had this mulch down for about 1 month and even with all the rain that has fallen, the color still looks great!
reviews.author: Kate

reviews.title: "Absolute junk"
reviews.text: Spend a little more money and get something better. This stuff is trash, figuratively and literally. It's like they took a bunch of unused lumber and other odds and ends, spray painted it and tossed it in the world's worst chipper shredder. Pieces are terribly inconsistently sized, several of the bags have miscellaneous bits of trash in them, and you're bound to get a few bags with fungus clinging to the pieces of "mulch." Furthermore, it does not block weed growth worth a darn and it becomes discolored within just a few days. I only bought this a few weeks ago and I'm already working on replacing it.
reviews.author: Jeff

reviews.title: "Frustrated"
reviews.text: Let me start off by saying I purchased this mulch 3 different times each time hoping when I went back it would be better but it wasn't. The first time I went to Lowe's and purchase this mulch because it was on sale I got 40 bags all of them were the same except the section I put those 40 bags in are covered in mushrooms right now which is very frustrating! The second time I went back which was 3 days later I got another 20 bags out of the same been the same brand of mulch and I got three different textures of mulch in three different colors of brown. I went back 2 weeks later to get some more for the backyard because I while I needed it to match as close as possible and again I have two different types of mulch textures and four of the bags had bugs flying all over the place when I took it out. I do not blame Lowes for this it's not there mulch but I do see a lot of reviews on here that there's a problem here with this company. I don't understand why they still carry it. With all the work and labor it took for me to put out 70 + bags it would have been nice to have healthy mulch that was all the same.
reviews.author: Vicko

reviews.title: "Extra work"
reviews.text: I purchased many, many bags of brown mulch last year to cover flower beds and yard areas I did not want grass to grow. The mulch looked nice but this spring, I had a crop of weeds that you would not believe in these areas. Below the mulch, I heavily layered newspaper so the weed seeds had to be in the mulch. Very disappointing since the object of putting out mulch is too not have to weed so much. I have purchased mulch from Lowe's for many years and this is the first time this has happened. I hope Lowe's will go back to the providers and advise them of this inferior product.
reviews.author: JeanSC

reviews.title: "terrible quality"
reviews.text: Purchased 20 bags of the black mulch saturday, rained sunday, brown monday. Waste of money.
reviews.author: Pete

reviews.title: "This turns brown in less than a week"
reviews.text: I purchased this mulch and in less than one week it turned from black to brown. Compared to the Preen mulch I purchased and installed a month ago, the preen is still black and looks great and this looks terrible. I would not recommend this to anyone.
reviews.author: UpstateNY

reviews.title: "It works fine"
reviews.text: I am not a professional landscaper by any means, but for basic use around the house, it works just fine.I've been using this product for 3 years because I maulch every other year, and it gets the job done.
reviews.author: Prez

reviews.title: "Mukch away"
reviews.text: 30 bags later, it's all spread, and easily covered the entire area that we were "mulching." Looks very good on the ground. Hope the black color lasts for at least one year, preferably two. Bags are heavy for old folks like us, so have a young son, nephew, grandson available for the lugging. Or, purchase, borrow or filch a wheelbarrow to make things easier. Wear gloves as the hand, cuticles, fingernails will be black from the dye. Better yet, have someone else do the work, then sit back and admire your finished product!!!
reviews.author: stouty

reviews.title: "Looks Great I will be getting more to finish up"
reviews.text: I bought 70 bags when it was onsale as the new house we bought needed all new mulch put down. Wish I had bought more as I only got about 2/3 of the house done. It looks great and after reading some of the other reviews I payed close attention as I opened each bag for any signs of termites or any other insects. I never saw a single one. The shredding is not 100% uniform through the bags and you get variations from larger pieces to more finely shredded. However I wasn't buying nor did I was all finely shredded and I find the variants actually looks good when it is all down.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Black Mulch Looks Rich"
reviews.text: Just spread 20 bags of premium black mulch around all our landscaping beds. WOW! Black really enhances the colors throughout the yard. Black mulch makes a perfect background for the red dogwoods, hostas, peonies & arborvite. Each bag of mulch was shredded evenly in small sizes. The color was also even in every bag. Can't wait for the other periennials to come up.
reviews.author: Maggie

reviews.title: "Termites"
reviews.text: I got at least one bag that had termites. I start checking bags content and pay more attention after I read the reviews. Used to be great mulch few years ago. Now quality is different and the subterranean termites were there, as others stated. I am concerned and sad.
reviews.author: itsonfile

reviews.title: "Wet, black dirt"
reviews.text: This is not mulch. It was very wet, decomposed wood product. It had formed wet. muddy clumps in the bags. I got 20 bags, so this was not one bag being bad, they were all like that. It was difficult to get out of the bags becuase it was s sticky. Then it sat on the ground in clots that you had to try to break up. It was like spreading cake icing. I will never buy this product again.
reviews.author: grnwnv

reviews.title: "NOT BAD MULCH WHEN LOWE'S HAS IT ON SALE:"
reviews.text: I prefer cypress mulch, but understand the eco aspects and settled for this one because Lowe's had it on sale for $2.00 a bag. My preference would be the rubber mulch, but after putting 230 bags of it around the house, my budget was a little tight. So far I have put out about 100 bags of this mulch, and it looks pretty good (dark brown color). I still have about 50 more bags to go, and will wait for it to go on sale again before buying more. One thing I have noticed is that critters do not like to scrounge in the rubber mulch as much as the natural kind. Maybe the smell has something to do with it. All in all, I can say it has met expectations. I can recommend. And, one thing I always do before mowing, is to go around all the flower beds and rake any mulch that has spilled out, natural and rubber, back up in the beds. You have to try to keep from blowing it away when mowing. Maybe a little OCD here.....
reviews.author: whitinski01

reviews.title: "Black mulch"
reviews.text: We bought 42 bags of this mulch. First we got only 10 because of the reviews here, but once we opened them, went back to the store to get the rest. The whole summer past and the mulch is still looking black and perfect on our front yard.  I will come back in Spring to post another comment, and let you know if the color is still there. By the way, we live in South Lyon, Mi.Sergio.
reviews.author: Sergio

reviews.title: "termite infested mulch"
reviews.text: Be forwarned! This mulch was infested with termites.I raced to remove the mulch before the termites got into the ground.
reviews.author: CC

reviews.title: "Mulch"
reviews.text: Bought 40 bags of this product. I would estimate half of it was white in color. Not sure if that was some type of mold or what. I noticed lots of plastic, foil and pieces of paper in it also. I will never buy this product again and will definitely not recommend it. Very disappointed.
reviews.author: Karla

reviews.title: "Find Something Else!! DANGEROUS!!"
reviews.text: I bought 25 bags to use around landscaping for our 4th of July party. Noticed multiple cases of black dyed trash is bags when spreading... and then I saw it... 4 SHARP peices of GLASS in one bag. These people should not be manufacturing and bagging mulch! Find something else!
reviews.author: Nate

reviews.title: "Great color and coverage. No plastic like others"
reviews.text: I bought 20 bags on sale for $2.00 each and covered a large area with them. It was all super clean with a nice color. There were no plastic bits like some of the other brands. No frisbees, no soda can bits, no spoons and forks, just what I paid for. I'm on my way to buy some more.
reviews.author: JohnnyBlaze

reviews.title: "Save your money"
reviews.text: I bought 8 bags of this and have to say I expected better. I have never used a mulch that smelled as bad as this one does. Don't know what it is but as soon as it was spread out the flies started showing up. Tried spraying with a hose to settle everything and the minute the water touched it the color ran off. Have never had this happen before. Will not be buying this again!
reviews.author: Red1

reviews.title: "Good quality mulch for price"
reviews.text: Good quality mulch for the price when compared to the higher priced mulch. With lowes coupon picked it for $1.60 a bag and when compared to bulk I saved approx 40%.
reviews.author: DJ10848

reviews.title: "Great Value"
reviews.text: For the price, this mulch is a great value. For $2 to $2.50 a bag, I'm not sure exactly how premium of mulch some of these reviewers were expecting. I have been purchasing this mulch for the last several years, and I have been pleased overall. Some folks have commented the color faded by the next day, but that is just the mulch drying out after being moist in the bag. I look for mulch that will not add weeds to my flower beds, and this fits the bill.
reviews.author: MCox

reviews.title: "After the first rain the color was gone"
reviews.text: I had read many comments that said the same but I gave the vote of confidence and the same product failure, after the first rain fell, it lost a lot of color.
reviews.author: Sanjuanero

reviews.title: "The Word Premium Says It All"
reviews.text: I purchased twenty bags of the brown mulch when it was on sale.  I used it in the flower beds along the fence line in my backyard.  I was very pleased with the quality of the product.  The color was dark, the mulch was of a consistent size and did not have any "junk" in it.  The pieces were smaller than what I have purchased in the past nor had any pieces that looked like shredded wood or pallets.  I think the word Premium in the title says it all.  I would highly recommend this product to anyone wanting a good looking mulch.  I am going back to get another ten bags.
reviews.author: UtahGrandma

reviews.title: "Nails"
reviews.text: On a whim I decided to purchase 5 bags of this junk to use in a flower bed, in the process of dispersing it and I came across several nails, luckily the flower bed I was using it in was at the back of the yard so the quality of the product wasn't a huge issue.
reviews.author: supersizeme

reviews.title: "Color doesn't last"
reviews.text: I put this product in some flower gardens and within a week between the lite rain and what ever it is now a light brown don't waste your money i still have 15 more bags to put down but will not be and the guarantee is useless Loews will not refund the money
reviews.author: McZeke

reviews.title: "For $2 it's ok!"
reviews.text: I should have bought more of the Scotts nature scape mulch when it was on sale for $2 a bag a few weeks ago. This brand looks like it comes from chopped up pallets and even still has a nail in it.
reviews.author: Rich

reviews.title: "Poor quality product"
reviews.text: I purchased some of this from Lowes and it is awful...poor grade and quality of product.It is the "junk" of whatever they want to pack in the bags. Long branches, just junk.Stick with the name brands and what you know.
reviews.author: Gardner

reviews.title: "Excellent ground cover"
reviews.text: I purchased the Black Mulch last summer for a high traffic area in the front yard. The land scaping is visibule to the whole neighborhood. The Black still retains its original color, looks nice. I had trees to plant in the early fall and purchased additional Black Mulch because the tree base is highly visible. Good product.
reviews.author: MustangP51d

reviews.title: "Poor Quality-Wrong Color"
reviews.text: I bought this 'premium' mulch because I needed a LOT and it was finally on sale. There were some huge sticks in it that I really couldn't use as mulch. He color does fade quickly but the worst was that several bags were a totally different color!!  The bags were all purchased at the same place and time and all were labeled "dark brown". Several bags were nearly black and so far off from the brown that I had to buy more to cover it so it would look uniform. I'm pretty disappointed but couldn't go buy all new mulch to replace this.
reviews.author: livestrong3c

reviews.title: "GOOD MULCH FOR THE PRICE. RECOMMENDED"
reviews.text: I read most of the negative reviews before purchasing. I imagine this product is purchased and bagged by Lowes by different suppliers in the US. I live in California and found the product to be worth the sales price of $2 per bag. I purchased 12 bags and spread in my planter areas. I only found 3-4 larger pieces that I broke down into small bits. I have used this before in my other planters. After almost one year the color is still full and I never seen weeds come through. I would recommend this product for the price as the next comparable product id $4.63 per bag.
reviews.author: Elvis

reviews.title: "What Happened?"
reviews.text: This is the 3rd year I've been using this Premium Brown Mulch. I never left a review, but I loved the product. The sales are great when you can get it for $2 a bag. In the past, the mulch was nicely ground, albeit the dye does leach out when the bags are wet. I got some bags early this spring - most likely leftover stock - and it was fine. However, with my recent purchase, I was very disappointed. Like a previous reveiwer stated, this mulch was not Premium! It had large pieces and chunks of wood and didn't spread very far. I even found a long piece of twisted copper wire in one bag! I suspect Lowe's changed their supplier, but not the bag labeling as Premium mulch. A good value still if you don't mind having to buy extra bags to get the coverage you want.
reviews.author: Ledfether

reviews.title: "Smells and Flies"
reviews.text: Bought 75 bags when it was on sale, good price and it looks good from the street. The bad, as soon as it got wet the first time we noticed a manure smell.  Then came the flies, and then more flies...still dealing with the fly problem a month later.
reviews.author: TraumaRN

reviews.title: "garbage"
reviews.text: Placed 25 bags Saturday. Rained Sunday. Monday it looked like year old mulch that needed replacing. Utter junk. Lowes should be ashamed to sell this crap.
reviews.author: l

reviews.title: "In Colorado, mulch was GREAT!"
reviews.text: Like everyone else, I was a bit wary on the very mixed reviews this mulch received but decided there were enough good reviews to outweigh the bad so I decided to go with it, especially since it was 1/2 the price of the bulk mulch from the landscaping places.I bought and spread 84 bags of mulch and all of them were just fine, I'm happy to report.  2 of the particularly wet ones had a very small amount of white mold but I've bought other mulch that has had the same thing.  It has dried out no problems.No bugs or pests of any kind in any of the bags.  I found 3 or 4 items across the 84 bags that were trash--a bottle cap, things like that--but overall, I was very pleased and at least in Colorado, definitely recommend it.
reviews.author: KellyAAM

reviews.title: "Do not buy, poor quality"
reviews.text: They say, "You get what you pay for" and that is SO true with this mulch. I have been mulching the area around my home for over 13 years and this has to be the worst mulch I've ever purchased. There are HUGE chunks of wood, some up to 8 inches long, as well as what appears to be parts of pallets that are painted red and blue among the mulch. There are also rounded parts of branches up to 6 inches long. I won't be back for this next year, I don't care if they are giving it away for free.
reviews.author: Cathe

reviews.title: "Construction debris"
reviews.text: Bought 4 bags in April 2017 at Woburn, MA store. Construction debris present in the bag.
reviews.author: Vlad

reviews.title: "Really Black until it dries out."
reviews.text: Lots of large chunks of limbs, bark and some stuff that I couldn't determine what it was. Even found some stones and in one bag a rock 4 to 5 inches in diameter and weighed over a pound. The mulch is damp to wet out of the bag and is really black. However, as soon as the sun hits it and dries it out the black is about 1/2 of what it was out of the bag. I would recommend it provided you realize this is not the triple ground fine mulch.
reviews.author: Glen

reviews.title: "Great for a physical weed block"
reviews.text: This âmulchâ is dyed scrap wood from what I can tell. The upside to that is that is that it doesn't compost as quickly as a more organic mulch would, so it can last over a year. I do NOT use it near small plants or bushes I want to encourage to thrive, but I DO use it under some Ashe Junipers and other areas where I just need a weed/ grass block.  It maintains its color better if you keep it dry for a few days after you spread it.
reviews.author: Wizkid

reviews.title: "Perfect Color"
reviews.text: Perfect consistent dark color and small chips that compliment my landscaping.
reviews.author: JBear

reviews.title: "Watch out"
reviews.text: I purchased 75 bags and picked up 25 at a time over 3 trips.  The first 50 bags were trash and the black die was wet and not set in the wood.  These bags had large pieces of wood and clearly were not properly prepared for sale.  The final 25 bags that I picked up were perfect!  The wood in this group of 25 bags were properly prepared and the back die was set in the wood.  It looks like Lowes elected to sale hurricane recycled wood that was not correctly processed for sale under the âpackaging marketingâ printed on the bags.
reviews.author: Jim

reviews.title: "You Get what you pay for"
reviews.text:
I used this mulch once and doubt it is hardwood mulch. Every bag I opened had 4 and 5 inch pieces of 2x4's in them, some even longer. There are not a lot of hard wood 2x4's used in the building trade. (too expensive)
The color fades quickly and just not worth using. The Scotts Earth Grow mulch is much better!
reviews.author: Maxl

reviews.title: "Color Faded Within 12 Hours"
reviews.text: I've bought mulch for 20+ years and know good mulch from bad mulch.  When the product I wanted and have used the past two year wasn't on sale, at the urging of the store manager, I purchased 38 bags of this Preen product and put 20 down in late afternoon the same day.  It rained at 2:00 a.m. that night.  The next morning when I went to look at it I was stunned by how much brown color had washed away after one rain shower.  A different brand mulch from Lowe's I've had down for 14 months looks better than this product that wasn't on the ground for 14 hours.  I returned the remaining 18 bags.  Also, beware that this product is more of a hybrid mix of wood chips and wood mulch, not purely wood mulch. The remains of chopped up pallets and old lumber are very evident.
reviews.author: Autoreset

reviews.title: "Good Deal"
reviews.text: I purchased the black mulch on sale for $1 off. I got 12 bags. Wish I had gotten double. The mulch was a good consistency and had no "trash" in it. Has rained several times and color is still true. I'm going to go get more and pay the full price so I can finish my flower beds before the weeds take over again.
reviews.author: GrammyPammy

reviews.title: "No fading and an attractive addition."
reviews.text: At first I wondered if it would fade but decided to give it a try.  very pleased with my decision a year later it is still black.  Others are adding this color to their yards because of what they have seen. no difficulties with trash or debris included in our bags and there was no fading after rain. There are pine needles lying on top of the mulch from last night's storm.  This photo is current a year after laying the mulch.
reviews.author: Oursommerhome

reviews.title: "Decent"
reviews.text: I've used about 10 bags to mix in and touch up the mulch I purchased from a local mulch maker. This mulch seems fine to me. The quality is perfectly fair for the price and other than a little mold which was easily removable, Ive had no issues. I'm in Portland OR, and think the quality changes drastically based on region. After one year (mind you it rains 6 months straight here), it's still reasonably black. My neighbor has brown mulch and this black mulch is still darker. I'd recommend this product.
reviews.author: SCMX

reviews.title: "Color IS not an issue"
reviews.text:
I am transitioning to Black Hardwood Mulch from Cypress. Spring 2015 mulched tree rings with this product Spring 2016 I am doing beds. Since several reviews were about color shades I put a new bag down next to the old much, let it dry for a few days then came back and checked on color. After a year I had less weathering then with Cypress (golden to silver) and was nearly the same shade as new mulch Black Five Stars 

Color not issue. I mulch a LOT have to buy 5 pallets a year and rotate beds. I prefer the ease of bags over bulk. Sure it cost more but so does labor. 

Last people complained about trash in the mulch. TRUE I had a few treasures, from shirts to bottles to just junk but for as many bags as I placed it did not fill a single bag and was so easy to pick out. Mulching is a dirty job and you have plenty of bags left over in which to place this trash.
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "Weed generator"
reviews.text: We have used this mulch for 6 years. This year I purchased  140 bags. Two pallets plus!  In the past it has been pretty good mulch when on sale. This year the mulch came contaminated with wire grass seeds. A very nasty week to get rid of and in spite of pulling hundreds of stalks and using round up we are still fighting this weed. This mulch needs to inspected by Lowe's. You put mulch down to control weeds not generate them!!!!
reviews.author: SJ

reviews.title: "Satisfied"
reviews.text: I bought Lowe's mulch and was very happy with it. I had no problems with fading, insects or consistency of size. I would recommend it and will buy it again soon as it goes on sale.
reviews.author: Liz

reviews.title: "Contaminated"
reviews.text: Bought 20 bags from Lowes. 3rd bag opened had some kind of white spores growing on the mulch. 6th bag opened as I began to spread found a syringe. Yep!  This is contaminated. Only gave 1 star because you can't give it 0.
reviews.author: Zekethefreak

reviews.title: "Rocks in mulch"
reviews.text: I have bought quite a few bags of this brand of mulch.  I found so many rocks in the bags that I took a picture of how many I collected.  Also found plastic and a big hunk of solid metal.  Very disappointed.  Mulching is a hard enough job without having to constantly pick out foreign debris.  Will avoid using this brand in the future.
reviews.author: SW

reviews.title: "Cheap but garbage"
reviews.text: Despite the temptation to buy this for its cheap price, avoid if possible. The bags I picked up came off of a fresh stack, had to cut the wrapping off the pallet. 4 out of 10 bags had white mold, probably not so great for the plants in my flower beds. Every single bag had a decent number of wood blocks the size of my forearm, seemed like half a bag of firewood instead of mulch.  And I even had several large pieces of sharp broken plastic in one bag.  Apparently quality control at this manufacture is pretty lacking.
reviews.author: Joe

reviews.title: "Good ground coverage"
reviews.text: Bought 3 yards (40 bags) for $80, which is less than I would have paid for loose mulch at the local landscape supply. It covered more than I typically can cover with 3 yards measured by the bucket operator's eye, and my truck didn't end up being filthy. I'm going back to get another couple of yards.
reviews.author: JHH

reviews.title: "IDEAL MULCH"
reviews.text: I have used this brand of mulch in Brown over 10 years. Get it every year for my gardens. I love it. It is ideal--texture, color and price. This color is the most beautiful brown I've ever used. Now I won't buy anything else. Other people may have had adverse experiences, but in all the years I've bought this mulch, none of these characteristics have I ever had. I'm about to buy several more bags tomorrow.
reviews.author: Annie

reviews.title: "DO NOT BUY - Worth it to pay for the good stuff"
reviews.text: Loses color, filled with branches and even large stones!  Texture and size and density varies greatly from bag to bag.  Terrible quality and total lack of consistency. I was researching how to get my refund for the color guarantee and there appear to be lots of lawsuits against this manufacturer?
reviews.author: NOmasmulch

reviews.title: "HORRIBLE JUST HORRIBLE"
reviews.text: I would rate this 0 stars if the site would let me.  Nothing but sticks, some as big as 2" diameter!  Out of the entire 4 bags there was maybe one handful of actual mulch.  Do not waste your time or money on this.  There is nothing Premium about it.
reviews.author: Frustratedmulcher

reviews.title: "Dead Mice!!!"
reviews.text: I purchased this product from lowes and quickly went to my home to open and disperse..I noticed a strong smell but associated it with the normal mulch smell..When i opened the first bag about half way through there was the bodies of 3 mice!!!!Expecting a fluke i set it aside to return another when the next 2 bags had what appeared to be mouse carcasses inside!!!Stay away from these rodent graveyards  !!!
reviews.author: Not-A-Living-Mouse

reviews.title: "Watch Out"
reviews.text: Steer clear of this so called "Mulch" It is basically a combination of trash, recycled whatever and dirt. Poor quality control. Faded after rain also.  Back of bag says produced by Harvest Consumer Products out of Mooresville, NC. You get what you pay for.
reviews.author: ilbts

reviews.title: "Seems like very good mulch..."
reviews.text: By no means am I an expert in mulch, but this stuff seems pretty danged good, especially considering the price. I've had bulk mulch installed by my gardener before, I've bought "good" bagged mulch before from the local high end garden center, and this stuff beats those by far. Looks fantastic laid down. Been raining like crazy the last couple of days and I was expecting to find it all down the street, but nope, 99% of what I laid down is still nicely in place. Just keeping my fingers crossed it stays looking good for at least a little while. If so, I'll definitely be keeping an eye on it for future sales.
reviews.author: rudyelgato

reviews.title: "nasty"
reviews.text: just bought 20 bags, my front yard now has tons of flies flying around this mulch, it smells like manure, it has been few days and the smell has is not gone,if it wasn't a total waste of money I would remove it, will never buy this trash again,i m going to spend the extra 3 dollars per bag and buy 20 more bags for my back yard
reviews.author: buyerrrr

reviews.title: "Get it while you can"
reviews.text: We have used the brown for 2 yrs now with great results. Don't waste your time on high priced mulch from a place that you have to buy it by the yard and mess up your truck. This mulch from Lowe's is awesome and easy to handle by the bag and much less $$. Do the math . It's a great deal and makes our home look wonderful every yr . We purchased 30 bags last week and another 15 today. Great stuff !
reviews.author: Dennis

reviews.title: "Poor quality"
reviews.text: Ordered 100 bags of black mulch (2 skids). On May 12th we spread bags from the skid containing 45 bags it was very large chunky/fine pieces. Started 2nd skid and bags contained finer close to double shredded completely different than bags on 1st skid. Very disappointed that our mulch areas look different but too late to stop. May 20th noticed black mulch had turned brown and in one area the color completely washed away it's now gray.  Strongly suggest not to use this mulch in visible areas because bags contain different quality. Will be contacting customer service to honor guarantee.
reviews.author: Disappointed

reviews.title: "Smells like a barn yard"
reviews.text: We purchased 30 bags of brown mulch this past weekend, they were on sale 5/$10. After spreading the mulch and letting it sit overnight and going through a thunderstorm and hours of rain our house still smells like a barn yard. The outdoor Is so strong that we have candles lit in the house and still can't evade the smell. My husband originally blamed the dog but after 24 hours we're certain, this time it's not her fault. Save your selves, don't buy this mulch unless you're accustomed to the harsh stench of farm like animal droppings right outside your door.
reviews.author: DiannaPatrick

reviews.title: "Color and type of mulch is inconsistent"
reviews.text: I bought 20 bags of the dark brown mulch all from the same store to redo a flowerbed. As I started laying the mulch out I realized that certain bags varied largely from other bags. Some of the mulch is very darks compared to others and some of the mulch was almost like bark mulch while others were chip mulch. My flowerbed is now patchy and not very attractive. I contacted the store and they said because it is already laid out that there is nothing they can do. Will not buy again.
reviews.author: Kkent

reviews.title: "Wires, nails, ect in mulch"
reviews.text: This mulch used to be better than it is now.  This last purchase of mulch was full of construction debris, giant chunks, wire, and tons of nails, this product has gone waaaaaaaaay down hill fast.  Im not going to purchase this product anymore, not worth the money!!
reviews.author: SuperGardner123

reviews.title: "Good for Year Two"
reviews.text: I put the first batch of mulch down almost 14 months ago; to this day it has barely faded. The new mulch I put down next to it looks almost identical. Excellent product and I will continue to use during this years mulching projects.
reviews.author: MichiganOwner

reviews.title: "Not recommended"
reviews.text: More than disappointing. I purchased 40 bags recently and in opening the first 5 the mulch was molded with mostly large sticks inside. The dye is undeniably cheaply done! Once it has contact with your skin or clothes, good luck. What a waste of my time and money!
reviews.author: Ponkie

reviews.title: "Quality has gone down!"
reviews.text: I have purchased this product for a few years now. It is always a decent price, no bad smell, and stays dark for the summer. This year it was like a different product. It had large chunks of wood (up to a foot long), several had nails in them. Many pieces had visible paint - red and blue. There was a lot of trash (pieces of plastic) in the mulch, and many pieces only had the brown coloring on one side. They opened a new pallet to get my 30 bags, and so all came from the same batch. But at least 5-6 bags were covered in white mildew (once I opened them), and they were used within 2 days of purchase, so it wasn't like they sat around for a month. I will not purchase this brand again.
reviews.author: Lori

reviews.title: "Works for me"
reviews.text: I did my own comparison of 4 different brands of brown mulch, 2 from Lowe's, and 2 from the other nationwide store. I poured each bag out in the same area of my garden, I let them set for about 3 weeks. The 2 from the other store faded noticeably, their consistency seemed like longer pieces of wood, and the cheaper brand faded worse. As for the 2 selections from Lowe's they are very similar in color and wood consistency. Not really any difference except the prices. So I went with this brand, same 12 month color guarantee as the other brand. I bought 60 bags. I have not seen any bad quality concerns that some others have reported. I know better than to think it block all weeds, or that will look the same 12 months from now, nothing does.
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "Brown color gone after 1st rain"
reviews.text: Absolutely TERRIBLE color retention. Bought 25 bags during a sale and put it down alongside some leftover bags of another brand from last year.One hard rain later, the year old product is still brown. The new mulch? Washed out and grayish.My kids even asked me why I had gone back and put old looking mulch over the "new stuff" I'd just done last week!Now getting more Scott's brand to cover over this disaster.It was a great price, but looks like I'm getting what I paid for.
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "stones plastic tags 2x4's"
reviews.text: this mulch stinks i bought 5 moldy bags thats all they had at lowes, lady told me that was normal. this mulch look to me like it came from a 3rd. world country filled with plastic tags, lots of stones & 2x4's in the mix also. don't waste your money!!!!!
reviews.author: pat

reviews.title: "you get what you pay for"
reviews.text: people that complain about a $2 bag of mulch need some help.
reviews.author: bob

reviews.title: "good stuff"
reviews.text: I used this for my yard this year due to heavy rain and the pollen it has sort of faided in some spots but mulch is mulch! Ive bought the most expensive brand and it was junk! This was a good deal looks great makes my yard look a little more classy!
reviews.author: bboy

reviews.title: "Great Mulch"
reviews.text: I have used more than 50 bags to top dress my flower beds and could not be more pleased.  The quality for the price is exceptional.  The brown looks natural in my gardens and has held up well.  I will definitely continue buying my mulch at Lowe's.
reviews.author: Ouachitabell

reviews.title: "Don't do it"
reviews.text: We just bought 40 bags and spread it around on flower beds. There were many pieces with no color at all. In addition I had to pick out large rocks, pieces of boards and other debris. I would not buy this again.
reviews.author: BillE

reviews.title: "Looks Fine but Made My Dog Ill"
reviews.text: I put out some mulch in my yard last Saturday morning and it looks good - looks like mulch and is still black even after a couple days of rain. But while I was putting it out my dog ate 3-4 pieces of this mulch. He's been vomiting, lethargic, sneezing and coughing since Saturday night. I understood this to be non-toxic. For me, this $3 bag of mulch wasn't worth the $350 in vet bills and heartache of seeing my puppy sick. Would not recommend to people with pets who will be in the area and may ingest.
reviews.author: Katie

reviews.title: "Great color"
reviews.text: I bought this mulch even though there were negative reviews...I read the positive reviews which were very helpful. The complaint was that the black color washed out after a heavy rain. We just had a downpour and the mulch looks great and did not lose any color. Per the recommendations there was one constant...make sure the mulch has been in the garden for 24-48 hours prior to a heavy rain. Just check the weather reports and it should be fine.
reviews.author: SUZ

reviews.title: "LOVE IT!!"
reviews.text: After reviewing multiple bad reviews we were little skeptical about it but we bought few sample bags from local lowes store and tried and it is perfect much and rich in color. we ordered 300 bags to spread around our 1 acre lot. We are very happy with the quality and price of this mulch.
reviews.author: KK

reviews.title: "Black to Brown FAST!!!"
reviews.text: Bought 20 bags, did half of my project.  A week later got 20 more to finish but once I realized how much the color had washed out in one week I immediately returned the 20 un opened bags.  Even @ $2/bag this is not a deal.  Garbage.
reviews.author: B

reviews.title: "Junk..I'd give it 0 star rating"
reviews.text: This stuff is junk.  Large chunks of wood, half dyed, wire, you name it.  Bought 20 bags for my landscape man to put down.  If I had seen first bag it would have been returned.  Complained to manager but got nothing but blank look and sorry..we will make a note of that.  Do not buy this junk.  Brown and red seem to be better quality for some reason.but Black...junk.
reviews.author: Ticker

reviews.title: "WILL KEEP YOUR WEEDS OUT..!"
reviews.text: I have used the Black Mulch for years. I love it as it really does keep the weeds out. It needs to be added to each year, because of the draining and soil run-off. It will sink into the ground, slowly. However, a little raking, and filling in, and it looks great again. I just moved from Florida where everyone used the Red Mulch. When asked why I used the Black, I told them weed control. Before I left, I noticed there were more people using the Black. Definitely great as far as I am concerned. Thank you for a good and cheaply priced product..
reviews.author: Joie

reviews.title: "Been using it for 3 years now."
reviews.text: I purchase 400 bags a year. The secret is to look at the dates on the pallets you want the pallets with  the newest date on. The older the date the better possibility of white mold  and it being wet and soggy and smelly.
reviews.author: Termite

reviews.title: "I get this every 2 years"
reviews.text: I like this stuff.  I see a lot of complaints, but I buy some every 18-24 months to freshen up.   Never had an issue with color or mold like others are saying.  I recommend this product.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Ya get what ya pay for"
reviews.text: If you want big chunks of wood for your mulch, then this is the mulch for you. The best thing about this mulch is the price.
reviews.author: BobKY

reviews.title: "Low quality"
reviews.text: I should have read all of the reviews instead of just the ones at the top.  Since the top reviews were from a few years ago I naively thought they improved the product.  They didn't.  I bought the mulch this week and the bags contained large wood chips that could be used as a splint, white mold spores, and even pieces of 1X1 lumber.  Will not buy this again.
reviews.author: Michelle

reviews.title: "Value for Money"
reviews.text: Bought 10 bags on sale, at half the cost of brand name. Debated spending more on brand name, but when we got there, it all looked the same to me. It was easy to move around in the bags. I ended up taking my gardening gloves off at one point and had dyed fingernails. At least 1, maybe 2 bags were a slightly darker color-I figure it will all even out eventually. It did have a bit of an odor, but not super strong or anything. If you're not too picky, I think it's worth getting, especially if you are using it in a new area to build up the depth. Still need quite a bit more and will buy this again if nothing else to keep it consistent, but may buy nicer stuff to top off after a year or two.
reviews.author: lur1

reviews.title: "Great product for the money"
reviews.text: I have purchased this product on two separate occasions for two houses. I purchased approx. 60 bags. I haven't had any issues with it a all. There was one bag that had a piece of plastic flex pipe in it buy I don't consider that a issue. Just threw it in the trash. The first batch I purchased was at the beginning of summer and the color still looks great.
reviews.author: Scott

reviews.title: "The color and quality lasts!!"
reviews.text: This has been down for 2 years and still looks great.. if you don't put down enough and spread it too thin, it may not work as well. But if you put down a good layer it will look good for years to come.
reviews.author: Nauticialdoll

reviews.title: "Exactly what I was looking for"
reviews.text: I bought 13 bags this weekend and spread them in about 20 minutes.  This was exactly what I wanted.  The bags are clear so I could see exactly what I was getting before I purchased them on September 23, 2017.  I couldn't be happier.  I checked the reviews before I went to the store and still can't figure out why everyone recently had written bad reviews.
reviews.author: Happy-in-Albuquerque

reviews.title: "Tanned chipped wood"
reviews.text: Not bad for the money,its chipped tyded wood chips not mulch,i bought it in winter bags are soaked they leaked all over the driveway staining the concrete that wont just wash off.pay the extra 2 dollars and buy real mulch it better for your garden in the long run
reviews.author: Gil

reviews.title: "This mulch is fine... Fantastic @ $2"
reviews.text: Like you, I comparison shop. The easy comparison is between Lowe's and another big orange store down the street. Here are my findings after reading a bunch of the reviews on this page and the big orange page. Went to the big orange store. Went to Lowes. Couldn't see inside the big orange store's bags, so assumed they were full of all the stuff described in the reviews: trash, tree trunks, car tires and maybe a sleeping landscaper that got scooped up. Left and went to Lowe's. Their bags were clear and filled top to bottom with black mulch. I thought, at the price of 5 for $10 how could i lose. I put them in my car and there were no stains on my clothes and nothing spilling out staining my car interior. I got them home and spread them all 7 days ago. The mulch still looks as black as the day I purchased it. There was not one shred of garbage or sleeping landscapers that got scooped up.My takeaway... Go look for yourself and believe your eyes. Lowes $2 product in a clear bag is excellent for a year's beauty. What more can you ask?
reviews.author: Allbeback4more

reviews.title: "Different"
reviews.text: We bought 30 bags. Loved they way the looked. Some plastic chunks of things in the bags. Wasn't a big deal. We ended up needing more. We went back and got 20 more bags. We were very disappointed in the second round! They were chopped differently & had a white coating on some of the wood.... hoping the color turns out to be the same when it dries...
reviews.author: Carley

reviews.title: "Great for the Price"
reviews.text: This is the second year I've purchased this mulch.  Last year, I did part of my yard to see how it stood up to the harsh WI weather.  I'm pleased!  I can't tell the difference in color between the mulch I  laid two days ago and last year's mulch.  I'm. SURE you could find higher quality mulch, but you'll also pay more.  For my money, this is a great option.  I plan to go back and buy 10 more bags after the surprise snow we're getting today! #wisconsinlife
reviews.author: SJC

reviews.title: "great Product"
reviews.text: I buy this every year to freshen up my flower beds in black looks so nice, I will be getting this again for this year ... It is easier for me to handle as I am a widow, and 63 ....
reviews.author: Debbie

reviews.title: "Waste of money"
reviews.text: This product isnt worth a dollar a bag. Lost all of its color right away. Better off with naturscapes or having it delivered. Will contact store and vendor since it has a 12 month color guarantee warranty. Will follow up you to let you know the value of the warranty with Lowe and Vendor.
reviews.author: JFSYARD

reviews.title: "worst mulch ever"
reviews.text: bought 4 bags of this early in the year,it was very acceptable. Then I bought 4 more bags on the 13th of August,it was terrible.It had rocks,dirt clumps and a stick over 2 ft long.overall very rough and hard to even out.Will never buy this product again.
reviews.author: RonS

reviews.title: "Frustration In A Bag"
reviews.text: I guess I got lucky, the color in my "black" mulch lasted a whole two weeks before it started to fade and then turned a dull, light gray (within 5 weeks).  I put it down in April of last year and had to re-mulch in October to avoid looking at the gray all winter long.  Should have gone with something else and saved myself the time and money.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "The color and quality lasts!!"
reviews.text: This has been down for 2 years and still looks great.. if you don't put down enough and spread it too thin, it may not work as well. But if you put down a good layer it will look good for years to come.
reviews.author: Nauticialdoll

reviews.title: "Exactly what I was looking for"
reviews.text: I bought 13 bags this weekend and spread them in about 20 minutes.  This was exactly what I wanted.  The bags are clear so I could see exactly what I was getting before I purchased them on September 23, 2017.  I couldn't be happier.  I checked the reviews before I went to the store and still can't figure out why everyone recently had written bad reviews.
reviews.author: Happy-in-Albuquerque

reviews.title: "Tanned chipped wood"
reviews.text: Not bad for the money,its chipped tyded wood chips not mulch,i bought it in winter bags are soaked they leaked all over the driveway staining the concrete that wont just wash off.pay the extra 2 dollars and buy real mulch it better for your garden in the long run
reviews.author: Gil

reviews.title: "This mulch is fine... Fantastic @ $2"
reviews.text: Like you, I comparison shop. The easy comparison is between Lowe's and another big orange store down the street. Here are my findings after reading a bunch of the reviews on this page and the big orange page. Went to the big orange store. Went to Lowes. Couldn't see inside the big orange store's bags, so assumed they were full of all the stuff described in the reviews: trash, tree trunks, car tires and maybe a sleeping landscaper that got scooped up. Left and went to Lowe's. Their bags were clear and filled top to bottom with black mulch. I thought, at the price of 5 for $10 how could i lose. I put them in my car and there were no stains on my clothes and nothing spilling out staining my car interior. I got them home and spread them all 7 days ago. The mulch still looks as black as the day I purchased it. There was not one shred of garbage or sleeping landscapers that got scooped up.My takeaway... Go look for yourself and believe your eyes. Lowes $2 product in a clear bag is excellent for a year's beauty. What more can you ask?
reviews.author: Allbeback4more

reviews.title: "Different"
reviews.text: We bought 30 bags. Loved they way the looked. Some plastic chunks of things in the bags. Wasn't a big deal. We ended up needing more. We went back and got 20 more bags. We were very disappointed in the second round! They were chopped differently & had a white coating on some of the wood.... hoping the color turns out to be the same when it dries...
reviews.author: Carley

reviews.title: "Great for the Price"
reviews.text: This is the second year I've purchased this mulch.  Last year, I did part of my yard to see how it stood up to the harsh WI weather.  I'm pleased!  I can't tell the difference in color between the mulch I  laid two days ago and last year's mulch.  I'm. SURE you could find higher quality mulch, but you'll also pay more.  For my money, this is a great option.  I plan to go back and buy 10 more bags after the surprise snow we're getting today! #wisconsinlife
reviews.author: SJC

reviews.title: "great Product"
reviews.text: I buy this every year to freshen up my flower beds in black looks so nice, I will be getting this again for this year ... It is easier for me to handle as I am a widow, and 63 ....
reviews.author: Debbie

reviews.title: "Waste of money"
reviews.text: This product isnt worth a dollar a bag. Lost all of its color right away. Better off with naturscapes or having it delivered. Will contact store and vendor since it has a 12 month color guarantee warranty. Will follow up you to let you know the value of the warranty with Lowe and Vendor.
reviews.author: JFSYARD

reviews.title: "worst mulch ever"
reviews.text: bought 4 bags of this early in the year,it was very acceptable. Then I bought 4 more bags on the 13th of August,it was terrible.It had rocks,dirt clumps and a stick over 2 ft long.overall very rough and hard to even out.Will never buy this product again.
reviews.author: RonS

reviews.title: "Frustration In A Bag"
reviews.text: I guess I got lucky, the color in my "black" mulch lasted a whole two weeks before it started to fade and then turned a dull, light gray (within 5 weeks).  I put it down in April of last year and had to re-mulch in October to avoid looking at the gray all winter long.  Should have gone with something else and saved myself the time and money.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Doesn't Stay Black"
reviews.text: I bought these last year and they looked good. I bought a lot more this year to cover the rest of my back yard. They are a lot different than last year. Last year, they looked like wood chips. This year, they were more grinded and fine. The smell is also very unpleasant. I don't recall that from last year either. We still had the bags from last year, so I know I didn't buy a different brand or kind. Within a couple hours of laying down the mulch, they turned a dark brown color as they were airing out. My husband and neighbor commented on the dark brown color as well. I bought black and it was a rich black color coming out of the bag. There was no rain. It was a bright and sunny day. 12 months color guarantee? Don't count on it. Didn't even last half a day.
reviews.author: Diamond

reviews.title: "Time Saver"
reviews.text: Bought lots of the mulch to line the fence of my family home and it looked outstanding. Was very easy to put down and use along the entire fence. Makes the lawn look super professional the neighbors ask where did I get the mulch and if it comes in different colors. Would highly recommend to anyone that ask me about it.
reviews.author: GreenThumb

reviews.title: "Fungus"
reviews.text: This mulch is filled with fungus. I can't see the landscape I paid $8,000 for because of all the mushrooms. I've sprayed them with cleaning vinegar and water, baking soda and water, pulled them out by hand, and low and behold they continue to pop up. THIS MULCH SUCKS !!!! Would not buy or recommend to anyone.
reviews.author: Joeblow

reviews.title: "THE PRODUCT IS BAD"
reviews.text: THE PRODUCT SMELLS LIKE OLD RAILROAD TIES, HAS LARGE CHUCKS OF WOOD AND GOOD SIZE STONES IN BAG. LOOKS LIKE RECYCLED OLD LUMBER AND IS VERY POORLY SHREDDED. NOT WHAT I WOULD CALL MULCH
reviews.author: BOBO

reviews.title: "Don't buy"
reviews.text: It was black for a day, one hard rain and already brown and faded. I guess you get what you pay for. It was on sale 5 for $10. 12 month color guarantee is a joke. Very disappointed and lowes should not continue to carry this brand of colored mulch if they care anything about their customers satisfaction.
reviews.author: Daddio

reviews.title: "not colorfast"
reviews.text: this mulch lost it's color in less than a month. after it was rained on it turned hard as a rock
reviews.author: chb

reviews.title: "Fades in color quickly"
reviews.text: After reading reviews went and bought 10 bags. Out of the bag mulch was awesome. Rich color, really enhanced the plant area. Many reviews posted said theirs did not fade in color. However mine faded less than a week in use. This is in N.C. with extreme heat 95 and above. Now the color looks like old Creosote railroad ties and since this is in front of my house along the walkway I will have to replace it. Would not recommend this color unless one you don't mind fading and two don't put it where it is in constant sight or sun.
reviews.author: ncheel

reviews.title: "I read the various reviews and was apprehensive"
reviews.text: But I visited local E. Tx Lowes, looked through some bags and also saw one that had been opened and examined the content.  Purchased 15 bags and all were great:  no crap inside.  Unsure if they would 'bleed' if used within 48 hours of rain since we spread and had 3-4 days with no rain.  Looks great.  Plan to get an additional 20 bags in near future. If I did have any problems, I have worked with this Lowe's plenty over past 3 years, have had a few issues that were quickly resolved.  Just outstanding service with this store.
reviews.author: BillM

reviews.title: "Mulch/black"
reviews.text: To date, I have been impressed with Lowe's and their products. I purchased 5 bags in the Sacramento area and have not had any problems yet. The problems might be due to which plant produced the product, seems that a majority of the problems with the product come from the east, this makes me suspect the supplier. Maybe, I have been lucky but thank you ALL that have taken the time to present your findings. Better safe than sorry. Dan
reviews.author: Dan

reviews.title: "Great if you also need stones"
reviews.text: Pulled this pile of stones while spreading 3 bags of this "premium" mulch. Probably more but wasn't really looking. This stuff is crap, with rocks.
reviews.author: Shannon

reviews.title: "Disappointing"
reviews.text: There was a significant amount of mold on the mulch, so much of it looked white.
reviews.author: D

reviews.title: "Good decent mulch with good price"
reviews.text: I chose this mulch over the one at HD. I hate that some bag has powdery spots on the mulch, some kind of bacteria infection or fungus activity, even though appears to be harmless after you spread them out in the sun. Some bag is absolutely perfect with no issue. Nice-sized chunky mulch which will last much longer than the shredded mulch. The picture is misleading because these are not shredded mulch. The mulch is actually chunky in size, big chunky wood pieces, which last longer than the shredded ones anyway. Nice color, it faded a few days after you spread them, but the color stays the same after the first initial fading, so it's all good anyway. I would buy them again, but I do not want to happen to grab the bag with white powdery spots on them. Wish me luck.
reviews.author: mulching

reviews.title: "Try A Small Area First"
reviews.text: I just bought and applied 10 bags of the red and 10 bags of the brown because they were on sale for $2.00 a bag. And, I wanted to experiment with the colors. Both mulches seemed fine, quality-wise -- I did NOT experience any of the concerns others have expressed here, e.g., mold, debris, bugs, etc. HOWEVER, I do NOT personally like the appearance of either color mulch. Mind you, this is totally a matter of personal preference (and, as I said, I wanted to experiment).If I had to do it again, I would have tried each color in a limited (perhaps, little-seen) area first. I shall be returning to the FloriMulch Melaleuca that I've been using since I moved here 3 years ago, as I prefer its color, texture, etc. BUT, again, this is not a critique of the quality of this mulch, just a personal preference. And I wish I had tested it in a small area myself rather than spreading all 20 bags out at once.
reviews.author: TomHardy

reviews.title: "I would literally sleep on this mulch if I could"
reviews.text: This mulch is sick.   Good for flower beds, parking spots, filling holes, masturbating, and pretty much all other common uses for mulches.
reviews.author: Crony

reviews.title: "What do you expect"
reviews.text: This mulch is 2 bucks a bag and its great . people complain about the quality? buy 5 dollar a bag mulch !What do you expect mine is great dark black and when it fades after a year like most mulch does i dye it with some lowes mulch dye and it looks like new again . lots of bang for your 2 bucks
reviews.author: Yardman

reviews.title: "Color Faded Within 12 Hours"
reviews.text: I've bought mulch for 20+ years and know good mulch from bad mulch.  When the product I wanted and have used the past two year wasn't on sale, at the urging of the store manager, I purchased 38 bags of this Preen product and put 20 down in late afternoon the same day.  It rained at 2:00 a.m. that night.  The next morning when I went to look at it I was stunned by how much brown color had washed away after one rain shower.  A different brand mulch from Lowe's I've had down for 14 months looks better than this product that wasn't on the ground for 14 hours.  I returned the remaining 18 bags.  Also, beware that this product is more of a hybrid mix of wood chips and wood mulch, not purely wood mulch. The remains of chopped up pallets and old lumber are very evident.
reviews.author: Autoreset

reviews.title: "Washes Away"
reviews.text: This product is junk. I had no problem with the first 4 bags I purchased, but after that the next 12 bags were one surprise after the other. Half the bags had their color wash away from the mulch after the first rain or watering. One of the bags contained an 18 inch long piece of 1x6 board. Other bags contained river stones. This is an inconsistent product not worth taking the chance on, regardless of the price.
reviews.author: outdoorsman

reviews.title: "Doesn't keep color"
reviews.text: Put new mulch down in March and it's already horribly faded at beginning of July. Fortunately, it doesn't break the bank, but I don't think I'm saving much money if it needs to be replaced every few months.
reviews.author: kmorrow

reviews.title: "Be Watchful"
reviews.text: I bought several bags of this mulch. I noticed one bag had termites in it. I noticed them after spreading the mulch. I had to undo that section & spray Termite  killer. Tried to reach the store manager for resolution at Leesburg VA who would not return a call. what a waste of time and money.
reviews.author: Vink

reviews.title: "Color Faded"
reviews.text: Beautiful color but faded after 2 rains. Very disappointed.
reviews.author: Ashley

reviews.title: "Better than expected"
reviews.text: After reading several reviews, I was a little hesitant to try this product. However, since my project size was relatively small, I decided to purchase a few bags. Mulch has been placed and has held up very well after several months. The color faded a bit over the past few months, but nothing too extreme or to cause me to write a bad review. The mulch has held up thru rain and severe winds, so I am very happy with the results.
reviews.author: Nena

reviews.title: "Random Garbage in a Bag"
reviews.text: Bag literally contained construction debris and rocks.
reviews.author: Sam

reviews.title: "Inconsistent"
reviews.text: I purchased 16 bags of the black mulch...some bags were "shredded" others were "chunky"....after the first hard rain the "shredded" mulch lost all it's color...looks like the old stuff I was trying to "refresh" for the season...however the "chunky" mulch did hold it's color...overall I expected each bag to be of the same quality as the last....it looks really bad having some spots with the washed out "shredded" mulch and some spots with the deep black "chunky" mulch....even if the shredded mulch had not washed out...it still would look horrible having 2 different types of mulch in the flower beds....they need to be consistent with the product and/or mark the bags as being "shredded" or "chunky"
reviews.author: seafire

reviews.title: "termites in the mulch"
reviews.text: I bought 80 bags of mulch for my yard on 2 separate occasions this season. First 55 went down without a problem. My coworker had mentioned one day at work that she had to remove all of her mulch due to her husband finding termites under the mulch when he went to go plant a shrub after having had the mulch down for a couple weeks. This had me on alert. So I kept an eye out while spreading my next 25 bags that I just picked up. Well the third bag I open has terimites living in the mulch. First I noticed a lot of bugs in the pile of mulch so I looked closer. This is when I noticed the white termites, finding more as I sifted through the rest of that pile of mulch from that bag. Now this is the only one is noticed termites in but that's not to say there weren't in any of the others. So now I'm going to have to figure out which chemical I'm going to have to use to treat all this mulch with. My coworker ended up shovel up all her mulch into garbage bags and throwing it out but she didn't have 80 bags worth.
reviews.author: jason

reviews.title: "Excellent product, price, and color-retention"
reviews.text: Annually we've been using more than 100 bags of this mulch in black for the past four years. The consistency has alway been quite acceptable and the color has always stayed black. I have no idea what the whiners are talking about ... my wife has always been thrilled with it! Me too.
reviews.author: Borealbushman

reviews.title: "I Use 180 Bags a Year"
reviews.text: An acre of my property is landscaped and I replace the mulch yearly. Takes me about 3 pallets (180 bags) to do all the beds so I don't want to spend more than $2 a bag which is what this mulch costs me on sale. I could buy mulch cheaper by the truckload but having it bagged makes it easier for me to distribute. I have tried the more expensive mulches, including the rubber mulch, but prefer this one. It looks good, stays put, and minimizes weeding and watering.
reviews.author: skinney

reviews.title: "Buyer Beware"
reviews.text: I purchased 50 bags of mulch to cover the front and sides of my home. I did everything that's recommend cleaned all weeds sprayed, laid down weed paper and then placed the mulch. This mulch had minimal odor to it, spread very easily and looked amazing, beautiful brown color to it. Here's where the problem began within less then 2 weeks of laying the mulch I started to get nettle weeds popping up everywhere. This type of weed was no where to be found prior to laying down the mulch. When I pull them up they have not broken through the weed paper but are rooted with in the mulch. There is no contact number I can find for the company and Lowes just brushed it off. I have pulled them out and sprayed, yet they still come back.
reviews.author: SweetT511

reviews.title: "Easy to spread mulch"
reviews.text: Purchasing 42 bags of mulch to spread in my flowering beds and hosta patches surrounding 5 trees.  It is easy to wheel contained in a bag to the areas needing mulched.  I still have 5 bags left to finish my job in and 16x16 foot patio area with three sides all landscaped.  When Lowe's get my corner fencing installed 12x12 foot the rest will be put in place.  Have used the mulch before and had good luck with it.  Only down side is a few bags had a mold growing in them from being bagged, but it died after the sun hut it.
reviews.author: RT

reviews.title: "Great Mulch for bagged mulch"
reviews.text: This is the second year in a row I have used this mulch.  Good quality.  I have not had any issues with bugs or mites of any type.  It is much easier for me to handle and much easier than shoveling mulch that I use to get by the truckloads.  Pricey unless you get it on sale.
reviews.author: DixieRadar

reviews.title: "Premium Mulch Brown"
reviews.text: 15 bags of brown premium mulch with rocks in all bags! Large pieces of scrap lumber present in all bags as well! Even had orange coaxial cable in one bag.....dyed brown junk wood not mulch! Only good experience were both workers helped load bags and were very polite and helpful!!!
reviews.author: Chief2300

reviews.title: "Significantly Improved Quality Mulch!!"
reviews.text: I just purchased and installed 150 bags of Brown Hardwood Mulch which was on sale for 5 for $10 for the 4th of July Sale. I have been using bagged mulch for the last 5 years for convenience fully expecting the mulch to not be the same quality as triple ground mulch I used to purchase in bulk. I have purchased mulch from Lowe's and their major competitor. The quality was at best 3 stars with the competitor's Scott's brand maybe slightly better but not significantly. My biggest complaint was the large pieces and trash in the mulch.  I purchased 5 bags from Lowe's earlier in the season for a small job and was pleasantly surprised by the improved quality and color of the mulch. So much so that I wondered if I picked up the wrong mulch.  When it went on sale, I ordered 150 bags delivered on pallets and shrink wrapped and placed on my driveway for a reasonable fee.  I just put down the mulch this week and all 150 bags were outstanding.  The mulch was as good as any 3 times ground bulk mulch I've bought and free of any large pieces or debris.  I don't know if Lowe's listened to the negative reviews and upped the quality and/or changed suppliers.  Whatever the reason, kudos to Lowe's for a much improved product at a great price! Keep this quality and I will keep coming back!
reviews.author: TNkayaker

reviews.title: "30 bags later and I am very satisfied."
reviews.text: I live in the hot sun of FL.  I purchased this mulch with the fears of what I read.  I am very pleased so far.  A few larger than other pieces found but nothing that I would find alerting.  The texture is that of other much that I have purchased that is significantly pricier.  It hasn't been down too long so I can't comment on the color resistance.  I plan on purchasing 30 more bags later.  I only gave it 4**** since I haven't put it to the color test.  I would not hesitate to purchase this if you are considering it.
reviews.author: Marie

reviews.title: "Worked for me"
reviews.text: Probably not the best mulch you can buy but I got some on sale and it did the job. Can't complain for the price I paid (it was good mulch for the money). I assume the quality will vary and that's why some people have better experiences with this mulch than others.
reviews.author: CommonSenseAl

reviews.title: "Not worth it... even if it's on sale"
reviews.text: 12 Month Color Guarantee??  Not even close.  I bought 30 bags and it looked great when I spread it out.  Now, 2 months later, it's tan.  Not black.  If I wanted tan I would have bought brown mulch.  Very disappointed in this product.  Will not be buying it again.
reviews.author: Brad

reviews.title: "Great mulch"
reviews.text: I read all the reviews and was a little leery of buying this but at $2.00 a bag I thought I would give it a chance. The bags I bought didn't have any of the problems in the other reviews. Looks great in the flowerbed. Easy to spread out and will be back for more.
reviews.author: Dori

reviews.title: "12 month color guarantee, I think not."
reviews.text: I purchased 40 bags of mulch from LOWES last week. On Saturday my son & I spread 20 bags, the next day began 3 days of rain. Yesterday I look at the mulch & it looks like it's been down for the past 2 years. The Scott's mulch I spread a month ago looks brand new. Not to mention the garbage I was picking out of this. Contacting Lowes & the manufacturer tomorrow, hoping they live up to their 12 month color guarantee.
reviews.author: katblas

reviews.title: "Don't buy"
reviews.text: This product was infested with some type of small flies. We placed it around our porch and now our porch and around our doors are covered with the insects. Also, it rained 3 or 4 days and product is already losing color..
reviews.author: Joy

reviews.title: "Color fades real fast"
reviews.text: Faded the very next day. Really quick, after 3rd day it's like a grey/ashy color now. Was a good deal when on sale for $2.50 but it doesn't hold up at all.
reviews.author: Jimboo

reviews.title: "Been buying for years; consistently good value!"
reviews.text: I have used this product for multiple years across multiple homes and always been happy. Great value. Brown mulch eventually fades to lighter brown in heavy sun, but pieces are large enough to not easily wash away, small enough to provide great coverage.
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "Poor quality mulch"
reviews.text: I really should of went to a Lowes store first to check what the mulch looks like first before ordering online.This is really poor quality mulch. When I first loaded the bags in to my vehicle, it felt like light bags of sticks. Almost all the bags contained some white substance. Other reviews here mentioned mold. Im not sure, but all i know is the mulch totally did not meet my expectations. In the past, I had purchased Scotts brown mulch before and it was of way finer quality.
reviews.author: kulau

reviews.title: "Poor quality mulch"
reviews.text: I really should of went to a Lowes store first to check what the mulch looks like first before ordering online.This is really poor quality mulch. When I first loaded the bags in to my vehicle, it felt like light bags of sticks. Almost all the bags contained some white substance. Other reviews here mentioned mold. Im not sure, but all i know is the mulch totally did not meet my expectations. In the past, I had purchased Scotts brown mulch before and it was of way finer quality.
reviews.author: kulau

reviews.title: "Instead of Premium on Bag, should be Substandard."
reviews.text: Have bought this mulch over the years from Lowes, but this year will be my last. Advertised as hardwood mulch, why does it have pine bark in it, also trashy with debris and pieces of 1"x1" pieces that are inches long, looks like scrap molding. Definitely not as advertised and on top of that, bags seem to be not as full as in previous years. LOWE'S needs to check out the supplier that they are buying this from.
reviews.author: Ron

reviews.title: "Hardwood mulch flat pieces mostly 1 to 4 inches"
reviews.text: Purchased a pallet of this mulch, there are 65 bags to a pallet. The mulch was pretty close in appearance to what is displayed on the plastic packaging, which is to say mostly 1.5 - 3" flat-pieces, brown stained, hardwood chips. The stain did turn my nitrile gloves brown since I spread a fair amount of it by hand, although I can easily believe it will stay mostly brown for the entire growing season. I found it amusing that the brown bags received only a 2 star rating on this Lowes site, while the red bags received a much higher rating, since I suspect the manufacturer uses the same process for both and only varies the dye they spray on the wood. Probably says more about the reviewers than the product.
