questions.question: "Is this mulch dyed? We have a pond and can not used dyed mulch."
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Alberta
answers.text: The mulch is dyed black and that is one of the reasons there are so many complaints about fading.

answers.author: ray
answers.text: Yes it is dyed. I stacked these on my concrete porch last year prior to using it It stained my concrete porch. Had to power wash it three times to get the stain off.

answers.author: Lucy
answers.text: Easily one could read the label or call the company or read the specs on the page. This mulch is safe for vegetable gardens, No herbicides , no insecticides non toxic. Id be more afraid of what you buy at the grocery store and consume daily.You DONT know how or where that produce came from.

answers.author: Sichuan
answers.text: Yes it is.

answers.author: ee
answers.text: Yes, I think it is.

answers.author: jimbo
answers.text: I bought you this last year and I have a pond also never had an issue with it dying my pond.

answers.author: OutdoorCook
answers.text: The manufacturer claims on the bag that the mulch contains natural forest products and colorant. No other details are presented. The distributor is Harvest Garden Pro, LLC, 1977 Bay Rd, Milford DE 19963.

answers.author: Sta-Green Team
answers.text: Yes. This product has colorant added to it. Thanks!

answers.author: Dave
answers.text: Can't say "how much", but it's definitely dyed. The brown color from my mulch washed out in the first heavy rain. Very distinctive difference. I wouldn't use if artificial color is a concern.

answers.author: T-time
answers.text: All colored mulches are dyed. Most are dyed with vegetable oil.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Yes, this product is dyed. The manufacturer color/finish is dark brown and is guaranteed for a year. The mulch is made from hardwood.

answers.author: montanamike
answers.text: Yes, It is clearly dyed, which comes off quickly after rain!

answers.author: JoeE
answers.text: It definitely looks dyed. I would be shocked if it's not.

answers.author: gary
answers.text: The other answers say somewhere between 60 and 75 bags, or the count varies

answers.author: Joey
answers.text: 65 per pallet I work there

answers.author: mascroft
answers.text: Just purchased a pallet, April 2018, and there are 65 bags.

answers.author: poppy
answers.text: 65 bags

answers.author: JM
answers.text: This number varies from year to year, apparently. As is now, most pallets have 68 bags on them. The same can be said for the red and brown variations of this brand.

answers.author: MJN1
answers.text: 75 bags per pallet

answers.author: Shack
answers.text: 75 bags per pallet

answers.author: Captain
answers.text: 60 bags per pallet.

questions.question: "Is this mulch safe for fruits and vegetables?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: LUCY
answers.text: COMPLETELY SAFE , CALL THE COMPANY. NO HERBICIDES , NO INSECTICIDES , NON TOXIC

answers.author: Anonymous
answers.text: Someone answered this question with a statement that it appears plywood is in the mulch. This is a hardwood mulch and that most likely excludes any sort of plywood or pressboard being in it. Most plywood (99%) comes from softwood trees. Pines and cedars are not hardwood for example. Fruit trees and limbs, oak, maple, alder are good examples of hardwood.

answers.author: gina
answers.text: I was wondering the same thing. I will instead use the Cedar and pine mulch they sell for my herb and vegetable garden. It is listed as "organic" and is only cedar and pine chips, free of dyes. Cedar naturally repels bugs.

answers.author: turtlemom
answers.text: I would not put it around my fruits and veggies. It is a mixture of woods, some that have probably been treated and it even looks like it has plywood in it. I did put it in my flower beds one year and it molded under them and attracted tons of bugs and ants.

answers.author: Slacking02
answers.text: I used this hardwood mulch around a small vegetable garden May/2014 and brought in a nasty Spider Mite infestation. It looks nice, but there was an ongoing battle with insects all summer. You may consider other ground cover options for edible plants.

answers.author: OIMYAD
answers.text: If the bag does not say anything about it, call the manufacturer's number on the bag and ask them.

answers.author: Bobby
answers.text: Yes

questions.question: "can I use it for an outer play ground area?"
questions.author: awesome

answers.author: lucy
answers.text: YES

answers.author: LUCY
answers.text: ABSOLUTELY

answers.author: rayyyy
answers.text: I would not use it near kids because of the dye that is used. It comes off on to your hands when putting it out

answers.author: DrJ3055
answers.text: This is a Hardwood Mulch. As such, the wood particles are subject to splinters. I would use the more expensive Rubber Type Mulch for Play areas. The Particles do not splinter and the rubber does form a cushion when a child falls on it.

answers.author: smarty
answers.text: yes.. good for same

answers.author: Anonymous
answers.text: Organic mulch doesn't do well in a traffic area. It would be a real mess, and maintence headache. If you are wanting to add color and texture to this area rubber mulch is your best bet. (watch out for sticker shock) Play sand might be your best bet; you can always top coat with mulch later if you don't like the look.

answers.author: Anonymous
answers.text: No you can not use Mulch as play ground material. It is meant as a soil conditioner. Use extra small bark or better order material specific for play grounds such as ground up rubber.

questions.question: "please, what is this mulch made from?"
questions.author: Binky

answers.author: lucy
answers.text: This is made from hardwood 9804442000 is the number for the company. I have used this for years and the mulch always stays true to color. You cant tell the old from the new. and NEVER in over 10 years have I EVER saw any bugs in it and I am quite meticulous.

answers.author: Marty
answers.text: Garbage

answers.author: robertdustoffe
answers.text: Southern yellow pine mulch trees.

answers.author: pattyp
answers.text: chipped pallets and dyed black...

answers.author: DrJ3055
answers.text: This is a shredded Hardwood with black dye.

answers.author: Moo-Mobile
answers.text: It is made in the USA, WooHoo! It's just waste product from the bark of pine trees. Natural and no dyes or chemicals. I like it allot.

answers.author: ordinaryjoe
answers.text: This mulch is made of pine chips.

questions.question: "How many cubic feet in a yard of mulch ?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: handyman
answers.text: A yard of mulch is really a cubic yard which is 3 feet wide by 3 feet high by 3 feet deep. So there are 27 cubic feet in a cubic yard of mulch.

answers.author: Greg
answers.text: A cubic yard is 27 cubic feet.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: 1 cubic yard is equal to 27 cubic feet.

answers.author: NatureDude
answers.text: 27 Cubic feet in one yard

answers.author: Sta-Green Team
answers.text: There are 27 cubic feet in a yard. Thanks!

answers.author: robertdustoffe
answers.text: One cubic yard of any dry or wet material is twenty seven cubic feet.

questions.question: "How many bags does it take for 1 cubic yard?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Donti
answers.text: A cubic yard = 27 cu ft; Cubic is 3 times each side and a Yard = 3 ft. so Cubic Yard = 3 x 3 x 3 = 27 cu ft This bag of Mulch is equal to 2 cu ft. so the number of bags of this mulch to equal a Cubic yard is = 27 cu ft divided by 2 cu ft = 13. 5 bags or 14 bags.

answers.author: dt63944
answers.text: 1 cubic yard = 3*3*3=27 cubic feet, therefore 27/2=13.5 bags

answers.author: Maestro
answers.text: 13 and 1/2 bags

answers.author: Sta-Green Team
answers.text: 1 cubic yard equals 13.5 bags of mulch. Thanks!

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Five bags would be sufficient for one cubic yard of mulch.

answers.author: gary
answers.text: The other answers say between 40 and 75 bags, or the count varies

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: You would need about 60-65 bags for one skid.

answers.author: BobbbyT
answers.text: I ordered 20 bags and it was approx. 1/2 of the skid. 40 bags would be a accurate guess.

questions.question: "How many bags needed for 450 square feet 2 inches deep"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Donti
answers.text: 450 sq ft times 2 inches deep = 450 sq ft x 2/12 ft = 74.99 cu ft or 75 cu ft. Each bag is 2 cu ft so 75 / 2 = 37.5 bags or 38 bags

answers.author: Slacking02
answers.text: One bag will cover 12 square feet at 2 inches deep. This is listed under the specifications tab on the product page.

answers.author: Hextall
answers.text: There is a mulch calculator on lowes.com. Just use the onsite seach bar and search 'mulch calculator'.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: It would take about 38 bags.

answers.author: Sta-Green Team
answers.text: One would need approximately 38 bags to cover 450 square feet at 2 inches deep. Each bag covers 12SQ FT.

questions.question: "how do you calculate how much mulch"
questions.author: frogger

answers.author: bgill85
answers.text: I guessed, started out with 5 bags and went back to get 5 more and that was about right, but I don't have a massive area, my propertyt is 5500 sq ft but the landscape areas are smaller cutouts, see photos.

answers.author: Jimbo
answers.text: Lowes has a calculator that you can use - the big question is what is your puropose of the mulch, looks or weed control. Weed control for wood chips needs 3 inches - looks - enough to cover - 1 inch or so.

answers.author: GrammyPammy
answers.text: For a heavy application of mulch (which I recommend to keep the weeds down) I use the width & length of the bag - one bag covers the size of the bag. Too much is better than too little.

answers.author: robertdustoffe
answers.text: Depends on the coverage thickness.--each bag has two cubic feet of product. @ 6" thick it would cover 4 sq. ft. @ 3" thick it would cover 8 sq. ft. @ 1" thick it would cover 24 sq. ft Get the drift?

answers.author: DrJ3055
answers.text: First measure the square feet of area to cover. The look on the bag, there will be a coverage scale. This scale will tell you how many bags are needed for how many square feet you have to cover.
